name: An Oasis in the City
summary: Very central to the city which can be reached by an easy walk or by bus, with transport at the door, if required, and all amenities within easy reach.
space: Potts Pt. is a vibrant  and popular inner-city suburb & the area was described as 'Australia's Bohemian Heart' in the article by Raymond Bonner in the New York Times . Ultra-convenient & within walking distance of the central business district  & all tourist sites such as:  the Botanic Gardens,  Opera House,  NSW Art Gallery,  Australian Museum,   Circular Quay, the Sydney Opera House, and BridgeClimb Darling Harbour Museum of Contemporary Art Art Gallery of NSW Sydney Museum Hyde Park Botanic Gardens Chinatown, Paddy's Markets, and the Chinese Gardens Paddington (& the Saturday markets) The historic Rocks area (& the markets on Saturday & Sunday) It is 7 minutes walk to the Kings Cross.train (Metro) station & buses to the beaches .  Bus to/from city leaves from across the road (and it takes about 15-20 minutes to walk to Circular  Quay and the Opera House). The bus  to Chinatown leaves from in front of the building. Restaurants, coffee shops & supermarket are 2 minutes up the road. .

neighborhood_overview: It is very close to everything and everywhere, has  many trees along the streets and is in a beautiful part of the city
notes: $150.00 key security deposit, refundable on return of  rhe keys.    The Supermarket, 100 metres up the road, is open until midnight and has free wifi and the  Library is 10 minutes up the road and has free WiFi, as do many cafes etc. On Sunday travel on the Opal travel card (covering buses, trains and ferries) costs a maximum of $2.50, a great bargain.
transit: It is 7 minutes walk to the Kings Cross.train (Metro) station & buses to the beaches .  Bus to/from city leaves from across the road (and it takes about 20 minutes to walk to Circular  Quay and the Opera House). The bus  to Chinatown leaves from in front of the building.
access: Kitchen & laundry facilities.   Shared bathroom.
interaction: As much as they want.
house_rules: Be considerate.   No showering after 2330h.
host_location: Potts Point, New South Wales, Australia
host_about: Recently retired, I've lived & worked on 4 continents & over the years have travelled thru about 50 countries. I live in inner-Sydney within walking distance of most places (except the beaches, which are approx. 30 minutes. away on public transport).  Interests are travelling, wildlife, reading,snorkelling, theatre, ballet & interesting food.

name: Sydney City & Harbour at the door
summary: Come stay with Vinh & Stuart (Awarded as one of Australia's top hosts by Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky & key shareholder Ashton Kutcher. We're Sydney's #1 reviewed hosts too). Find out why we've been positively reviewed 500+ times. Message us and talk first BEFORE you make any reservation request - And please read our listing to the end (hint hint). Everything you need to know is there.
space: We're pretty relaxed hosts, and we fully appreciate staying with someone else, in their home home, is not for every-one. This is not a business, or a hotel. We're casual Airbnb hosts, not hoteliers. If you're just looking for an alternative to an expensive hotel, then we're not for you. Here you'll be treated in the same way we treat family & friends when they stay. So... no fluffy bathrobes... Please say hello and message us *BEFORE* you make your reservation request... It'll help speed things up, and smooth things out... Please read our listing all the way to the end. It will make getting a confirmed reservation so much easier :) See below (hint hint) --  G'Day from Vinh & Stuart in Sydney! Thanks for coming to check out our listing :) We have another btw... http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/73639 if this one is unavailable "Sydney City Home with Harbour Views"; our spare room in the attic. Your room: * Private bedroom (with a lockable door) * Queen size bed * All linen, pillows, blankets,

neighborhood_overview: Pyrmont is an inner-city village of Sydney, only about 2kms from the Sydney CBD (Central Business District) / Core, right next door to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. https://www.airbnb.com.au/locations/sydney/pyrmont Pyrmont has a relaxed community feel with an inner city vibe. Pyrmont is only about 2kms (10 - 15 mins walk) from the centre of Sydney with an extensive range of local restaurants, wine bars, and pubs. There's some seriously good baristas and cafes right close to our home (Go and say hi to Damien & Tim at Bar Zini - it's one of our local faves). There's five star fine dining right through to greasy-spoon takeaways with some of Australia's finest dining restaurants within easy reach. * Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay * Exhibition and Convention Centres * Sydney Fish Markets * Pyrama Point Park * Jones Bay Wharf * The Star (Casino) with Food Halls, Bars, and the Lyric Theatre * Powerhouse Museum * National Maritime Museum Also (back on the food - notice a theme?): * Two groce
notes: We've a few reasons for the 6.00pm arrival time / check in / bag drop time... One of them is that we're really flexible with check out times. :) While we do work from home, we don't particularly want to broadcast on the internet if we are away from home. That's why our arrival time is always listed as 6pm. Our "check in" / "arrival time" / "bag drop" is all the same thing. It's not like we're a hotel with a team of porters waiting to take your bags any time of the day or night whether we're at home or not. So, if we haven't agreed some alternate arrangements, then we look forward to welcoming you to our home at 6.00pm. While we may be able to arrange some arrival times / bag drops / check ins earlier, we do need to make those arrangements well in advance. So if the 6.00pm check in time isn't your preference, please talk to us about it *before* you make your reservation. :)
transit: Our home is centrally located and an easy walk to everywhere (everywhere you want to go anyways). We also have easy access to trams (light-rail), trains, and ferries which are all conveniently a few minutes walk away. Transport options are great:  There's a bus, the 389, pretty much at our doorstep every 10 minutes. It goes into the City Centre, into Paddington, all the way to Bondi Beach and on to North Bondi - Doesn't get better than that! Trams ("light-rail") every 12 minutes. - Central Station, Fish Markets, The Star, Chinatown, Glebe - Central to Dulwich Hill. Ferries from Pyrmont Bay, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay are a great way to explore. Trains from Town Hall, Central, and Wynyard. A main Sydney City (Town Hall) train station is only 10-15 minutes walk away. Central Station is 15 - 20 minutes walk (5 mins by bus or tram). Airports: The international and Domestic airports are only about 15 - 20 minutes drive away (longer during traffic peaks), again, all easily accessible
access: We look forward to welcoming you just as we would welcome our family and friends. We'll provide you with a code for the door with easy (and secure) access, so you can come and go as you please. Any time. We work from home, so there's generally always someone around. Our house is your house - we are not a hotel, this is not a business. It is our home. We live here and we work from here too. So there's always something happening. If you love the arts, artists, and the creative industries, then this is the place in Sydney to be.
interaction: As much or as little as you like. We live here. This is our home.  We will be at home when you stay, and generally around & about if and when you need us.
house_rules: We look forward to welcoming you to stay you just as we would our family and friends. "Farm Gate Rules" - if a door is open, leave it open, if a door is closed, please leave it closed.  We'd ask that you'd please not eat in your room, or smoke inside the house. We've a kitchen and dining room for meals (and of course, feel free to use the fridge) and a sheltered, undercover area outside that you're more than welcome to use if you smoke. We tend to work from home, meet clients in our home office, and work by phone too. So this means that our home would be better suited to guests wanting to be out sightseeing during the day, rather than spending the days inside. (But why would you want to stay inside all day when there's so much to see and do anyway?) Every experience we've ever had with Airbnb has been a positive one. Whether we've been hosting, or staying as guests, we've met kind & considerate people, had interesting conversations, and made great new acquaintances & friends. We don't
host_about:
G'Day from Australia!

He's Vinh, and I'm Stuart...

We're big fans of AirBnB for nearly a decade having used it when traveling in the USA not long after AirBnB first started.

Since then we've enjoyed traveling with AirBnB across the US, around Australia, in Hong Kong, and also in Vietnam. We're also hosts.

As guests we're always out & about most of the time and won't be intruding too much.

We're neat & tidy and vibrant conversationalists...

We operate ArtSHINE industries - Australia’s independent Creative Industries Enterprise Acceleration Platform + Launch Pad identifying, advancing, and funding commercially minded and innovative Creative Industries Professionals who focus on art, craft, artisanal making, design, fashion, entertainment, photography, music, writing, film & television, digital technology, and games & interactive content. ArtSHINE also incorporates a coffeehouse and coworking space; CoSydney CoWorking + Project Space, in the City of Sydney’s Chippendale Creative Precinct.

So here's an open invitation to come check us out.

My partner Vinh is a keen traveler who works a lot with artists and designers in his coaching practice. He's the energetic, vibrant one...

I lived in Bolivia for a year as a young man just out of school and have worked in social enterprises and not for profits over the years. I'm the more serious, bookish one (with a wicked sense of humour though). Currently working in financial services too...

One of the things we're keen to do is catch up with some social entrepreneurs, coworkers, not for profits, and microfinanciers.

We're particularly interested social enterprise, coworking, and small business incubators & mentoring projects.

More that happy to answer any questions that you may have.

All the best,

Vinh & Stuart
Australia

name: Manly Harbour House
summary: Beautifully renovated, spacious and quiet, our 3 Bedroom, 3 Bathroom home is only a  10 minute walk to beaches in Fairlight or Forty Baskets,  or a 30 minute walk to Manly via the coastal promenade, or an Express bus runs every 20 mins at your door.
space: Our home is a thirty minute walk along the seashore promenade to Manly, one of Sydney's most beautiful beaches, with its village restaurants, cafes, and shopping.  If you prefer more variety, the Manly ferry will take you to the Sydney CBD in 15 minutes.   The residence is sited in a sought-after family-friendly street only a short stroll to nearby North Harbour reserve and Forty Baskets cafe and beach. It's a short walk further to express CBD buses, ferries, and Manly entertainment. Or there is a bus (#131 or #132) around the corner that drops you in Manly in 8 minutes.  Our home features a stainless steel galley kitchen, including Ilve oven and gas cooktop. We have two separate living areas on the ground floor. The front lounge enjoys P&O window surrounds with a fireplace, Grand piano and wall mounted TV.  The separate family/ dining room at the rear has two long white leather lounge sofas and a 65” wall mounted TV. The dining room table extends to seat 8 comfortably.  There is a cov

neighborhood_overview: Balgowlah Heights is one of the most prestigious areas on the Northern Beaches.  Filled with seaside character and a boutique way of living, this suburb offers everything you could need.   Located approximately 11km from the CBD, and only 2 kms from Manly, Balgowlah is surrounded by pristine water frontage including North Harbour, Forty Baskets, and Sydney Harbour.  Filled with a vast array of public parks, pools, marinas, beaches, sporting facilities and Sydney Harbour National Park. Local Amenities •Forty Baskets Beach, Reef Beach, North Harbour Park, 40 Beans Cafe, Clontarf Beach, Castle Rock. •Nearby Spit to Manly walking track that leads left along the promenade to Manly or right through scenic Sydney Harbour National Park around to Clontarf. •Balgowlah Heights shops, offering a supermarket, delicatessen, boutique shops, cafes and more •Nearby Stockland Mall offers a vast range of cafes, supermarkets, eateries, boutique fashion stores, home wares shops and Fitness First Gym •Array
transit: Balgowlah - Manly bus # 131 or #132  (Bus stop is 3 doors down, around the corner) takes you to Manly Ferry in 8 minutes.  Manly ferry gets you to Sydney CBD in 15 minutes.
access: Guests have access to whole house except locked basement and storage room. (Rear ground level studio not included.)
house_rules: Standard Terms and Conditions of Temporary Holiday Accommodation Note: Variances can be agreed on but only by arrangement with the owner in writing. Payment of booking constitutes the clients acceptance of these Terms and Conditions. Balance of the rental amount must be received in full according to AIRBNB policies. If not the owner has the right to cancel the booking and attempt to re let it. The owners will make every effort to ensure the property is available as booked. However the owners reserve the right to make alterations to bookings due to unforeseen circumstances. To maintain a good standard for our guests we require certain conditions to be complied with. We appreciate most will respect our property but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following conditions. Number of Guests should not exceed 6 adults or subsequently agreed in writing or email, and no more than 8 people in the house at one time. Fees will apply for excess guests not agreed with the owners in adv
host_about: I am a Canadian who has made Australia her home for over ten years. I appreciate a good place to stay, having had many travel adventures myself.  My home is in Balgowlah, a pretty harbourside village next to Manly with easy access by bus or ferry to Sydney CBD.

name: Unique Designer Rooftop Apartment in City Location
summary: Penthouse living at it best ... You will be staying in a unique apartment on the top floor of a centrally located boutique building.  As the apartment is spread over 2 levels guests have a high level of privacy and security. The room has its own bathroom, balcony, fridge, coffee station and the whole apartment is furnished to a luxury standard in a contemporary designer style with all mod cons.  Location is one of the best in the city with easy walking to everything you may need.
space: A charming two-level, two-bedroom, two-bathroom duplex apartment on the border of East Sydney, Darlinghurst and Kings Cross with everything that Sydney has to offer within easy walking distance: Sydney CBD 10mins, Hyde Park 5 mins, Oxford St 10 mins, Kings Cross 5mins  The apartment is spacious, elegantly decorated in a modern contemporary style and very well equipped with all mod cons. This is an older style apartment with character and charm. It is not all shiny and new.  The room is situated on the lower floor, it is a spacious bedroom with large built-in robes, own fridge and tea and coffee station, a comfortable large queen bed with quality linen and its own cute balcony. Next to the bedroom is an exclusive use bathroom with large walk-in shower. The main living/dining area is also on this floor; it is a bright warm space, stylishly furnished with an eclectic fusion of art work and mementos. Off the main living space is another balcony that has a charming view and surrounded in tr

As the apartment is spread over 2 levels guests have a high level of privacy and security. The room has its own bathroom, balcony, fridge, coffee station and the whole apartment is furnished to a luxury standard in a contemporary designer style with all mod cons.  Location is one of the best in the city with easy walking to everything you may need. A charming two-level, two-bedroom, two-bathroom duplex apartment on the border of East Sydney, Darlinghurst and Kings Cross with everything that Sydney has to offer within easy walking distance: Sydney CBD 10mins, Hyde Park 5 mins, Oxford St 10 mins, Kings Cross 5mins  The apartment is spacious, elegantly decorated in a modern contemporary style and very well equipped with all mod cons. This is an older style apartment with character and charm. It is not all shiny and new.  The room is situated on the lower fl
neighborhood_overview: The location is really central and there is number of things to do and see all within a few kilometres; Stanley St (Sydney’s little Italy) is just around the corner which has some great restaurants and a real European feel. Darlinghurst is wall to wall of cafes, bars and restaurants to suite all tastes and budgets. Woolloomooloo marina is at the bottom of the hill with its ritzy restaurants and famous residents (Russell Crow has the penthouse at end of wharf) it is beautiful to hang out on a nice evening. The Australian Museum and The Art Gallery of NSW have both interesting exhibitions and evening events, The Bridge can be seen from my corner and the Opera House is a pleasant stroll through the Botanical Gardens and Domain. Chinatown and Darling Harbour are just at the back of the CBD and Sydney colourful nightlife of both Kings Cross & Oxford St are on your doorstep.  I also have lots of more information on things to do while in Sydney just ask me.  On booking you will receive my hou
notes: The apartment is on the top floor with 4 flights of stairs to walk and there is NO lift, it is great for working out your legs but not really suitable for anyone with mobility/fitness challenges, also the apartment is not suitable for a young child.  If you want to want more information or have a burning question please message me and I will endeavour to come back to you within 24hrs.
transit: If walking is not your thing I am well serviced for public transport with a bus stop almost outside of door that takes you into the CBD and beyond and Bondi Beach in the other direction. The Town Hall train station is a comfortable walk and this station is one of the main connector stations for all lines, plus the airport is a quick 20mins away by cab or the Airport Shuttle bus which picks up outside my door.
access: Guests have own key and access to use facilities of apartment including Roof Terrace.
interaction: You would be staying with me and my very cute, house trained small dog Charlie he is a 15 years old Pomeranian, does not shed and is very friendly.  I am originally Scottish and have made Sydney my home for the last 20 years; I am well travelled, enjoy meeting new people and exploring new places I am open-minded, have respect for all people, value differences, respect my guest's privacy and look for the same understanding in return.  I am no longer a youngster but still young at heart and enjoy going out and experience all the great restaurants, bars, clubs and events that Sydney has to offer. I do entertain at home sometimes but would not describe this as a 'party house'.  I do have a demanding career, work long hours, plus manage my Airbnb properties, have Charlie and active social life and at times my guests may never see much of me.  If you are looking to have "The whole Airbnb experience" of spending time with your host/ concierge service/ family meal-type experience this is not t
house_rules: I am fairly easygoing and will try to accomodate guests reasonable requests.  I ask that guest treat my home with respect.  No Smoking inside of Apartment  No additional overnight guests.
host_about:
I am originally Scottish but I have made Sydney my home for the last 20 years, I  love the city and the country and would not live anywhere else. I am well-travelled, I enjoy seeing new things, having new experiences, challenging myself and meeting new people.
I work for myself in the corporate work, which can mean I have long days and I may not be around much Mon to Fri. I have a work hard, play hard attitude and have a varied social life, lots of different groups of friends, always doing something.   I am open-minded and value peoples differences, though I hate the term, this is a GLBTQ friendly house. 
I would describe myself as a bit of a "foodie";  host dinner parties/ soirees, I eat out and I travel for food. I enjoy the finer things in life, nice surroundings, beautiful clothes/ shoes/handbags, fine wine etc. I love shopping for the unusual from markets to tucked-away little shops, designer sample sales to high-end boutiques. I am creative, collect contemporary art and enjoy the creative arts.  
I also have a little dog, Charlie he is a 15yr old Pomeranian that I have had since he was a puppy, he can get a little excitable but generally is friendly and very cute.  
My life's motto is "Be the best version of you" & " I can do that"

name: Sunny Darlinghurst Warehouse Apartment
summary: Sunny warehouse/loft apartment in the heart of one of Sydney's best neighbourhoods. Located on the corner of two iconic Darlinghurst streets famous for laneway bars and eateries, and just footsteps to equally amazing Surry Hills and Potts Point. Walk through beautiful parks to the city in less than 10 mins, the opera house in 20 and access Bondi Beach easily via the bus stop directly in front of the building.
space: My apartment is a beautiful, simple, open plan / one bedroom loft with soaring high ceilings and hardwood floors that hint at it's previous life as a printing factory in the 1940s. It has huge windows that flood the space with glorious sunshine throughout the day and provide a refreshing breeze during summer.  A few key features: * Wireless harman/kardon aura stereo system so you can stream your music wirelessly from any bluetooth device * Internal laundry with washer and dryer * The kitchen is equipped with gas cooking, microwave, a dishwasher and the basics for preparing meals at home * All the essentials are included (so you can travel light): fresh towels, sheets and a hair dryer  * There is no traditional TV but instead there is a smart projector (complete with built in TV function and apps including Netflix) for a home cinema experience Feel free to drop me a line and ask any questions.
description: Sunny warehouse/loft apartment in the heart of one of Sydney's best neighbourhoods. Located on the corner of two iconic Darlinghurst streets famous for laneway bars and eateries, and just footsteps to equally amazing Surry Hills and Potts Point. Walk through beautiful parks to the city in less than 10 mins, the opera house in 20 and access Bondi Beach easily via the bus stop directly in front of the building. My apartment is a beautiful, simple, open plan / one bedroom loft with soaring high ceilings and hardwood floors that hint at it's previous life as a printing factory in the 1940s. It has huge windows that flood the space with glorious sunshine throughout the day and provide a refreshing breeze during summer.  A few key features: * Wireless harman/kardon aura stereo system so you can stream your music wirelessly from any bluetooth device * Internal laundry with washer and dryer * The kitchen is equipped with gas cooking, microwave, a dishwasher and the basics for preparing meals a
neighborhood_overview: Darlinghurst is home to some of Sydney's best restaurants, coffee and designers. The apartment is located on the corner of two iconic streets (Crown St and Stanley St) - famous for eateries, bars, boutiques and galleries. It's also a very short walk through beautiful Hyde Park to the centre of Sydney city and is an easy stroll to many other awesome neighbourhoods, including the creative precincts of Surry Hills and Potts Point. With galleries, museums,  the Royal Botanic Gardens and other harbour side parks (even the Opera House!) all within walking distance, the apartment really offers the ideal base to explore from. A few location highlights: * There are many fantastic restaurants and cafes located on the same street as the apartment - literally footsteps from the front door * Some of Sydney's coolest wine and cocktail bars are hidden in the laneways surrounding the apartment building, including Love Tilly Devine, Shady Pines and more...you won't need to budget for cabs when you are
notes: I am the owner of this property, so you can be assured that it is not being sub-let. The apartment is clean, functional and furnished with stylish pieces and contemporary artwork. But it is not new and is therefore priced to reflect what it is. While Darlinghurst is one of Sydney's more bustling neighbourhoods, the apartment is located at the rear of the building and so enjoys a relatively quiet position. Once in a while my neighbour's might have a weekend party. As this is my home, I have some of my belongings in the space, however the wardrobe is clear for you to hang your clothes and make yourself feel at home. The air-conditioner is a portable unit, and so is really intended for extreme weather and should not be used continually. As light sleepers may find it too loud there is also a quiet fan in the bedroom for hot nights. GUEST REQUIREMENTS I request all guests verify their identity with Airbnb's offline ID verification process. It is really quick and easy to do! See airbnb.com/v
transit: With many eateries, bars and attractions all within walking distance, most guests find they don't require a car and rarely resort to taxis.  There are plenty of public transport options that make exploring further afield very easy. The apartment is a short (7 minute) walk from Museum and Kings Cross train stations, offering directly access the airport and wider Sydney (as many different lines pass through these two stations). There is also a bus stop directly in front of the apartment that provides quick and direct access to Circular Quay / the Opera House (this is also a walkable distance) and Bondi Beach. The Central Business District is easily accessed on foot through Hyde Park in 5-10minutes. THERE IS NO ON-SITE PARKING. You have 3 other options: 1/ street parking - most street parking in the area is timed during the day, and free between 10 pm and 8 am the next day.   2/ There is a Wilson Car Park just down the road with a  flat rate on Saturday and Sunday (check out prices on the
access: The whole apartment is yours to enjoy!  Check-in from 2pm / Check-out by 11am* * Depending on whether there is another guest checking in or out the same day, I can be flexible about check-in/out times. NOTE: very late or early check-ins (i.e. between 21:00 and 05:00) may attract an additional fee.
interaction: Depending on the time of arrival, I will either meet guests in person or provide access via a a check-in service called Key Ninja. All guests must show identification when exchanging keys. Once checked-in, I leave guests to make themselves at home but am just a txt/phone call away and always happy to share tips on local places to eat / drink / explore.
house_rules: I kindly request you treat my apartment, my neighbours and the environment with respect and care by following these rules: - No smoking. Not anywhere in the apartment. Not even out of the window.  - No parties. This means, no big groups of visitors in the apartment and no more than two adults are permitted to sleep in the apartment.  - Keep music and noise to a minimum. No sound should be audible from outside of the apartment between 10pm - 7.30am Sunday through to Thursday inclusive, and 11pm - 8am Friday and Saturday evenings. Remember that the apartment is located in a residential apartment block and my neighbours are probably not on holiday! - Please clean up any mess promptly. This means if you spill something: wipe it up. Keep food stored away and wash dishes daily to prevent any crawling visitors. - Dispose of rubbish promptly (the garbage room is on the ground floor). - If you find something is broken, or you accidentally break something, please notify me so that I can arrange
host_about: Curious about the world and full of wanderlust. I am both an airbnb host and traveller. By day I work as a junior doctor and rent out my inner Sydney city loft when traveling myself for work or holidays. I love that this allows me to help share our beautiful harbour city with guests from all over the world.  As a traveller, I seek out experiences that offer me a glimpse into what local life is like in the places I visit.

name: Right on Bondi Beach, but so quiet! A real haven!
summary: A stone's throw to Bondi Beach. Right in amongst the action yet on a quiet residential street. This spacious, FIVE BEDROOM beach house is the perfect spot to stay in Bondi Beach with a family or larger group. Walk to the ocean in 2 minutes for your morning swim. Wake up early and enjoy the most amazing sunrise. Equipped with everything you need, and perched by the world's most famous beach. Breakfast cafés, bars, amazing restaurants a lazy stroll across the street. Welcome home :)
space: Whether you’re an active morning person, a sleep-in-and-enjoy-the-sun person, or an explore the nightlife kind of person, iconic Bondi has everything, all within walking distance. This great property has easy on-foot access to everything Bondi has to offer- the beach, excellent cafes, shops, boutiques, markets, and public transport (including two bus routes, direct to the CBD). The large, comfortable home is fully furnished and self contained, and boasts 5 bedrooms across two floors, with space to sleep up to 11 people!     Master Bedroom with queen bed and king single sofa bed + en suite bathroom.     Three bedrooms with queen size beds     One bedroom with 2 single beds. Not to mention the huge open plan kitchen, dining, and lounge areas, which open onto a sunny backyard, great for entertaining in the evenings, a space for the kids to play while you relax, or just popping home for lunch after a swim! There are also the two off street parking spots so you don’t have to worry about get

access: Exclusive access to the whole place with keys in the secret lockbox. So you don't need to take the keys with you, if you don't want to. And any one of your group can come home anytime using the lockbox.
house_rules: No parties unless agreed with House Management (Bondi Beach is a densely populated suburb and neighbours must be respected). No groups of under 30 year olds can book. No smoking inside (outside is fine).
host_about:
I have had a holiday rental business, Ruby's Holiday Residences, for 13 years now. I feel like I am running my own private hotel, but the rooms are just spread out over many sites!
I love to travel (my friends call me a gypsy!) and spend my year between Sydney, London and Nice. I run my business from anywhere. But it's work everyday in this industry! No rest for the wicked!
Travel, food, cinema, more travel and more food are my passions. I love all things French, so any travel in France, French food or cinema are my favourites.

name: BONDI BEACHFRONT CENTRAL LOCATION
summary: This large, light-filled and artistically decorated older style one-bedroom apartment is in the best position in Bondi. Directly opposite the beach . Cafes and buses at the door. Its perfect for guests wanting to experience the heart of Bondi with all its cafes, natural beauty (views) and social activities. This apartment is a real gem and has unprecedented views and decor.
space: BONDI BEACHFRONT BOHEMIAN APARTMENT Why stay at Ravesis? Half the price and twice the size. Same position only larger, and more comfortable. Beautiful older-style  Parisian style apartment overlooking Bondi Beach, steps to sand. Staying at this apartment is an experience.  Ideal for couples, executives and creatives. High ceilings, polished floorboards,piano, lots of natural light. Suited to guests who appreciate an artistically decorated space. The main living area is large, light, airy (has ceiling fans) , loads of room and has breathtaking views. The kitchenette is attached to the main living room and is fully equipped with dishwasher, fridge, food blender, and crockery and cutlery.The bedroom is large with plenty of cupboard space, also has ceiling fans and a cupboard full of lovely white linen. The bathroom is compact but still manages to provide you with a bath (half-bath) - not just a shower as in many apartments. Situated on Bondi's main shopping strip amongst cafes, bars and p

neighborhood_overview: The most exciting and entertaining neighborhood in Sydney. Cafes, restaurants, beach, sea-pool, surfing, designer shopping, organic cuisine. Lots of eye-candy! No need to leave this suburb - its all here.
notes: Large ceiling fans rather than air conditioning make for an airy, healthy environment. A half bath as well as shower makes for a more comfortable option. High ceilings give the feeling of space and airiness. A piano and collection of good books plus a view to die for. I have had a few guests mention noise levels from temporary occurences. These are all temporary and to be expected from such a thriving, holiday-vibe locality. Nothing is permanent here - its continually changing. Its a cosmopolitan environment. There has been mention of damaged window frames due to the beach . This does not affect the ambience.
transit: Buses and taxis right at the door, so plentiful there's often no need to book them. Across the road from the famous Icebergs where you can swim by day and dine exclusively by night. Amazing ocean walks to Tamarama and Bronte.
access: Entire apartment, plenty of  cupboard space. Direct ocean views.
interaction: I prefer to meet with the guests on arrival. If I am away I will have a friend welcome the guests.  I am on call for any requirements or problems.
house_rules: no smoking or pets , and maximum of two people.
host_about: I take great pleasure in hosting airbnb guests from all over the world in my lovely apartment.I am an artist and photographer with a love for meeting new people, I have a great collection of books and have made the apartment to be an experience.

name: Studio Yindi @ Mosman, Sydney
summary: An open plan apartment, which opens onto a spacious garden.  Self-contained, bathroom, 1 double bedroom, plus 2 single beds in the open plan area.  Mosman is a smart Sydney suburb, the harbour on 3 sides, 15 - 18 minutes  from city centre by bus route 243.
space: Studio Yindi is a self-contained open plan studio apartment on Level 1, which opens onto a spacious garden.  It includes bathroom, and a fully equipped basic but practical kitchen for self-catering.    There is 1 Queen size double bed in a separate bedroom.   The 2 single beds are in a screened area, that is part of the large open plan area.   The beds can be moved around in the open plan space to meet the needs of your group, for acoustic or visual privacy that best suits you.   We recently installed a second gas space heater that quickly makes the Studio snug after you come home from a long day touristing or working in the winter. ACCESS CONSIDERATIONS Please be aware that the Studio is at the rear of of our house,  which you access via a path down the left side of our house.  There is about 6 steps at irregular spacing down the pathway.   There is one step into the Studio, then 2 more steps between the living area and the kitchen/dining and sleeping areas. Finally the bathroom is 2
description: An open plan apartment, which opens onto a spacious garden.  Self-contained, bathroom, 1 double bedroom, plus 2 single beds in the open plan area.  Mosman is a smart Sydney suburb, the harbour on 3 sides, 15 - 18 minutes  from city centre by bus route 243. Studio Yindi is a self-contained open plan studio apartment on Level 1, which opens onto a spacious garden.  It includes bathroom, and a fully equipped basic but practical kitchen for self-catering.    There is 1 Queen size double bed in a separate bedroom.   The 2 single beds are in a screened area, that is part of the large open plan area. ACCESS CONSIDERATIONS Please be aware that the Studio is at the rear of of our house,  which you acces
neighborhood_overview: Mosman is a smart, middle to upper class suburb on Sydney's lower north shore, with Sydney Harbour on 3 sides. Mosman shopping centre has a village feel that makes it popular for fashion and food shoppers from all over Sydney.  There is lots of natural bush and wildlife in Mosman - the kookaburras and lorikeets are guaranteed to give you a noisy brilliant early morning dawn chorus in the summer time!  Our location is convenient for a harbour edge walk to Manly, and visiting Sydney's famous Taronga Zoo. Studio Yindi is a great base for seeing Sydney in detail.  The hosts are regular oversees travellers themselves, and we enjoy the variety, surprise and informality of AirBnB accommodation. There are lots of interesting cafes and restaurants within 10 minutes drive, many of which will also home deliver.
notes: STANDARD OF ACCOMMODATION We pride ourselves on providing clean, comfortable accommodation, that represents excellent value for money.   We present Studio Yindi as the type of space we look for when we are travelling nationally or internationally ourselves.  If we can find places to stay that are excellent value for money then it means we can spend longer travelling for the same budget amount! If you are comfortable with comfortable but sometimes recycled furniture and Ikea style kitchen equipment, and do not expect an apartment styled ready to be published in a trendy home magazine, then you will feel very much at home.   But if you are expecting a 5 star hotel standard of accommodation then you will probably be more comfortable staying at a much more expensive Airbnb site,  or a 5 star hotel in the city centre.
transit: GETTING TO STUDIO YINDI Upon confirming your booking we will provide you with the address and detailed instructions for reaching us by, car, taxi or public transport. We are within 5 minutes walk of the junction of Countess Park, Countess St, Mosman NSW 2088 Australia if you want to look up our location online. PUBLIC TRANSPORT TO/FROM STUDIO YINDI  Bus to Sydney city centre: 243, 2 minutes to bus stop & 18 minute trip.  Cost about $3.50 Bus to Mosman, Spit Junction: route 243, 2 minutes to bus stop & 5 minute trip. Bus to Taronga Zoo: 10 min. walk to stop on Military Rd then take route 247. Bus to Balmoral Beach: 10 minute walk to stop on Military Rd. Bus to Manly Beach: 10 minute walk to stop on Military Rd, then route 143 or 144 Buses to northern beaches: 10 minute walk to stop on Military Rd. Taxi to/from Sydney airport: 18 km, 25 minute cab ride costing about A$75 - $80 Distance to city centre: 7 km, 15 minute cab ride costing about A$25 Quite a few guests use Uber to get around S
access: Studio Yindi is fully self-contained,  with it's own entrance door.   There is a key safe at the entrance door, so guests can arrive and depart independently, without needing to disturb the host and family who live upstairs in the same building.
interaction: We are happy to help guests with as much information as they need for an enjoyable tourist experience of Sydney.    We sometimes share a bottle of wine or a cup of tea/coffee with guests who have time to socialise.   Other guests are on a tight schedule of things to do, including weddings or conferences to attend so we hardly see them. We love having families stay with us.   Children who are into skateboarding will love the sloping chicane course offered by the street where we live.  2 boys from Sweden got very involved with the local skate board mob, and were still in contact with the skateboard mates years after they went home to Stockholm. Soccer, Aussie Rules football, or even cricket is often played by local children on our street,  which has very little through traffic.  But obviously children need to be supervised by their parents when they are playing on the street.
house_rules: Studio Yindi is located in a very quiet suburban area. We value highly the implied support we have from our neighbours.  The most important thing you can do is to be quiet in the evening after 10 pm.   In particular do not stand outside chatting noisily to friends who may be arriving or leaving. After 10 pm please do not chat outside in the garden.  And please close all the sliding doors, so that any conversations you are having inside Studio Yindi are not heard by our immediate neighbours who are probably trying to sleep. This is not a space you want to rent for a bunch of male or female friends, who want to let their hair down and party! Simply treat our home the same way you would expect friends or strangers to treat your home when you have them as guests! The Studio is self-contained with its own entrance, so you can come and go quite independently. We are flexible about check-in times, and understand that many guests are flying into Sydney on flights that usually arrived between a
host_about:
Faber est suae quisquae fortunae

We became Airbnb.com hosts back in December 2010.   I was originally an architect, but worked in IT sales/marketing for the next 30+ years.  Semi-retired now,  I still manage consulting projects involving the Internet for small-medium businesses and some community based campaigns to promote better planning outcomes for the whole community, not just developers and their “top end of town” mates.

I call myself an Internet Architect on my business card these days.  Most of my current projects involve marketing using social media tools.

A born and bred Sydneysider, I lived in UK for 10 years till 1984.  I have done lots of travel in Europe, Turkey, Egypt, Jordan, Sri Lanka, Thailand, China, Vietnam, Japan, New Zealand, USA. 

Studio Yindi incorporates the things we look for when selecting boutique hotels, pensions, hostels and B&Bs for ourselves - space, privacy, wifi Internet access, reading light at the bedside, comfortable and practical for working while "on the road", a bit unusual, a little surprise, and value for money. 

My own preferences are for adventure and off the beaten track, rather than luxury, international 5 star. 

We love meeting travellers from all parts of the world, and helping them enjoy the experience of a first visit to Sydney.

We have lots of experience assisting overseas based friends and colleagues to see the best parts of Sydney, using public transport, and avoiding the expensive tourist services.

Messing about on boats is one of my passions. I have a 7.2 m (24') yacht moored nearby on the harbour and know a lot about the nice parts of our extensive waterways, including its part in Australian history.  I love sharing tips on how to see the best of the harbour, using inexpensive public ferries, plus strolls around Cremorne Point from Mosman Bay, or the 3 - 4 hour walk from the Spit to Manly, via Sydney Harbour National Park.

My major work project now is as a volunteer Director of the Keeping Place centre for aboriginal art, culture and history.  Our biggest challenge is finding a permanent physical home for 2000+ pieces of art and sculpture, plus 200,000+ photographs!

name: 2br Eclectic Stylish Home, 2 mins to Bondi Beach
summary: Two blocks to the beach, surf and coffee. Large stylish apartment with separate eat in kitchen, lounge and balcony for the perfect relaxed Bondi stay. Five minutes walk to main shopping area, 3 minutes to transport to city, and beyond. Great cooker and fully equipped kitchen to cook at home and close to lots of cafés. Enjoy!
space: Just 2 blocks from Bondi Beach and less to your morning coffee, this spacious apartment is on the first floor of a ninety-year old character block of four.  Plenty of cafes, supermarkets, shopping nearby and Bondi's main shopping precinct is less than 5 minutes walk away so you are right next to it but far enough away to ensure a quiet stay. Transport to the city and all of Sydney is less than 5 minutes away so you can have a beach holiday but also be in the city within 20 minutes. Accommodation consists of a massive master bedroom with queen bed and separate sun room with dedicated workspace, a second bedroom  with another queen size bed.  The large fully equipped eat in kitchen with dining table for 8 is at the rear of the apartment leading onto a balcony complete with hammock and another large outdoor dining area shaded by trees with district views.  The bathroom has a shower and full size bath. There is a separate lounge room with a long, large luxurious sofa and other reading and

neighborhood_overview: 3 minutes to the beach and cafes.  5 minutes to the main shopping and restaurants of Bondi Beach. Close enough to access it easily and far enough away for quiet. 15 minutes by car to the city. 5 minutes to Bondi Junction by car 15 by bus. And did I mention you can have a swim before breakfast and another after work most of the year.
notes: Sydney's a great city to visit. It has all the things cities offer and then there's all the things a holiday resort offers too.
transit: Buses and more buses to get you to Bondi Junction to trains that will take you anywhere in Sydney. And more buses direct to the city, and buses to the ferries which are one of Sydney's delights. Your day only gets better when you can take a ferry to wherever you are going be it work or play.
access: The entire flat, 2 bedrooms, kitchen, living room, balcony, bathroom
interaction: As much as feels best in the situation. Some people are more social others more private. I always try to be friendly and sensitive to who they are.
house_rules: Perfect for couples or families. Smoking only allowed on balcony This is an owner occupied building so no big/loud parties, please.  Respect for neighbours is very important. Only the registered house guests to stay please Enjoy!
host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I'm a designer. I have lived in many cities, countries and travelled to many more. I still travel frequently for work and pleasure. It's fantastic living here. In summer you can start and finish your day with a swim and in winter I love to walk or do yoga on the beach when its much less crowded. 

Sydney's a great place to visit with lots of great place for coffee, breakfast, dinner and/or drinks. There's always plenty to do with movies, galleries, theatre, dance, walks, yoga, kayaking, days away. I know Bondi and Sydney well so can recommend lots of great places so you can pack in as much as you can or do as little as you wish.

name: Large Garden Apartment in Bondi.
summary: Huge light and airy 2 bdrm flat with dining room and sunroom. Great views from all windows and typical Bondi ornate ceilings. 7 mins to the beach.  Best backyard in Bondi ! This is an old school Bondi block offering comfort not luxury. Will suit creative folk.  Prefer environmentally aware people-( no red meat please: chicken and fish are just fine.)   My personal belongings will remain in the flat with plenty of space provided for guests. On 2 bus routes: -3 blocks (7 mins) from Bondi Beach.
space: Large sunny apartment in funky 1930's huge Bondi duplex with dining room, 2 bdrms and private enclosed sunroom off the front bedroom. 3 blocks to the beach, 2 mins to bus stop to Bondi Junction.  Pleasant surrounds, enormous backyard, creative household. All bedding and towels, lovely kitchen, wireless internet, phone calls (mobile, local and interstate) and washing facilities. There are 3 living areas so plenty of privacy if it is for 2 couples. Rooms have queen sized beds and ornate ceilings.  Prefer people who leave a small footprint on the planet. email enquiries to (EMAIL HIDDEN)

neighborhood_overview: Bondi is a great place to holiday in. It has many tourists and back packers so sometimes you may need to speak with party goers. Failing that , Bondi Police are very supportive of noise complaints unless it is a hectic night.  I will leave a list of my favourite coffee shops, eateries, doctors, DVD shops, ice cream shops etc. I have a degree in Contemporary Music and Aboriginal Studies so I have a lot of Aboriginal artifacts around the flat. I will leave a list of interesting venues and places to visit if you share that interest.
notes: This flat will suit environmentally aware, music and art loving people.  I would prefer guests to not eat or cook red meat in the house- but failing that to be meticulous about cleaning all cooking utensils, crockery and cutlery. There is a BBQ available outside. Please show respect to the planet -if you are not using an electronic appliance, turn it off at the wall. We are a dry continent so please be careful with water.
transit: 3 Bus routes just around the corner. (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). Transport Info line is invaluable 131 500. Tell them where you are (closest cross streets)  and where you want to go and they will describe the best route to you detailing Bus numbers, bus stop numbers and scheduled times.
access: Entire apartment, kitchen, bathroom and massive backyard. Small piano room will be locked with most of my personal belongings in it.
interaction: I will be travelling , so all questions can be directed my manager.....(Number given on booking.)
house_rules: Enjoy yourself ! Clean up after yourself. Be thoughtful about red meat in the house - I prefer none ( chicken and fish are fine). No smoking in the house but back yard is fine. Socialising is fine but this is a no- party house. Please be considerate of neighbours. Leave a small footprint- conserve water, turn off all appliances when not in use. Almost close all windows before going out.
host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
My great garden flat will suit easy going tidy people. The household (upstairs and ) down stairs are musicians so would suit like minded people. I would prefer no red meat in the kitchen-(chicken and fish is fine) and there is a barbecue outside but willing to accept red meat if you clean thoroughly afterwards.
The apartment is huge and the rooms have a queen sized beds, so suitable for a couples or singles. There are sunrooms front and back. I have unlimited phone calls : local and national and mobile. 
Washing machine and internet included of course.
I am 3 blocks from the beach -(a 7 minute walk) and 2 minutes to a bus stop.

name: Comfort & space in the heart of Paddington
summary: If you're looking for something comfortable & conveniently close to everything, this is the place for you! The apartment is bright and sunny, and occupies the whole top floor of an art deco block in the heart of Paddington. Seconds from Oxford Street shops and the 5 ways (lots of cafes and bars and a brilliant local supermarket). Easy access to both the City/Surry Hills or Bondi in the other direction. Other highlights are the view to Rushcutters Bay and a large, landscaped private garden.
space: Large double bedroom with an adjoining sun room and desk, perfect for working travellers. The room is quiet and cool on hot summer nights, even though it's a short distance to all of Paddington's vibrant night life. Comfortable bedding & towels supplied, and there is plenty of wardrobe space. The sun room is populated with succulents and plants making it feel like your home away from home. If there are extra guests I have a double futon sofa bed in the lounge which is very comfortable. It is possible to have guests in the lounge area, but I don't make a habit of it. Send a request if you need to accomodate more than 2 people!
description: If you're looking for something comfortable & conveniently close to everything, this is the place for you! The apartment is bright and sunny, and occupies the whole top floor of an art deco block in the heart of Paddington. Seconds from Oxford Street shops and the 5 ways (lots of cafes and bars and a brilliant local supermarket). Easy access to both the City/Surry Hills or Bondi in the other direction. Other highlights are the view to Rushcutters Bay and a large, landscaped private garden. Large double bedroom with an adjoining sun room and desk, perfect for working travellers. If there are extra guests I have a double futon sofa bed in the lounge which is very comfortable. It is possible
transit: Oxford Street is at the top of the hill and there are buses that run east to the beaches and back into town. We're also very central and it's easy to walk most places!
access: Full access to the apartment and the shared private garden. There is a large, fully equiped kitchen and dining area, and you are welcome to have friends over for dinner etc, but no parties please. You will have your own set of keys while here.
interaction: I work fairly long hours but am around in the mornings and every other evening to offer advice on local attractions, restaurants and activities. If I'm home and cooking, I'll most likely invite you to join me for a meal :)

name: Gorgeous arty warehouse apartment
summary: The apartment is a converted wool storage warehouse which was converted in early 2000. It is in a historic area of Sydney which was home to many manufacturing companies. In recent times the apartment has been remodelled and redeveloped to take advantage of its location nearby education institutions and markets around the city.
space: Spacious furnished 2 bedroom apartment 110sqm with open plan living room and kitchen, fully equipped gas kitchen, master bedroom with ensuite and separate main bathroom with bathtub. Security carspace in building. This is a recently renovated warehouse conversion with security entrance. The apartment features lofty ceilings, dark bamboo flooring, original turpentine beams through the rooms adding beautiful features through the home. All modern facilities with fridge and dishwasher and microwave. The apartment is situated in Ultimo, a stone throw from the city and nearby cafes in Glebe and Newtown. Only a block away by walk to major shopping centres and a short walk to the Sydney Fish Markets and Paddy's weekend produce markets. Easy access to transport hubs, central station 10min by foot or a range of buses heading to most directions. Shopping and international restaurants all at your doorstep. Aimed for medium and long term tenants who would like the convenience of a fully furnished a

notes: There is some renovation occurring on the building and as such the balcony is out of bounds.
transit: We are only a stone throw from buses, trains and light rail to reach most parts of the city. You can use your Visa/MasterCard and American express to touch on to pay for public transport. An Uber from the airport will only cost $25 and takes about 25min.
interaction: I am easily able to be contacted and happy to give you privacy as well. if there are special needs or even some travel advice I'm happy to provide local insider tips.
house_rules: We love visitors to enjoy themselves when staying in my home. It's a lovely apartment for its proximity to major conveniences, shopping, cafes and markets. Great place for entertaining and please be mindful of noise in the apartment which can travel to any neighbours. If there are any problems with the place let me know and we can help out There are manuals for the appliances in the house. Please leave the place clean and tidy. Rubbish can be disposed of in the lower ground carpark at any time. We encourage recycling in our neighbourhood.

I love travel.
Originally from Sydney, have travelled extensively through southamerica, germany and southeast asia.
Currently working in organic art forms and medicine

name: Quiet base to explore Sydney
summary: We have a peaceful family home with a large garden, close to Sydney CBD. We are well travelled & enjoy meeting other travellers and as we know Sydney week, we can be useful helping you make the most of your visit to Sydney.
space: Hello!  We offer bed and breakfast in our family home, with large garden, in Sydney’s Inner West.  There is  a queen bedroom  with plenty room to take another single bed.  We can also provide a cot, high chair & baby bath. There is also the opportunity for separate bedrooms with a second bedroom available. We provide all bed linen, towels and breakfast (cereal/muesli, fresh fruit, toast, fruit juice and tea/coffee). Please let me know your preferences and any dietary issues. Other meals can be arranged at an additional cost. The house has WiFi internet access. The bathroom has a large bath with separate shower and toilet. Everything is in good working order with constant hot water. There is a separate laundry with another toilet & shower.  There is also a washing machine and line on which to dry clothes - in Sydney, clothes dry on the line in no time! Our house is a renovated traditional Californian bungalow with polished floorboards, lots of light & a large garden. We are very close t

interaction: As this is our family home, we are on hand for support.

We do not accept cards and please do not ask to book outside Airbnb. Please be clear with dates & the number of guests, when booking. Please do not invite other guests/friends without notice.
host_about:
We know Sydney well and can, if you like, help you plan and enjoy your visit! 

I prefer to reply to people with a profile attached & will give preference to previous Airbnb users with good references and those with good reviews advance in the queue. 

It's great to have Airbnb travellers who already have recommendations but, if you don't have an Airbnb profile when initially inquiring, please tell us a little about yourself/ves as I do through my profile and the photos of our home.

name: A little bit of Sydney - Australia
summary: PLEASE FIRST SEND AN EMAIL TO US BEFORE BOOKING ONLINE AS WE DO NOT ACCEPT AUTO BOOKINGS. Quiet area and a close drive to the cbd or out to the country.
space: Modern renovated home near central Sydney and close to Pennant Hills train station.  No additional price for second guest! We have a beautifully appointed rooms available within a 2 story 4 bedroom home. We are situated in historic Hills District in one of the most lovely forested suburbs near many parks and waterways. We are minutes drive away from local pubs, coffees, restaurants. We have two bedrooms with your own full private bathrooms. No extra charge for use of Free WiFi internet access,  printer/scanner use, and HD digital TV. Free parking is available. Perfect for single, couples, family or business executive. All bedrooms have their own LCD TV's for personal enjoyment. Koala Wild life park is only 2K away. The M60 bus runs in front of the house and you can take the Airport train to Pennant Hills station which is near the house. For those that drive we have lots of free street parking.  We are well traveled, interested in others and enjoy meeting people.  Full laundry facilitie

notes: We don't charge a cleaning fee and appreciate if you tidy up after as we provide everything that way. Your assistance is appreciated.
transit: A bus service to and from the local railway station runs from near our street. (about 200 metres away) Coming from the airport: Take the train from the airport to Central and change to a train to Pennant Hills (trains stopping at Pennant Hills will normally be marked as Hornsby trains via Macquarie Park and Epping). Exit the station to your right as you face the direction that the train is going. Cross the road on the pedestrian crossing and the bus stop is 20 metres up hill to your right. Catch the M60 direction Parramatta, and alight at CEDARWOOD in Cherrybrook and walk 200 meters to Beahan place. Turn right and we are second house on right. (no 4) Alternatively,Take the train to Town Hall in the CBD. Exit to George St and head west (downhill) via Druitt St to Kent St (passing York and Clarence as you go). Turn right into Kent St and the bus stop is on your left on the corner of Druitt Place (NOT Druitt Lane which is close by). Catch the 621 or 620X bus and ask the driver to advise y
access: Guest will have full access to the house except our personal bedroom and bathroom.
interaction: We are two professionals who are willing to interact as much or as little as requested by our guest. There are many areas of the house where you can have your privacy or if you like to interact with us that is fine as well.
house_rules: Please always lock the front door when you leave, thanks. The sun provides a wonderful solar powered cloths dryer therefore unless we have constant wet weather we dry our cloths in the garden.  We also appreciate if you turn off electricity if you are not in the rooms.  In return for your kind consideration you will find us very willing to help you in anyway.  We'd ask that you'd please don't smoke inside the house. There is undercover area outside that you may do this. Please don't eat in the bedrooms as for hygiene reasons. Beside there is lots of room at the kitchen  and dinning tables.  Please understand that this is a family home, and while your rooms and your bathrooms are sacred to you and you alone and perfectly clean and set up for you…..the rest of the house is like most houses that have 2 working professionals!  We treat all our guests as part of our extended family, and hope you feel the same way about us….it would appear from our reviews that this is the case :-)
host_about: We are living in Sydney. We like to see Wine region and do local turist things.

name: northern beaches, narrabeen, sydney
space: Light, bright and breezy one-bedroom unit. One minute's walk to Narrabeen Lagoon, three minutes walk to Narrabeen ocean beach, one of the world's top surfing beaches. Very quiet, visitor parking available. Located on the Northern Beaches, between Palm Beach and Manly.  Swimming, surfing, kayaking, fishing, walking...outdoors lifestyle. Buses to Sydney and Manly - ferry from Manly to Circular Quay (Sydney) takes 30 minutes.

I love travelling, both in Australia and overseas...when I can afford it...

name: Cosy, Private, Self-Contained & Close to the City
summary: This is a complete, self-contained granny flat (unit) with separate entry for your independent visit to Sydney. Advertised as accommodation for 2, there is also a sofa bed in the lounge room if you have 1 or 2 kids in your family. As new, there is a separate dining room and bathroom. Close to Sydney airport, there is plenty of street parking, and it is only 20 - 30 minutes to the city centre by car. Alternatively it is a 5 minute bus ride or a 15 minute walk to a choice of 2 railway stations.
space: Newly renovated granny flat (self contained attached apartment) in quiet neighbourhood. Close to bus, trains (once you are at the station, its only 15 minutes to the city) and the airport so it's easy to get around stunning Sydney. Fully equipped kitchen with fridge/freezer, microwave, toaster, electric kettle and gas oven with grill. Apartment includes dining room for 4, lounge room with TV and CD/DVD player, comfortable separate bedroom, as new bathroom and separate laundry with washer and dryer. Wi-Fi available, there is also a spacious patio to relax outside. Kids welcome - there is a sofa bed for 2 in the lounge room (but it might be a bit crowded for 4 adults). There is a separate entrance to the flat so independence and privacy assured. Please, no smoking indoors and no pets allowed.
description: This is a complete, self-contained granny flat (unit) with separate entry for your independent visit to Sydney. Advertised as accommodation for 2, there is also a sofa bed in the lounge room if you have 1 or 2 kids in your family. As new, there is a separate dining room and bathroom. Close to Sydney airport, there is plenty of street parking, and it is only 20 - 30 minutes to the city centre by car. Alternatively it is a 5 minute bus ride or a 15 minute walk to a choice of 2 railway stations. Newly renovated granny flat (self contained attached apartment) in quiet neighbourhood. Close to bus, trains (once you are at the station, its only 15 minutes to the city) and the airport so it's easy to get around stunning Sydney. Fully equipped kitchen with fridge/freezer, microwave, toaster, electric kettle and gas oven with grill. Apartment includes dining room for 4, lounge room with TV and CD/DVD player, comfortable separate bedroom, as new bathroom and separate laundry with washer and dryer
neighborhood_overview: Close to Sydney Airport and multiple train stations, this is a quiet, leafy suburb. Next to Australia's smallest National Park, Bardwell Valley is a great blend of urban living and natural escapes. There is Bardwell Valley golf course nearby, as well as Bexley swimming pool complex. There is small convenience store  just down the road for the basics, and a small supermarket at Arncliffe and Bexley (15 mins walk or 5 mins in bus).  There are large supermarkets at Earlwood and Rockdale, and the 473 bus can take you to both shopping centres (about 10 mins). Earlwood Bardwell Park RSL Club provides a fantastic venue that has good food and drinks, in a great local atmosphere that is only minutes away. Bardwell Park shopping centre is closest with the basics including hairdressers, barbers, post office, coffee shop, pizza bar and more. The Wolli Creek Station precinct has major supermarkets, lots of restaurants and cafes and it's own 'buzz' with people always out and about.
transit: Bus:  Route 473 from nearby Lorraine Ave to Rockdale Station (10 mins) and Arncliffe Station (5mins), also to and from Bardwell Valley Station (10mins). From these stations there are many more buses and trains to choose from that can take you all over Sydney.   Train: Arncliffe is easiest to get to, and about 15 minutes walk. There are usually 3-4 trains an hour into the city, and more during peak hours in the morning and afternoon.  It takes about 15 mins to get to the city centre once you are on the train. Bardwell Valley and Turrella Stations are about 25 mins walk, and Wolli Creek Station is 30 mins walk, but its not as direct to our house Taxi: Taxis are usually available from the west side of Rockdale station, and it shouldn’t cost more than $12 to get here from that taxi rank
access: Your stay includes access to the self-contained flat, common area patio with our house, large front lawn, delightful back lawn and laundry.
house_rules: Guests are asked to *Maintain noise to a reasonable level and, in particular, between 10pm and 8am; *Comply with parking regulations and show consideration to neighbours and other vehicles; *Dispose of garbage and recycling in accordance with the usual practice at the property and in the allocated bins. Guests must not leave excess rubbish in common or public areas; *Notify us of any complaints as soon as is practicable; *Minimise their impact upon the residential amenity of the neighbours and local community *Be responsible for their Visitors
host_about: Hi, thanks for checking out or profile. Maria and I have been married for over 15 years, have 2 beautiful daughters and have lived in Sydney all our lives. We love food, wine, finding new experiences and discovering beautiful locations in this wonderful city!

summary: Spacious, airy, fully furnished apartment in Clovelly/Randwick with lots of greenery around. It's suitable for couple's with children or friends' sharing. Located in a quite street with great views and close to beaches, parks and cafes.

name: Sunny Room in Art Deco
summary: My comfortable apartment, with high ceilings and polished floors, is a quintessential Bondi experience. Featuring a private master bedroom, perfect for one to two guests, it is just minutes from the ocean whilst offering easy access to Sydney's East and the city.
space: I'm a millennial creative, situated in a beautiful, thirties era, brick building in relaxed Bondi Beach. You're invited to take advantage of my spacious (45m/sq) home. My apartment is on the top floor of the building, has polished wood floors throughout, high ceilings, and faces north west catching all-day sun. The apartment is furnished with an eclectic collection of art, furnishings and plants, ensuring you feel right at home throughout your stay. You'll have access to the private master bedroom and the shared living areas of the apartment during your stay. The north facing bedroom features a queen-size bed and 100% flax linen bedding. The large living room features a reclaimed timber lounge and complimentary slung leather armchairs, perfect for relaxing with a glass of wine. Positioned below the garden-facing windows, the dining room suite comfortably hosts four for a meal. A well-loved feature of my place is the apartment's original deco bathroom and kitchen, both in good condition
description: My comfortable apartment, with high ceilings and polished floors, is a quintessential Bondi experience. Featuring a private master bedroom, perfect for one to two guests, it is just minutes from the ocean whilst offering easy access to Sydney's East and the city. I'm a millennial creative, situated in a beautiful, thirties era, brick building in relaxed Bondi Beach. You're invited to take advantage of my spacious (45m/sq) home. My apartment is on the top floor of the building, has polished wood floors throughout, high ceilings, and faces north west catching all-day sun. The apartment is furnished with an eclectic collection of art, furnishings and plants, ensuring you feel right at home throughout your stay. You'll have access to the private master bedroom and the shared living areas of the apartment during your stay. The north facing bedroom features a queen-size bed and 100% flax linen bedding. The large living room features a reclaimed timber lounge and complimentary slung leather a
neighborhood_overview: North Bondi is a super friendly neighbourhood with its mix of young families, creatives, surfers, the fashion set and travellers... and my apartment is centrally located amidst the neighbourhood's dynamic lifestyle. The locale boasts a unique village-feel, complete with green grocer, bakery, butcher, deli and a number of cafés and restaurants. I’m happy to supply you with a list of my pick of the local spots to help you make the most of your stay. Of course, the breath-taking surf beach is also only a few minutes walk away!
transit: Whilst most things you could want are within walking distance here in Bondi, a trip to Sydney isn't complete without seeing some of the sites of our beautiful harbour city. To head into Sydney there are a number of public transport options really easily accessed from our apartment: 386/387 bus route between Vaucluse and Bondi Junction. 379 bus route between North Bondi and Bondi Junction. 380/333 bus route between Dover Heights and Circular Quay, via Bondi Beach waterfront, Bondi Junction, Paddington, Surry Hills, Hyde Park. Eastern Suburbs train line from Bondi Junction to Central, connecting to the entire train network. There is on street parking available, with a 2 hour limit during the day, unlimited overnight.
access: Guests have access to the private bedroom and the common spaces in the house, including well-stocked kitchen, as well as ADSL2 wifi, and the front loader washing machine – access to the washer is in the apartment's basement level laundry.
interaction: I'll be here during your stay and also available on my mobile for any requests.
house_rules: We take pride in our home and know you too will treat it with respect. Please don't smoke inside, and if you use the kitchen equipment, please clean it.
host_about: I'm a freelance graphic designer based in the east of Sydney, Australia. When I'm not hovering over my MacBook, I can usually be found walking my greyhound, Björn, or catching up with friends over drinks.
