name: Sydney City Home with Harbour Views
summary: Come stay with Vinh & Stuart (Awarded one of Australia's top hosts by Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky & key shareholder Ashton Kutcher. We're Sydney's #1 reviewed hosts too).  Find out why we've been positively reviewed 500+ times. Please read our listing first (hint hint) We do not accept reservations from people without a verified profile. And please do not make a reservation request before we have exchanged messages. We're keen to chat 1st and make sure we can offer you what you're looking for
space: Please say hello and message us  *BEFORE* you make your reservation request... It'll help speed things up, and smooth things out... Please read our listing. It will make getting a confirmed reservation so much easier :) See below (hint hint) --  * Private attic room (private, but NO DOOR - please see the photos) * Double size fold out SOFA BED --  G'Day from Vinh & Stuart in Sydney! Thanks for coming to check out our listing :) We have another listing btw... http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/12351 if this one is unavailable, or you don't like the idea of a sofa bed (we've slept on it ourselves - it's good for a couple of days before you feel the need for a real bed). Our other listing is called "Sydney City & Harbour at the door"; a queen bed in our second bedroom. We're pretty relaxed hosts, and as Sydney's #1 hosts we play an active part in the Airbnb community, but we fully appreciate staying with someone else, in their home home, is not for every-one. This is not a business, or a hotel.
description: Come stay with Vinh & Stuart (Awarded one of Australia's top hosts by Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky & key shareholder Ashton Kutcher. We're Sydney's #1 reviewed hosts too).  Find out why we've been positively reviewed 500+ times. Please read our listing first (hint hint) We do not accept reservations from people without a verified profile. And please do not make a reservation request before we have exchanged messages. We're keen to chat 1st and make sure we can offer you what you're looking for Please say hello and message us  *BEFORE* you make your reservation request... It'll help speed things up, and smooth things out... Please read our listing. It will make getting a confirmed reservation so much easier :) See below (hint hint) --  * Private attic room (private, but NO DOOR - please see the photos) * Double size fold out SOFA BED --  G'Day from Vinh & Stuart in Sydney! Thanks for coming to check out our listing :) We have another listing btw... http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/12351 if this o
neighborhood_overview: Pyrmont is an inner-city village of Sydney, only about 2kms from the Sydney CBD (Central Business District) / Core, right next door to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. https://www.airbnb.com.au/locations/sydney/pyrmont Pyrmont has a relaxed community feel with an inner city vibe. Pyrmont is only about 2kms (10 - 15 mins walk) from the centre of Sydney with an extensive range of local restaurants, wine bars, and pubs. There's some seriously good baristas and cafes right close to our home (Go and say hi to Damien & Tim at Bar Zini - it's one of our local faves). There's five star fine dining right through to greasy-spoon takeaways with some of Australia's finest dining restaurants within easy reach. * Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay * Exhibition and Convention Centres * Sydney Fish Markets * Pyrama Point Park * Jones Bay Wharf * The Star (Casino) with Food Halls, Bars, and the Lyric Theatre * Powerhouse Museum * National Maritime Museum Also (back on the food - notice a theme?): * Two groce
notes: We've a few reasons for the 6.00pm arrival time / check in / bag drop time... One of them is that we're really flexible with check out times. :) While we do work from home, we don't particularly want to broadcast on the internet if we are away from home. That's why our arrival time is always listed as 6pm. Our "check in" / "arrival time" / "bag drop" is all the same thing. It's not like we're a hotel with a team of porters waiting to take your bags any time of the day or night whether we're at home or not. So, if we haven't agreed some alternate arrangements, then we look forward to welcoming you to our home at 6.00pm. While we may be able to arrange some arrival times / bag drops / check ins earlier, we do need to make those arrangements well in advance. So if the 6.00pm check in time isn't your preference, please talk to us about it *before* you make your reservation. :) :)
transit: Our home is centrally located and an easy walk to everywhere (everywhere you want to go anyways). We also have easy access to trams (light-rail), trains, and ferries which are all conveniently a few minutes walk away. Transport options are great:  There's a bus, the 389, pretty much at our doorstep every 10 minutes. It goes into the City Centre, into Paddington, all the way to Bondi Beach and on to North Bondi - Doesn't get better than that! Trams ("light-rail") every 12 minutes. - Central Station, Fish Markets, The Star, Chinatown, Glebe - Central to Dulwich Hill. Ferries from Pyrmont Bay, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay are a great way to explore. Trains from Town Hall, Central, and Wynyard. A main Sydney City (Town Hall) train station is only 10-15 minutes walk away. Central Station is 15 - 20 minutes walk (5 mins by bus or tram). Airports: The international and Domestic airports are only about 15 - 20 minutes drive away (longer during traffic peaks), again, all easily accessible
access: Our house is your house - we are not a hotel, this is not a business. It is our home. We live here. We look forward to welcoming you to stay you just as we would welcome our family and friends. We'll provide you with a code for the door with easy (and secure) access, so you can come and go as you please. We work from home, so there's generally always someone around.
interaction: As much or as little as you like. We live here. This is our home.  We will be at home when you stay, and generally around & about if and when you need us.
house_rules: We look forward to welcoming you to stay you just as we would our family and friends. "Farm Gate Rules" - if a door is open, leave it open, if a door is closed, please leave it closed.  We'd ask that you'd please not eat in your room, or smoke inside the house. We've a kitchen and dining room for meals (and of course, feel free to use the fridge) and a sheltered, undercover area outside that you're more than welcome to use if you smoke. We tend to work from home, meet clients in our home office, and work by phone too. So this means that our home would be better suited to guests wanting to be out sightseeing during the day, rather than spending the days inside. (But why would you want to stay inside all day when there's so much to see and do anyway?) Every experience we've ever had with Airbnb has been a positive one. Whether we've been hosting, or staying as guests, we've met kind & considerate people, had interesting conversations, and made great new acquaintances & friends. We don't
host_about:
G'Day from Australia!

He's Vinh, and I'm Stuart...

We're big fans of AirBnB for nearly a decade having used it when traveling in the USA not long after AirBnB first started.

Since then we've enjoyed traveling with AirBnB across the US, around Australia, in Hong Kong, and also in Vietnam. We're also hosts.

As guests we're always out & about most of the time and won't be intruding too much.

We're neat & tidy and vibrant conversationalists...

We operate ArtSHINE industries - Australia’s independent Creative Industries Enterprise Acceleration Platform + Launch Pad identifying, advancing, and funding commercially minded and innovative Creative Industries Professionals who focus on art, craft, artisanal making, design, fashion, entertainment, photography, music, writing, film & television, digital technology, and games & interactive content. ArtSHINE also incorporates a coffeehouse and coworking space; CoSydney CoWorking + Project Space, in the City of Sydney’s Chippendale Creative Precinct.

So here's an open invitation to come check us out.

My partner Vinh is a keen traveler who works a lot with artists and designers in his coaching practice. He's the energetic, vibrant one...

I lived in Bolivia for a year as a young man just out of school and have worked in social enterprises and not for profits over the years. I'm the more serious, bookish one (with a wicked sense of humour though). Currently working in financial services too...

One of the things we're keen to do is catch up with some social entrepreneurs, coworkers, not for profits, and microfinanciers.

We're particularly interested social enterprise, coworking, and small business incubators & mentoring projects.

More that happy to answer any questions that you may have.

All the best,

Vinh & Stuart
Australia

name: Beachside haven with gorgeous sea & Headland views
summary: Spacious self-contained bayside apartment in quiet location with beautiful views over Malabar Bay, Malabar Headland and across to Maroubra. 5 minute walk to the nearest golf course. Ocean pool just a 5 minute walk away & 10 minutes walk to the beach. New headland walk from Malabar beach to Maroubra which has spectacular ocean views. Also 10 minute drive to La Perouse National Park.  Bus to city 5 minutes walk. **PLEASE NOTE: There is min 1 week booking between 19th  May and  6th August 2019***
space: Fully self contained top storey of house with separate access, own balcony with beautiful bay and ocean views. Swim at Malabar beach or ocean pool which is only a 5 minute walk away. Easy access to many beautiful bays and beaches and interesting walks.  Spacious living area with well equipped kitchen, large bedroom with queen size bed and large built-in wardrobe, modern bathroom, and your own washing machine.  Just a 5 minute walk to the city bus, close to Maroubra and Coogee beaches, and 14 km to airport. We are in a quiet location within walking distance to cafes, restaurants parks, and fabulous golf clubs. Malabar is a coastal suburb situated around Long Bay. Malabar is mostly residential, but with large plots of land devoted to the Randwick Golf Course,and parks. A small group of shops is located at Prince Edward Street, close to the intersection with Anzac Parade. You can be completely private, but we are close by for any information or assistance you may need. Check-in and out ti

Also 10 minute drive to La Perouse National Park. Just a 5 minute walk to the city bus, close to Maroubra and Coogee beaches, and 14 km t
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is quiet as house is in a residential street. As the bay is quite small, there are never large crowds using the beach. The golf course & club are very picturesque being on the ocean front. The ocean pool is very popular with guests and with ourselves as it is 5 minutes walk so no need to take anything with you but your towel, keys and sunscreen.  Nearest eating and drinking venues are the Leagues club which also provides reasonably priced and varied meals. The golf club is more expensive but still good value. There is also a Chinese restaurant and fast food places within a 10 minute walk and some excellent cafés especially the Heritage and Beach Cafés. La Perouse, Little Bay, Yarra Bay and Maroubra are 10 minutes drive away and have a good selection of cuisines.
notes: If you are a golfer,  this is golfer heaven with several golf courses close by.  Nearest is 5 minutes walk from the apartment.
transit: Bus to city within 5 minute walk. Larger selection of buses 10 minutes walk.  No on site parking but plenty of free street parking. Taxi from the airport takes about 20 mins and costs $40-$50 or many people use Uber.
access: Apartment is fully self-contained. If guests want to use the bbq they are most welcome. Help yourselves to any of the herbs and fruit from the garden.
interaction: We live downstairs. Guests are welcome to knock on the interconnected door at any time for information or a chat. However guests can be completely private as they have their own separate side entrance.
house_rules: We are an easygoing couple and want to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. We expect you would treat the apartment as if you were in your own home. No smoking inside the apartment or loud music after 9pm.  Please switch off air-con or heating when going out. It only takes a few minutes to heat or cool when you return.
host_about: We are from Ireland, but have lived in Sydney for over 30 years.  We enjoy travelling, theatre, movies, nature, walking, and meeting  people. We are happy to help in any way we can, but you can be assured of total privacy if you just want to relax and do your own thing.

summary: A lovely room in quiet little cottage in a central position. One bus stop to the CBD, and 4 minutes walk to a huge variety of restaurants, bars, pubs and supermarket shopping. Pretty gardens and outdoor living areas. Take breakfast on the terrace.
space: A small quiet room in a  little cottage, one bus stop from the Sydney CBD. Walk to shopping, numerous restaurants, wine bars and pubs. Street parking no problem. Pretty outlook and garden, resident Italian greyhound, modern kitchen and bathroom. Friendly, casual atmosphere. Neutral Bay is a harbourside suburb on the lower North Shore of Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. Neutral Bay is located around 5 kilometres north of the Sydney central business district. The Sydney Central Business District (CBD) is an area of very densely concentrated skyscrapers and other buildings, interspersed by several parks such as Hyde Park, The Domain, Royal Botanic Gardens and Wynyard Park. George Street is the Sydney CBD's main north-south thoroughfare. summary: Fully furnished 2 bedroom garden apartment in the most beautiful part of Sydney. Close to the beach and the city, this enchanting location has a taste of everything. Truly a great location if you like to be close all amenities.
space: A rare opportunity exists to stay in a fully furnished newly renovated lush garden residence in one of Sydney's most prestigious area's.    Set back from the street in a beautiful garden setting close to beach, shops and  bus stop.  Location and Transport: Your local community parks, cafes, bank, post office, boutique shops, supermarket,  pub and restaurants are less than a 5 minute walk away.  A bus is at your doorstep to transport you to Bronte beach in 5 minutes or the opposite direction to Bondi Junction in 5 minutes, where you can take the train into Sydney CBD in 3 stops. Alternatively take a direct bus to Central Railway station. All buses leave  every 3 minutes to Bondi Junction, and buses leave to Bronte Beach Randwick Ritz, Coogee Beach, Maroubra Beach and various other locations every 10 minutes. The bus 400 will take you to and from the airport. I use the App 'Citymapper' for timetables. On foot you can get to  Bondi Junction (The main shopping area), Tamarama and Bronte Be

neighborhood_overview: Close to everything, you can't go wrong in this location
notes: Mobile Phones and internet: Mobile phone reception is not great inside the apartment due to the double brick walls and location. To ensure high speed internet penetrates throughout, we have two internet connections installed Natural light: In the winter months ( June July August ) there is a lack of natural light due to the aspect. Summer months ( November through March ) are lighter and brighter, although we do not get full natural light being on ground level.  We are referring to southern hemisphere seasons!! Unfortunately when it rains we lack natural light even in summer.  Fuse box: The fuse box is on the balcony of the upstairs unit in case of power overload. it has happened once so it's handy to know that it is easily rectified. We suggest you don't use too many appliances at one time on the one circuit. The upstairs neighbour is very obliging if access is needed   Beds and Cots: The residence has 2 Queen beds which sleeps 4 adult guests.  We can arrange a portable cot if given a
transit: Transport just about at your doorstep to beach and city. Buses running every 3 minutes up to Bondi Junction and every 10 minutes down to the beach so no need for a timetable.
access: Meet and greet on arrival with someone who will give you keys and show you where everything is and how it works, or security codes will be given prior to arrival if no one is available for check in. 24 hour check in access
interaction: Your privacy is respected and you will not be contacted during your stay unnecessarily. Interaction will be as much or as little as needed for a comfortable stay. We will be available via email when travelling overseas. Feel free to contact us at anytime and we will respond as soon as we are online. We check emails several times daily and also leave a local phone contact for emergencies. If we are in Australia, we are available via phone An emergency trades list is provided. Manual with local knowledge and how to get around and recommendations
house_rules: Noise limitations due to quiet neighborhood. Strictly no parties or guests sleeping over. This is for mature adults or a young family only who are genuinely looking for a quiet comfortable place to stay. Small get togethers on the premises with friends are welcome It would be appreciated if you could water the plants on the deck  during your stay. .
host_about:
We are Karen and Gavin, a friendly professional couple who work full time, enjoys outdoor activities, the beach and surfing. Interested in meeting people and keeping fit. Our Sydney home is available whilst we are on holidays. Our holiday home at the Entrance is available all year around.

We love to travel for both business and pleasure and enjoy setting up our Sydney home for guests to enjoy while we are travelling :)

name: Bondi Beach Break 2 Bedroom Apt
summary: This Quiet and Fabulous 2 bedroomed apartment is a short stroll to Bondi beach.  This is a Large bright airy apartment  which  has whitewash bamboo floors, beautiful ornate ceilings with overhead fans and all the mod cons including Internet TV; DVD;
space: This Quiet and Fabulous 2 bedroomed apartment is a short stroll to Bondi beach. name: Room + own Bathroom in Family Home!
space: Room available in a family home in a lovely safe leafy suburb Your Space Fully furnished bedroom and own bathroom. Room includes single bed , plenty of drawers and hanging space, bedside table, mirror, pillow, towels, desk and desk lamp. You also get wireless internet in the room, free use of washing machine,. microwave, TV , DVD, etc. House is a large 5 bedroom, 3 bathroom house with lovely surroundings, BBQ area and garden. Location Close to bus or 25 minute walk to station, cafes, restaurants, supermarkets, banks, and a short drive to many of Sydney’s beautiful Northern Beaches! Long term or short term stays available. The accommodation will suit older travellers, business people or students as the home is quiet and provides good very clean accommodation at a reasonable rate. We are very relaxed and easy going. We have one beautiful cat that lives in and out of the house. We also have an exhuberant, friendly, affectionate and comical Miniature Aussie

neighborhood_overview: Wahroonga is a very pretty, quiet suburb with many beautiful homes and gardens. Our local area is rated as the safest area in Sydney. The shopping village has a wonderful feel and a great place to share a good coffee with a friend. We live very close to the bush.There are many nice bush walks close to our home where you can sometimes see wallabies and other wildlife.
transit: Bus on the corner of street takes you to local shopping centre and railway station. It is 38 minute train ride into the city.
access: Guests have access to all amenities  in the downstairs part of the house.
interaction: We interact with the guests as much or as little as the guest would like. Guests frequently join us for dinner. Some guests choose to pay an additional fee which covers all meals. This particularly appeals to younger guests who are not that keen to cook their own meals.
host_about: Hi my name is Marianne, i am a  Friendly, Easy going, Casual Social, Busy, Happy  person...I  love to meet people from different cultures and places from around the world.

name: Balmain - spacious modern house with pool
summary: Great family home, with swimming pool, located in prestigous Sydney harbourside suburb. Short drive/ferry to city, walk to funky cafes, wine bars, pubs, restaurants, shopping, harbourside pool & great vantage points for Harbour fireworks.
space: Available is a spacious, modern fully furnished 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom, 2 living area home in the heart of Balmain - a harbour front suburb of Sydney. (It is 10 minutes via ferry or bus from the centre of Sydney). The home provides ample space and a brand new inground pool and sunny backyard for lazy days. There are 3 bedrooms and a second living area with sofa lounge (with proper double mattress) and the home can accommodate 6 people request (1 single, 1 single, 1 queen, 1 double sofa bed).  There are 2 bathrooms - one with freestanding bath. Wardrobe and drawer space in each room is available. Air conditioning, foxtel, wireless internet are available. All crockery, cutlery, linen, towels are provided and house is profesionally cleaned before guest's arrival. The house is located in a quiet street with a large park at the end (with children's equipment) and walking distance to trendy and unique shops and boutiques, cafes, historical pubs, restaurants, harbour swimming pool, shopping ce

neighborhood_overview: Balmain is often regarded as a trendy and affluent precinct and widely recognised as one of Sydney's premier suburbs. Old world charm and a friendly village atmosphere are two of Balmain's greatest attributes. Located just four kilometres from the Sydney CBD, Balmain offers a sanctuary for people who are lucky enough to live or visit the area.
notes: The home is in a residential area so guests need to be mindful of our neighbours. The home accommodates 6 people.
transit: Ferry and bus direct to City and North Shore - 10 minutes
access: Guests have access to all areas of the home with exception of the storage area/garage.
interaction: We welcome pre-arrival communcation and always make contact to confirm bedding arrangements and offer any other assistance, ie. sightseeing, transport options, airport transfers
house_rules: No parties. Do not park over our neighbour's driveways. No additional guests without prior arrangement. Responsible for garbage. Any seafood must not be put in residential bins. No smoking indoors or pets. Bond required.
host_about: Mum with two kids and a lovely husband who all love discovering the world and meeting new people and embracing new cultures. Lucky enough to live in a fabulous part of the world, but always keen to see more places and make new friends.

name: Apartment in North Bondi Village
summary: The apartment is in a classic 1930s Bondi block. High ceilings and relaxed beachside feel. Ground floor, so it stays cool in the summer. No stairs to negotiate, you can just roll in and straight out down to the surf and sand.
space: This cosy ground floor apartment is located on the picturesque Ben Buckler headland and is a 2 minute stroll to the sand of Bondi Beach.   100m from North Bondi Village shops - grocery store, laundromat, news agency, chemist and many cafes and restaurants. The stop for the main Bus routes is at the end of the street (380 & 333 to the city or, going the other direction, continue on to Watson's Bay and South Head). There is also  a nine hole cliff-top golf course across the street! Queen bed in master bedroom and very comfortable queen size sofa bed in second bedroom.  (extra airbed available if needed) Child friendly with a portacot and high-chair available. All day unmetered street parking outside the apartment. In the summer season Bondi is a thriving cosmopolitan centre for sun, surf and fun. The beach is part of a large moon shaped bay of white sands and breaking surf. It is fringed by parks and apartments that overlook the blue waters.

transit: If you are travelling by public transport, Ben Buckler point (North Bondi) is serviced by two main bus routes : the 380 and the express service 333. Both pass through Bondi Junction Station interchange. This in turn services the greater rail network. If you are coming via the airport rail line it is simplest to alight at Museum station and then take either the 333 or 380 from Liverpool / Oxford st corner of  Hyde Park.
access: Access to the entire apartment and shared laundry at the back of the building
interaction: We’re a phone call away if there’s anything you need
house_rules: $500 Security deposit. No Smoking in the apartment, please.
host_about: From Bondi, in the theatre and film industry. I love the surf and to travel

name: Beach Suite - opposite the beach
space: Literally across the road form Bondi Beach.  1st floor apartment - one of only 2 very private apartments.  Views of beach, ocean and headland from lounge room and 2nd bedroom. Main bedroom has french doors leading to private courtyard. With the beach and park across the road it's perfect for all kinds of holiday recreation. Great for kids and adults alike.  Cute galley style kitchen well equipped with matching crockery, glasses and quality Scanpan cooking pots.  Sunny and breezy, floorboards throughout. Cooking facilities, towels, bedding provided. Free broadband Internet and cable TV with all the movie channels  Large Plasma TV - see lounge room picture.  Bathroom is rendered in modern tones and has a medium sized bath.  Stays of a week or longer can request a weekly clean and linen change for a small fee.  Seconds to cafes and restaurants. house_rules: Strictly non smoking apartment and building. No large gatherings or parties - fine to have friends round for drinks and dinner parties - but no wild parties thanks! Please note, this like most other holiday apartments is not a hotel. It does not come with concierge services. Internet facilities are provided free of charge as a 100 percent connection and service can not be guaranteed. Also note this apartment is not modern. It is as advertised - rustic beach house charm. The windows are wooden and weathered from the sea as is the back courtyard. We eschew the modern feel and don't offer that. It's a classic Bondi Beach Side apartment. If you need modern and or concierge services we recommend the QT hotel which, like us, is across the road from the beach.  Cheers bondi holiday apartments

notes: Parking can be arranged at $25 p/day Pets are possible on application

name: Secret Beach Hideaway with Tropical Gardens
summary: Nestled on a hill overlooking Sydney's Northern Beaches and a rainforest valley, this bright retreat is spacious, sunny, and private. An ideal escape for creative inspiration, filled with the sights and sounds of the ocean and surrounded by nature.
space: Nestled between the Pacific Ocean and Pittwater is Newport Beach on Sydney's Northern Beaches. Set high on a hill overlooking the ocean and rainforest valley, our home is light, sunny and private.  An ideal escape for creative inspiration, filled with sights and sounds of the ocean. Dine in the Balinese pavilion by the solar-heated pool. Invite family and friends for a BBQ, surrounded by native tropical gardens with expansive views over the valley to the ocean and to Newport reef. Our lower duplex home has 2 double-size bedrooms, large lounge/dining area. Pool, bbq and entertaining pavilion, table seats 12-14. Second bathroom near the pool, pavilion and gazebo. Kitchenette in pavilion by pool. Full moon rising over the ocean, morning sunrise, catch a glimpse of migrating whales. Seeking guests who enjoy tranquillity and the finer things in life.
description: Nestled on a hill overlooking Sydney's Northern Beaches and a rainforest valley, this bright retreat is spacious, sunny, and private. An ideal escape for creative inspiration, filled with the sights and sounds of the ocean and surrounded by nature.
neighborhood_overview: The home is between the Pacific Ocean and Pittwater, an eight-minute walk from Newport Beach with its cafes and restaurants. There are three golf courses, tennis courts, sailing clubs, cinemas, a library and Avalon Village within a 5-10 minute drive.
notes: Available for bookings of 2 weeks. Additional weeks negotiable. Includes garden and pool maintenance, linen/towels/bedding, wifi and 'welcome' breakfast.
transit: Off street parking for 1 car. Express bus every 15 minutes to Sydney centre. Or to Manly, ferry to Circular Quay, Sydney Opera House, The Rocks. Door to door airport shuttle services.
access: All areas of property, separate entrance via one short flight of stairs from the street and parking to the private lower duplex.
interaction: Available for information and assistance in person or via text/phone/email on request.
house_rules: Suitable for a single, couple or a family of 3 or 4. Maximum 4 people. Occasional guests overnight. Swimming pool on lower level. Not suitable for children who cannot swim well. Prefer families with children over 7 years of age.
host_about: Former Tour Director.... a good source of advice for activities in Sydney and further afield across Australia, New Zealand and Papua new Guinea. My family live in Sydney, I have 2 small grandsons who bring us much joy and entertainment. My home is in a beautiful beach side location, with views to the ocean and across the valley to the North-East. Its sunny and warm in winter, cooling sea breezes in summer, no air-con needed! The duplex is completely separate, accessed via one short flight of steps. Well suited to a couple or friends looking for a 'home away from home' for 2+ weeks.

name: Surry Hills Modern Apartment Living
summary: My place is close to Central Station. You’ll love my place because of the comfy bed. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
space: Great inner city location with easy walking proximity to cafés, pubs, quaint eateries, wine bars, funky small art galleries, yoga studios, shopping, and public transport. This is a bright and modern apartment located on the third floor of a six-story building.  Step out of your door step, out onto the street of what was formerly known as the “rag district”, and you are placed in an urbane and gentrified hub of the bohemian Sydney village of Surry Hills, Sydney. The apartment’s long rectangular floor space gives a great sense of flow and openness.  Enter the front door into the middle of a long corridor which separates the apartment’s two main areas: the living area including balcony facing out to Holt Street; and the back-end sleeping quarter.  A galley kitchen with modern appliances and 8-seater table makes it great should you wish to entertain a dinner party.  Hidden neatly behind cupboard doors are laundry/dryer, a shower room, and plenty of wardrobe space. Seeking out on-street par

A galley kitchen with modern appliances and 8-seater table makes it great should you wi
house_rules: No shoes indoors please
host_about:
I'm Australian-born, of Lao-ethnic origins, a global traveler, dedicated yogi, aspirational buddhist, with a passion for social justice, as well as, an appreciation for design, architectural details and good eating.

Ever since Airbnb started in 2011, I've listed home/s in Sydney and (formerly) in Hong Kong—and have enjoyed meeting a swag of guests in the Airbnb international community from all walks of life—some whom have even continued to stay in contact. 

As an Airbnb host, I'm aware of how most guests are not looking for a faceless serviced apartment or out-of-the-box stay. Are you a first-time visitor to Sydney who's coming without a full itinerary? Interested in local knowledge on great activities (pottery classes? suggestions for families and kids?) ... just ask, and I'd happily assist. For guests who already know the city and just needing the great city pad homebase—that's all good, too. Simply send an introduction of yourself in a request to book to start the dialogue...

As an Airbnb guest, I've had the fortune of fantastic stays with hosts in cities (San Francisco, Istanbul, Berlin, etc) enjoying the flexible option of the home stay in a foreign place.

In my work life, I work within the HIV Community Health not-for-profit sector sector. Some of my simple joys are flâneur in urban cities, roaming the markets, bazaars, hopping on a bicycle, and seeking out where the next Argentine tango milonga may be.

name: Luxury apartment by the beach
summary: This newly renovated 2 bed unit in a great location on the edge of the South Pacfic ocean at North Bondi.  It has a new lux stone tiled bathroom and kitchen, white washed floorboards.  Surrounded by blue sea, with great restaurants and cafes right outside your door.  This top floor unit has a terrace with views and a garage.
space: This 2-bedroom beachside pad is in a perfect position in North Bondi. Sundrenched and light-filled, it has sweeping views of the South Pacific ocean and Bondi beach, as well as the distant lights of the city and Tamarama.  The apartment is designer decorated in laid-back beachside chic.  Combined living and dining enjoys dining for 4 and a lounge area with 42” LED screen, Blueray, DVD, sound system (bring iPod or CDs) and cable television.    Enjoy programmes in HD and even 3D. There is a high speed wi-fi connection as well. The main bedroom has a Queen size bed while the second bedroom has a double, both with high quality white linens.  Both bedrooms enjoy ocean views. The balcony offers undercover dining for 6 people.  This is a walk-up building, and the unit is on the 3rd floor.  If you are reasonably active you won't even notice the stairs.  However it may not be suitable for the elderly. Enjoy living like a local and the best of Bondi from this Sydney greatspace.

neighborhood_overview: This is the best street in North Bondi, in the Ben Buckler enclave on the edge of the deep blue Pacific Ocean. Out the front door it is a 2-minute walk to the North Bondi village, with great cafes, cool little neighbourhood restaurants and local shops.  Meander another 2 minutes and you are on the sand of Bondi beach.  On the way, stop for a glass of wine and a plate of calamari at trendy North Bondi Fish.  Or pop upstairs for a schooner of beer and the best views of Bondi Beach at the laid back RSL Club, where travellers are always welcome.
notes: There is some construction on the street from a house being built.
transit: Lock up garage on the property or the bus terminus to the city is 100 metres away.
interaction: Questions by phone or email
house_rules: No pets and no smoking in house.  No parties.
host_location: Quarry Bay, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
host_about: I love the North Bondi lifestyle - my tip is to try and get out there at sunrise to tap into the local life, go for a surf or run the iconic coastal path to Bronte past Icebergs sea baths or just grab a coffee and chill on the legendary sands before they heat up with sun and sun worshippers.  Don't forget your bathers. THE BEST start to a day in Sydney.

name: Bright Private Room Close to the City
summary: This terrace is spacious and has 4 private bedrooms, 2 are Air BnB rooms, 1 is my bedroom, and the 4th as my office. There is plenty of space for everyone to live comfortably. Each bedroom is large enough to sleep 2 people. My home is centrally located, with plenty of transport links to both the city and beaches.
space: Lovely room in renovated 4 bedroom terrace in Redfern. The bedroom is private and has double bed with a large window, leafy outlook, and plenty of cupboard space. It's a large modern and clean share bathroom which is shared with the other Air BnB room. There's a great deck to sit on in the morning sun with your tea or coffee which is provided. There are 2 living spaces, a modern kitchen with gas cooking, dishwasher and microwave and a BBQ on the deck. My labradoodle will keep you company if you're cooking! There's a washing machine available as well as the wifi. Plenty of great cafes and restaurants at your doorstep and 2 minutes to buses and trains to explore Sydney. You can walk into the city in 20 minutes or jump on a bus to get you there in 10 minutes.  Redfern station is a 5 minute walk from the house, and Central station is a 12 minute walk from the house. There's a fully equipped gym a 5 minute walk away, a lovely sunny outdoor 50 metre swimming pool a 7 minute walk away, a few
description: This terrace is spacious and has 4 private bedrooms, 2 are Air BnB rooms, 1 is my bedroom, and the 4th as my office. There is plenty of space for everyone to live comfortably. Each bedroom is large enough to sleep 2 people. My home is centrally located, with plenty of transport links to both the city and beaches. Lovely room in renovated 4 bedroom terrace in Redfern. The bedroom is private and has double bed with a large window, leafy outlook, and plenty of cupboard space. It's a large modern and clean share bathroom which is shared with the other Air BnB room. There's a great deck to sit on in the morning sun with your tea or coffee which is provided. There are 2 living spaces, a modern kitchen with gas cooking, dishwasher and microwave and a BBQ on the deck. My labradoodle will keep you company if you're cooking! There's a washing machine available as well as the wifi. Plenty of great cafes and restaurants at your doorstep and 2 minutes to buses and trains to explore Sydney. You can
neighborhood_overview: It's a fast growing and evolving neighbourhood with plenty of new cafes and bars opening often. The convenience of this including a supermarket, a 30 minute walk into the city and plenty of green space within moments of the house to enjoy. Redfern is a safe inner city suburb. The house is moments away from buses and Redfern station is a 5 minute walk away.
notes: The main bathroom is on the 1st floor close to this bedroom. This bathroom is also shared with a second Air BnB bedroom which is on the same floor. All guests share this same bathroom. There is an extra toilet downstairs in the living area.
transit: Redfern station is a 5 minute walk from the house and Central station a 12 minute walk from the house. There are bus stops everywhere, as close as 50 metres away. You can also walk into the city if you prefer this, it will take you about 25 minutes to get into the centre. The train to and from the airport to my house is a 30 minute trip from door to door with a short walk from the train station to the house. It's great and costs approximately $18AUD each way. I use it on a regular basis. Sydney university is about a 20 minute walk away, Australian Technology Park about a 15 minute walk away, and Darling Harbour Convention Centre about a 25 minute walk away,
access: Guests have access to the whole house, including a full kitchen should you wish to cook whilst you stay. As if you are at home whilst you're away. All the comforts you would ever want in a long or short stay. There's a desk in the room should you need to do some work whilst staying. The bathroom is a shared with the second Air BnB bedroom.
interaction: I work for myself so that keeps me busy, I also go out often and I'm away sometimes too, however when i'm home I always enjoy a chat and a coffee or glass of wine and some advice on where to go, when and how to get there. It's always nice to share a meal sometimes, but respectfully giving you your space too. I really enjoy having people from all over the world come and stay with me.
house_rules: Check out is 11am or earlier. Check in to the room is between 1pm and 9pm. Your luggage can be left at the house after 11am should you have a late flight out from Sydney. Your luggage can be left at the house before 1pm should you have an early flight. Please use the exhaust fan when using the shower.
host_about:
I work for myself as a commercial photographer and I love it!
I have an office at home so sometimes i'm at home during the day working, so can greet you when you arrive, whilst other times I'm out working on location, if this is the case I will leave a key out for you and communicate this with you via the Air BnB message service.
Harry (my dog) and I go walking every morning. She will greet you very enthusiastically when you arrive at the house and be ready for a scratch on her tummy from you to say hello.
It's great to meeting and hosting new people from all over the world and have a chat over a coffee or a wine and share my local knowledge with you, and hear about your travelling experiences, but I also respect your privacy, and my work keeps me pretty busy too!
I love being an Air BnB host and have made some great friends from the guests who have stayed with me from all over the world.
I am aware a lot of people are looking for longer term accommodation, however, short term stays suits me, and I'm not looking for any guests to stay longer than 1 month.
I look forward to meeting you.

name: Private room for your Bondi holiday
summary: Stylish and eclectically decorated two bedroom Bondi apartment.  Located a 15 minute walk to the famous Bondi Beach, with public transport at your doorstep, this is the perfect base for enjoying all that Bondi and Sydney have to offer. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.
space: Welcome to my home in iconic Bondi beach.  The apartment is well located on the transport route to the bright lights of the city centre (7 kms: 15 to 30 minutes, depending on traffic conditions) and a brisk 10 minute walk down to the beach. The apartment is set peacefully at the rear of a boutique refurbished Arts & Crafts period apartment block, the 104 m2 space is very comfortable. It has high ceilings, is well furnished in an eclectic 'boho' style and I keep it very clean and tidy.  The private bedroom has a very comfortable double bed, fresh towels & sheets, wardrobe, dressing table and free internet. Tea, coffee etc and basic home products (laundry/ cleaning products, etc) are included for your stay. You  have shared use of the bathroom, kitchen, laundry (with washing machine & dryer) and the living area, including the sunny roof top deck. The bathroom has both a shower and a large bath where you can relax and ease muscles after a long day in the surf.. The kitchen is fully equipp

Located a 15 minute walk to the famous Bondi Beach, with public transport at your doorstep, this is the perfect base for enjoying all that Bondi and Sydney have to offer. The apartment is well located on the transport route to the bright lights of the city centre (7 kms: 15 to 30 minutes, depending on traffic conditions) and a brisk 10 minute walk down to the beach. The private bedroom has a very comfortable double bed, fresh towels & sheets, wardrobe, dressing table and free internet. Tea, coffee etc and basic home products (laundry/ cleaning products, etc) are
neighborhood_overview: The area: A brisk 10 minute walk to Bondi beach and the scenic coastal paths to Bronte, Clovelly or to the cliffs of Dover Heights. Wine and dine at the local cafes and restaurants, soak up the music from local venues, go crazy with shopping at Bondi Junction or take the bus/ train/ $25 cab fare to the Sydney nightlife and attractions. Nearby restaurants: Japanese, Thai, Indian, Vegetarian, French, Modern, Pizza, Seafood, many great cafes to hang out. Good take-away food outlets as well as grocery stores, wine shops and delis for all your food needs. I look forward to welcoming you to Bondi!  Activities you may want to do while in Bondi/Sydney: Near my place:  Scuba diving at Camp Cove, horse riding or bike riding in Queens Park, walking along the cliffs from Coogee to The Gap, the Bondi-Bronte cliff walk, walking along the shore of the Harbour from Rose bay to Nielsens Park , renting a small catamaran in Rose Bay, or if you are a pro - get yourselves down to Rushcutters  Bay yacht clu
notes: Free all day street parking is available  - but can be hard to find close by after 7pm (though lots of parking further down the street). There are Go Get cars in nearby streets.
transit: The 389 bus from the city drops you off directly in front of the building. The train station in Bondi junction to take you to the city is a 4/5 minutes bus ride or a 10 minute walk.
access: Help yourself to any appliances in the kitchen, blender, toaster and kettle along with basics like teas, oils, herbs and spices. There is a microwave, a washing machine and dryer, iron, bathtub and a hairdryer. Help yourself to any of those. I have wifi internet and a full bookshelf if you like reading. Fresh towels and beach towels if you're heading down for a swim. There's a surfboard and boogie boards if you're adventurous.
interaction: I also live in the apartment, so it is important that we remain friendly and respectful of each other's space.  Please ask any questions about your stay or about Sydney/Bondi in general, I'll be happy to help you get the most out of your holiday.
house_rules: I prefer non-smokers and absolutely no smoking in the apartment. Access to the apartment is for the paying guests only and I request that you respect my privacy and do not invite people to your room or to the apartment. Free wireless is available for your use during your stay -  you will have to provide your own computer or device.  The rules? ..simple: respect
host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
Hi, welcome to my page

I am a pretty laid back professional, I work in the city Monday-Friday as a policy manager for a government department and enjoy the beach and social lifestyle of Bondi and Sydney on my days off. 

I am healthy, energetic, fun/serious, open minded, you'll know up front what you need to know about sharing a place with me (if you book the room only) and I hope to expect that you will do the same with me so that we share the space in harmony. If you book the entire apartment I will greet you and leave you to enjoy your holiday in peace.

I have travelled extensively and appreciate the little things that can make an arrival/stay in a strange or new city/country a positive experience.

What I enjoy: reading, the arts, arthouse/international films, people, learning, puzzles, walking, riding my bike, sitting in cafes discussing everything and anything, people watching, catching up with my kids (they've left home), music, silence, nature, the ocean and much much more :)

name: Contemporary Living in Newtown
summary: Located in the heart of the inner west, this designer apartment is a colourful take on a converted church. It consists of three levels with a small deck for entertaining and is a stone’s throw from King St Newtown and Erskineville village. The whole house is only available when I travel overseas and as I'm heading to Europe in April 2019 to meet my first grandchild, this is an opportunity to take advantage of a home that can accommodate 6 guests and is close to cafés, bars and public transport.
space: Please send me a brief personal profile (eg number of people, ages, type of work you do, reason for trip) with your enquiry before you make a reservation.  This fabulous designer apartment with high speed broadband internet is located in the heart of the inner-west area of Newtown, less than 5km from Sydney city centre and 8km from Sydney International Airport. It's available for short-medium stays).  Originally a church building, it was converted about eight years ago to three apartments.  The apartment is more suitable for adults on holidays or business trips than for families with small children but parents can decide for themselves if their children can deal with stairs etc. I'm close to Sydney university so the apartment is also perfect for visiting academics for seminars or conferences. The kitchen is fully equipped including: * dishwasher * smeg oven and gas cooktop * microwave * refrigerator. The top level has two bedrooms and a bathroom. The ceilings are the original timber ch

It's available for short-medium stays).  Originally a church building, it was converted about eight years ago to three apartments.  The
neighborhood_overview: My neighbourhood offers a vibrant café/shopping/cinema/winebar strip (King St, Newtown) and a slightly quieter, village-type atmosphere in Erskineville Rd, Erskineville. I love both. Walking around the area is easy and interesting as there are many lovely old terrace houses, parks and street art, not to mention the people you may meet!
notes: I'll be overseas during your visit and will be contactable via email (Email hidden by Airbnb) but my neighbour (Kent) will be available if you have any urgent problems. He will also be handling the cleaning etc in my absence.
transit: There is usually no need to hire a car to get around Sydney if you stay at my place. Public transport to the city is fast and convenient. You can hop on a train to the city from either Newtown or Erskineville Station and be there in around 15 minutes. Buses from King St will take you to the city, Broadway, Glebe, Coogee Beach and more.
access: Guests can access the whole house. Please be respectful of my personal belongings :)
house_rules: I know that if you're staying at my place you're probably on a holiday but there are still a few rules! 1. First and foremost, please consider my neighbours who may be slightly anxious about living near an Airbnb home. Little things like not smoking outside their homes, not being overly loud especially after 10pm and being friendly if you run into them will be appreciated by all and will help to maintain Airbnb's good reputation. 1. No smoking. If you're a smoker or one of your fellow guests is a smoker, please take advantage of the park across the road where you're least likely to upset anyone. 2. No loud parties (small dinner parties and gatherings are fine, but remember that you have neighbours who are more than likely not on holidays and may have to get up and go to work the next day) 3. Children under the age of 16 are not to be left at home without parental supervision as I'm not insured for any damage caused in these circumstances. 4. Please be careful when you’re bringing large
host_about:
I'm am an artist, Silverfox model, Airbnb host, mother of four wonderful adult kids, proud grandmother of a baby girl born in the UK in November 2018, besotted dog owner and live in the top two levels of a beautiful, light-filled three-level renovated church building.

Sharing my home (the street level) with Airbnb guests is one of the best things I've ever done. It's given me connections with many amazing people. I've found that the kind of people who choose Airbnb are adventurous, friendly, warm, intelligent, curious and often have fascinating stories to tell about their own lives.

When I travel, I stay at Airbnb places and each place I've chosen has been unique, full of character and has offered so much more than a stark and sterile hotel room. Meeting my hosts has been another benefit - they are all wonderful people.

I have a dog – a Lagotto Romagnola – whose name is Mucca and she shares my space upstairs. She's very friendly and lovable and is classified as 'hypoallergenic' so should not be a problem for guests with allergies.

name: Family house on North shore
summary: There is a few rooms available, all come with a double bed, table, wardrobe and hangar access, access to kitchen, bathroom washing machine. We make it so you feel like its home away from home and provide everything you need so you pack light!
space: Family home in cosy North Shore.  Can offer one room with ensuite for short term stays and long term stays up to 3 months. During Janurary, Feburary, October, November and December multiple rooms are available (so enquire) NEW YEARS XMAS PRICING PREMIUMS APPLY This room is located in the beautiful, quiet and leafy North Shore.  There are many nearby many parks, golf courses and restaurants.  It is just half an hour on the train to Sydney CBD and if you have a car you can get to Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park or the Central Coast and Newcastle via the F3 Freeway. The hub of Chatswood is also located nearby with many businesses and asian shops and restaurants. Unlimited wifi, private own enclosed area with stove, microwave On that note, I am a couchsurfer (as a host and traveller), I have experienced many culture exchanges by vagabonding through Europe and Asia and know what it is like to need a home after living out of your suitcase. transit: 10-15 minutes leafy stroll downhill from some beautiful houses to gordon station- so may not suit families or guest with senior citizens north shore most frequent train line -30 minutes to Sydney CBD 20 minutes to the hills area, northern beaches, hornsby- perfect location for exploring sydney via car
access: Unlimited wifi, private own enclosed area with stove, microwave On that note, I am a couchsurfer (as a host and traveller), I have experienced many culture exchanges by vagabonding through Europe and Asia and know what it is like to need a home after living out of your suitcase. I will HOST YOU!. I am self employed and work long hours but I will make my effort to HOST YOU.
interaction: We will leave you with your personal space and offer a warm soup on dumplings made with love and care as well
house_rules: House Rules To be followed by all residents and their guests. Please use your common sense and curtesy to ensure others feel comfortable living in the house 1.Please use common courtesy and be considerate of others living with you: please keep common areas (eg kitchen and bathroom etc) tidy after you use it please keep the noise down so as not to disturb others please be considerate of others when using the bathroom if others are waiting 2.Keep the Noise Down after 11pm: when listening to music or movies in your room after 11pm please use earphones please refrain from using the kitchen after 11pm.  if necessary, please use it quietly please refrain from talking loudly (eg on the mobile phone etc) in your room after 11pm please switch to silent mode or turn down your mobile phone ring tone if you know that you will be receiving a lot of phone calls after 11pm please turn down the volume of the TV after 11pm please close the door quietly (ie do not slam the doors) (website hidden) clean
host_about:
Early 30s. Professional. Traveller, Business Owner, Travelpreneur (yes I get paid to travel and I can show you how) Interested in the variety and backgrounds of people and couch surfing without strings.

Friendly, accommodating and willing to help you with inside knowledge whether you are here for a holiday, conference or just a weekend visit. Either way, I will help accommodate with your needs and personal space.

My personal motto would be, "Never wish life was better, only you were Better"

::::THIS IS WHAT I WILL TELL YOU TO EXPECT POSITIVE AND NEGATIVES::::

Positive: I will help and make things easier for you in your stay, pick up from station when I can, leave food out if your hungry and you don't mind trying my/my family's food, and try and give you tips to save yourself here and there. I will as a host try and take care of you.

Negative: I am not a butler, you will be expected to clean up after yourself, follow house rules, keep the kitchen and public area in some order. You have to wear slippers (YES it is an Asian House), and sometimes other people will be staying so you do have to respect their space. I will also expect you to communicate if you wish to extend your stay or are running late.
___________________________________________________________________




All prices include, fully furnished, basic breakfast and tea and coffee, bread, pickup from station and clear directions to maximize your travellers time in the city ( As I am quite a traveller myself). Also wireless internet, toilet paper, soap and clean towels and access to a washing machine and kitchen which needs to be used carefully.

I also believe food is a great way to connect people and I love to source ingredients from markets and cook for my guests and it would be great if we could sit down over a meal and do the same and be able to do that. I am also able to converse in a variety of topics which include culture, music, politics and travel and would love to use a meal to get to know you as well. So all the prices MAY (depending on schedule) a personal cooking together and experience as we get to know each other if schedule suits.

I ONLY host people who I feel are in the same headspace and GENERALLY (but not always) no large families and people who BARGAIN BASEMENT my prices as they already very competitive.

name: Garden Retreat Northern Beaches
summary: The lovely sunny double brick ground floor apartment flows onto a 35 Sqm deck which then continues onto a secure yard with children's play equipment. Shade can be found under the magnolia, avocado or frangipani trees.  The bedrooms are large and the kitchen outlook is lovely.
space: Double brick sandstone and private garden apartment/home.  This is a piece of nature in the heart of one of Sydneys premium beach suburbs.  North East sun shines onto the entertaining deck and streams into the open plan dining/loungeroom.  kitchen looks out to lovely backyard.  The 2 x queen bedrooms are 4x4 with high ceilings and bedroom 3 has a day bed which can convert to a king bed and baby facilities.  Linen is provided.

neighborhood_overview: This apartment flows beyond its own picket fenced secure yard to further levels of grass and garden that lead to a creek front reserve.  It is like being in the country yet a 4 minute walk to a major shopping centre. The area is surrounded by beaches and cafes in every direction! Lakes, walks, bike tracks and even a local waterfall!
notes: There is a cottage nearby and an upstairs 4 bedroom apartment. However all 3 dwellings have been designed with privacy in mind.
transit: Public transport to the city can be caught 70 metres from our front gate. A 7 minute walk gets you to the buses to Palm beach and manly beach also.

house_rules: There is no Smoking permitted other than at the bottom of the property near the reserve. No large parties. Small function gatherings are permitted with notification to us and neighbours if deemed necessary.
host_about: We enjoy travel, our family and friends, the beach, music and home improving often using recycled materials. We hope you enjoy Best of Both Worlds 4 bedroom in the large top home, the Garden Retreat 3 bedroom or the quaint 2 bedroom cottage on the reserve/creek.  People always feel peace, safety and relaxation when they stay at this property of 'country' near the conveniences of northern beaches 'city'.

name: Potts Point: Lrg Mod Art Deco Apt, Walk Everywhere
summary: This large modern studio apartment (50 sqm) on Macleay Street is situated at the back of an art deco building with restaurants, shops, cafes, parks and public transport right on your door step.
space: If you can't find the dates you are after please look at my other properties all located very close to one another.   Cut and paste links into browser https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/7791178         (1BR - Potts Point) https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/9097926      (1BR - Darlinghurst) https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/21044299?s=51 (1BR Paddington) It's a modern styled apartment situated at the back of an Art Deco building overlooking Llankelly Place which is an pedestrian lane scattered with shops and cafes. Everything is at your door step in the perfectly located inner city neighborhood of Potts Point, East Sydney.   The apartment is spacious and very comfortably fits one or two people for any length of stay.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is centrally located in Sydney's village like setting of Potts Point.   Everything is in on your door step – Woolworths Supermarkets is located 150m from the apartment making it easy for you to stock up on groceries, laundromats and dry cleaners a few doors down, post office across the road and all majors banks and ATMs within 100m.   On the weekend, stroll over to the markets right across the road for all types of great stalls from fresh food, organic produce, vintage clothes, plants, & flowers to name a few. At night there is so much to see and do, restaurants, bars, nightclubs. Potts point really comes alive at night! You won't be sitting around.  I have become well accustomed to all the restaurants and bars in the area and supply a list on arrival  of places I highly recommend if you are lost for ideas during your stay. The building 'The Gordon' is a classic example of Art Deco architecture in a Potts Point.  The foyer and common areas are a little tired however re-fu
transit: You are extremely close to all public transport - Train (250m), bus (on door step) , taxi and car hire plus Go Get cars located perfectly at the building entrance.  Enjoy the best that Sydney has to offer all within easy reach - Bondi beach, the city, harbour-side parks, ferries and much more. In easy walking distance - city centre is a direct 20 min walk, or a leisurely 25 min walk along the harbour. Botanical Gardens are only 20 min walk away and 30 mins to the iconic Opera House.   The apartment is extremely easy to get to and from the airport via taxi (20-30 min), airport shuttle, or train.
interaction: You will enjoy the entire apartment to yourself during your stay.  If you do need assistance, I only live around the corner and can be reached either by email or phone.
house_rules: No parties, smoking or pets unfortunately.  Please treat my place as you would treat your own..
host_about:
Since I've had such great experiences with AirBnB, I thought it was only natural that I list my properties for visitors to Sydney. 

The inner eastern suburbs of Sydney  are swimming in good caffeine and food for that matter - any number of cuisines are available nearby as the area is scattered with amazing restaurants and cafes.  

The inner eastern suburbs is extremely central to what Sydney has to offer and has a great village feel to it.  I love living here and can't imagine living anywhere else and I hope for you to have the same experiences during your stay.

name: Artist Studio/Apartment in Dee Why, Sydney
space: We offer for rent the self contained top floor of our house. There are two bedrooms. One with a double queen bed, and the other with two single beds. There is a pool on the downstairs terrace, to share with the owners. We are looking to rent for the period from 3 July - 28 July. We are @ 7 min walk from the Dee Why beach. High speed internet is included. We are a Dutch, French and Australian family. We love hosting  people form different cultures and backgrounds and have had many so far.

hopefully, Till soon,

Godelieve

name: Spacious 2-Bed Unit, 5 Min Walk to Bondi Beach
summary: Welcome to my spacious apartment located in one of Sydney's most famous suburbs. Guests can enjoy a quick walk to both Bondi and Tamarama Beach. Located in an Art-Deco building and featuring wood floors and high ceilings, it's the ideal place to enjoy summer in Sydney. There are also plenty of scrumptious cafes and restaurants for you to try as well as a bus station nearby connecting you to the rest of Sydney. My place is perfect for solo travellers, families and business travellers alike.
space: IDEAL LOCATION. Enjoy the comfort of having your own apartment at the iconic Bondi Beach. We like our guests to make the most out there stay so we make sure to leave useful local tips and in-house entertainment.  - Located in a very convenient area in the lively Bondi Road, minutes away from the beach, next door to coffee shops, groceries shops and public transport. On Bondi Rd you will find many eateries and high quality restaurants. neighborhood_overview: A distinct neighbourhood that hugs Bondi Road, this small pocket is all about shopping, eating and drinking. Whole foods and organic produce are at the core of most menus. Only a short stroll to world famous Bondi Beach and offering quick access to Sydney’s CBD, Bondi will always be in high demand. (Sitchu)
notes: My place is located on Bondi Road so there is potential for a little street noise.
transit: Very close to bus stations and a 20-minute walk to the Bondi Junction train station. Public Transportation:  - The 333 bus line will take you into Sydney's CBD within 30 to 40 minutes depending on the traffic.  - The 380 and 381 will both bring you to Bondi Junction where you will find the massive Westfield Shopping centre.  - Bondi Junction Train Station links you to the CityRail network and is just a 10 minute trip by bus.
access: You will have private access to the entire apartment.
interaction: The best way to stay in touch is via Airbnb. My support team will be happy to answer all your questions before and during your stay.
house_rules: - This is my home, please treat it as if it were yours, as well! - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. - No parties and no smoking. If you disrespect that rule there will be penalty fees up to $300. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, an $80 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a (up to) $300 fee will apply. - Please double check doors are locked each time you leave. - To reduce our carbon footprint, we ask that lights, heaters, fans, TVs and other electrical devices please be turned off when not being utilised and when checking out of the house - Please make sure the dishes and kitchen are clear before you leave, and leave the house in a tidy condition as you found it.
host_about: Lucky to be a Bondi Beach resident and looking forward to meet you in the future!

name: Serenity Bondi Beach stay
summary: In sought after Central Bondi Beach Serenity is a spacious, cosy and serene cottage, with elegance & comfort in mind.
space: Serenity in sought after Central Bondi Beach is a spacious, cosy and serene home, with elegance & comfort in mind.  Situated on the corner of Roscoe Street & O'Brien, it's a stones throw away from the famous 'Bondi Beach'. Comprising of two large bedrooms both with queen size beds and built ins. The second bedroom has an additional desk and enough space to set up a comfortable onsite camping mattress, great for kids yet equally comfortable for adults.  Large open plan renovated fully equipped kitchen, dining and lounge. Full modern bathroom with tub and separate shower. Separate study area overlooks large sunny, private backyard (unfortunately the spa has been broken and is currently being removed) and outdoor entertaining area garden deck area. laundry facilities with washer and dryer. The décor is sumptuous yet tasteful throughout with timber floors, renovated kitchen and bathroom.  The beach & shops, cafes, restaurants, bars, markets & nightlife of Bondi Beach are a 1 minute walk aw

name: Great Location, Paris End,  Potts Point Sydney
summary: This immaculate apartment is private, modern and recently renovated, on the second floor of a beautiful historic Art Deco building. Surrounded by the best restaurants, cafes, scenic destinations, leafy quiet parks and nightlife, Potts Point is the Ideal location to explore Sydney.
space: This beautiful  apartment is private, modern and recently renovated, on the second floor of a beautiful historic Art Deco building. It is fully furnished with large windows that allow lots of natural light and airflow. The apartment has unlimited high speed Wi-Fi throughout the entire space. We've also provided the basics in terms of kitchen and bathroom essentials for your convenience. There is a secure door to enter the apartment complex, complete with intercom. The apartment is tucked away in a quiet leafy street not far from the bustling life of Potts Point and Kings Cross. In Potts Point, you are close to everything. It is brimming with little cafes, great restaurants, bars and bookshops. This apartment is the perfect location for both business or leisure. Train, bus and taxi services are literally a minute walk away, there is a supermarket and mall (with secure ATMs) less than a 10 minute walk from the apartment, and if you wander around the surrounding streets, you will certainl

It is brimming with little cafes, great restaurants, bars and bookshops. This apartment
neighborhood_overview: Potts Point has undergone a huge transformation to become one of the trendiest, most appealing neighbourhoods in Sydney. It's one of the most sought-after areas and best-kept secrets in the city, and around every corner is something incredible to do or see.  The neighbourhood is full of Art Deco apartment blocks, terraces squeezed between multi-level buildings, as well as small, quaint and intriguing cafes, bars and boutique shops. Leafy, tree-lined streets alternate between avenues full of bustling life.  The location of our apartment is convenient to everything. Surrounded by fine dining restaurants, quirky bars and antique and retro shops. The organic fresh farmer market is held every weekend and both Woolworths and Harris Farm are close by. The Kings Cross train station is an easy 10 minute walk and the Sydney CBD, Opera House, Botanical Gardens and Rushcutters Bay are all within walking distance.
transit: One of the best things about Potts Point is how close it is to everything.  The nearest train station (Kings Cross) is a 10 minute walk away, where you can get to Bondi, the CBD, or any of the suburban train lines. To get to the CBD, it's a leisurely 15 minute stroll, or a four minute train ride from Kings Cross Train Station. Rushcutters Bay Park is also less than a 10 minute walk away; one of the best-kept secrets in Sydney for an afternoon walk, picnic, or bottle of wine at the bay. You can also easily walk to the Circular Quay/Opera House Precinct, Australian Museum, Royal Botanical Gardens, Historical Woolloomooloo and the Rocks Area. In fact, most of Sydney's best tourist sites are incredibly close to the apartment! GETTING TO/FROM AIRPORT  – Taxi/Uber is probably the easiest/quickest option, approx. 20 minute in light traffic, costing around $35.  – Otherwise, there are various shuttle bus services that leave from the Main International and Domestic Terminals (to get to the apar
access: Guests will be able to access the entire apartment, including the built-in wardrobe with hangers. The washing machine and dryer is located in a shared laundry accessed on the ground floor ($2.00 per load).
interaction: We want you love the apartment and surrounding area as much as we do! It has everything you will need for a comfortable stay, and is professionally cleaned to a high standard between guests.  I am contactable by email and phone, so please feel free to get in touch if you need anything at all!
house_rules: This apartment is my home, so I invite you to treat it as your home too. It is a quite building, so I would ask for no parties or smoking please.
host_about: I am a Sydney based artist. I travel regularly and have a appreciation for finding a "home away from home" when travelling.

name: Woollahra/double bay1
summary: This bright modern house is perfect for your trips to beach or city, by train or ferry or bus.  You are invited to socialise with others or enjoy your privacy in the leafy garden. The room has a queen bed and own TV and balcony.  Breakfast is included.  Only very occasional use of kitchen and laundry is encouraged as these are busy areas! space: Hi, Being an avid traveller I have stayed airbnb so I know your needs! very happy to host you and show you my exciting city... My home is just 10 mins by bus,ferry or train from the city, Bondi beach, Double Bay and Bondi Junction. Both shops and transport are just a 10 minute walk away. Woollahra is a luxurious suburb with exciting coffee shops, fashion shops in the famous Queen Street, beautiful parks for meditation and walks, friendly and safe. The house offers free wireless, easy parking, a great sustainable garden with barbeque and lots of seating. The kitchen is fully equipped.  I offer you unlimited tea and coffee, breakfast and surprise treats!  and my last guests have also scored a few family dinners.  The bedroom is sunny and large with your own balcony, television and fridge. You would share a bathroom with other guests if there are any, otherwise it would be all yours. notes: Absolutely no smoking on the premises please. And the use of the home as an office is discouraged.

access: Garden, living room, occasional use of kitchen in the evening, 2 bathrooms.

Prefer limited use of kitchen and no use of kitchen after 8 pm Please be respectful - no showers after 10pm..  please use water wisely, short showers and sensible use when using the basin - I'm a raging conservationist!!!  not really, but we should have an awareness of water's preciousness! Laugh a lot
host_about:
Active epicure  Ardent traveller People eater
I have been a French teacher, English to migrant teacher, many other things but now I have a catering business and work from home making delicious smells.
I've been living in Oz for 40 or more years, originally from UK...
Spend my leisure scuba diving, walking, gym, gardening, swimming and lots of theatre... in fact anything that's on offer! 
I especially love travelling, music festivals around the world and meeting new people.  I guess my motto is to work hard, play hard!
I really enjoy meeting all my happy guests, showing them my favourite places and just being there for them.  We learn so much from each other.

Of course I am sensitive to your privacy, and there if you need more wine!

space: Welcome to beachside paradise! A beautiful beachside villa in Bundeena with waterfront access and gorgeous views of Port Hacking, overlooking Gunyah Beach - a swimming, snorkeling and boating paradise. A perfect spot for sun and water lovers! The Villa This newly built villa sleeps up to six adults. It has two double bedrooms on the upper level, one with a large ensuite. The floor to ceiling glass doors in each bedroom open on to a terrace enabling a complete indoor/outdoor environment. The master bedroom has a free-standing two person bath overlooking Port Hacking. Adjustable skylights and air-conditioning create a comfortable living and sleeping atmosphere. There is a third bedroom on the lower floor, also with an open fireplace. The lower floor also comprises a large open kitchen/living/dining area with polished concrete flooring, an open fireplace and new appliances, with floor to ceiling glass doors opening to a sunny grassed area. There is also a boat slab barbequ

house_rules: TERMS & CONDITIONS:  Note: Variances can be agreed on but only by arrangement with the owner in writing. Please note our "NO PETS & NO PARTIES" policy. Full payment is due immediately to secure the booking.  Payment of the rental constitutes the clients acceptance of these Terms and Conditions. If not received, the owner has the right to cancel the booking and attempt to re let it. Cancellation if caused by the client:  Once money is paidm it is not refundable unless the house is re-let for the entire period. If a refund is made due to the property being re let then a $50 cancellation fee will apply. The owners will make every effort to ensure the property is available as booked. However the owners reserve the right to make alterations to bookings due to unforeseen circumstances. To maintain a good standard for our guests we require certain conditions to be complied with. We appreciate most will respect our property but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following conditio
host_about: Hi I'm Christian, welcome to Bundeena NSW! I like fishing, surfing and kayaking - actually all water sports! I live with my family in this truly spectacular part of the world. I look forward to sharing it with you!

name: Beachside Coogee 2 bed apartment
summary: Our gorgeous home is ideally situated on a quiet street with beach, famous coastal walk, park, BBQs, playground, ocean pools, shops and buses only minutes away.
space: Our gorgeous home is ideally situated on a quiet street with beach, famous coastal walk, park, BBQs, playground, ocean pools, shops and buses only minutes away. It is just a short bus ride to the University of NSW. The apartment has lofty 10-foot ceilings with beautiful hard wood polished floor boards in the lounge room and kitchen. There is super soft New Zealand pure wool carpet in the bedroom so that your feet will feel on holiday too. The lounge room is North facing so our apartment is filled with light throughout the day which is just lovely. In the afternoon the breeze from the ocean flows from the lounge room through the apartment and out through the kitchen. There is a cosy bay window seat (big enough to nap on) in the lounge room with loads of comfortable cushions for your relaxation. There is a dining table in the lounge room or if you prefer you can eat up on the rooftop terrace. There is a 1950s sofa that has been recently refurbished and converts into a large single bed. W

neighborhood_overview: Across the road is a French Café (open every day except Tuesdays), convenience store (open 7 days until 9pm), a manicure/pedicure specialist and a laundromat. On the other side of the block (1 minute walk) you will find a hairdresser, beautician, and Thai restaurant (open 7 days). It is a 5-7 minute walk to all the action on Coogee Bay Road, which offers a wide variety of cafés and restaurants for your culinary pleasure. There are all the shops you could need including a supermarket, green grocer, bottle shop, pharmacies, surf shops and Thai massage. The famous Coogee Bay Hotel with its beer garden is right on the waterfront just 5 minutes walk away. We are one block (3-5 minute walk) from the beach, parks, a large children's playground, the stunning and famous coastal walk (you can walk north to Bondi or south to Maroubra), ocean pools including Wylies Baths, the Women's and Children's Baths and Coogee Life Saving public pool. There are BBQ facilities all within the same walking dista
transit: 1 minute walk to a bus stop with buses going to the City, Bondi, Randwick, Drummoyne and the University of NSW.
access: Guests will have private access to the entire apartment.
interaction: We will leave you to enjoy our apartment in private.
house_rules: No smoking. No pets. No late/loud parties. No loud music. Copies of guests' ID (drivers licence/passport) will be taken upon arrival. Apartment to be left clean and tidy in the state in which it was found. Pay for any breakages. There is a 'manual' in the apartment to show you how to use the internet, TV, washing machine, etc. Please follow these instructions. Close and lock the doors and windows on leaving. Please close the windows when it rains.
host_location: Lane Cove, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I have taken many trips overseas since my first at the age of 18 in 1988 to most continents, and am an avid traveller. My travel highlight was taking the train from London to Beijing via Moscow and Ulaanbaatar with my partner in 2008.

We now have a wonderful 8 year old son and 6 year old daughter. We travelled to New Zealand when our son was 5 months old, and had a great time despite being in Christchurch for the earthquake! We also travelled to Europe and Thailand when he was one year old. The four of us travelled to Hong Kong and Europe in July/August 2004 and we headed back to Europe, this time via Japan in May/June 2018. 

As guests we are quiet and respectful and will treat your place like our own.
