name: Best of Both Worlds North Narrabeen
summary: This comfortably furnished home is a relaxing retreat. Large living room is perfect for family connection, plenty of comfortable seating with a relaxed light and bright 'beachy' atmosphere.  Front entertaining courtyard is fantastic for entertaining and has total privacy from the driveway and the Cottage and Garden Retreat which are not even visible. There is also a private back sundeck. NB:  We also can direct you to excellent and well priced  overseas accommodation . Weekly apartment bookings
space: Beautiful, light, sunny, peaceful apartment looking out to treetops.  Level entry with parking and 30 metres to city transport, local shopping centre and childrens park.  Waterfall and wetlands reserve creek walk is in 2 different directions starting 5 houses away.  20 minutes walk to nearest surf beach.   This is the large upstairs house, there is a seperate sandstone 3 bedroom apartment underneath and a cottage further down the property, all on 1100 sqm of grass and garden backing onto reserve park and creek.  House is on top level with its own parking area, private courtyard and sunny balcony.   Large kitchen, bathroom and 50sqm living area along with 4 comfortable bedrooms, 1 with en-suite. The apartment has wireless internet and timber floors throughout.   PLEASE NOTE: **There is also a lovely 2 bedroom cottage on the property which gives full access to bottom levels of yard if required for a larger family group, retreat or organised event.  However it is rented by many of our gue
description: This comfortably furnished home is a relaxing retreat. Large living room is perfect for family connection, plenty of comfortable seating with a relaxed light and bright 'beachy' atmosphere.  Front entertaining courtyard is fantastic for entertaining and has total privacy from the driveway and the Cottage and Garden Retreat which are not even visible. There is also a private back sundeck. NB:  We also can direct you to excellent and well priced  overseas accommodation . Weekly apartment bookings Beautiful, light, sunny, peaceful apartment looking out to treetops.  Level entry with parking and 30 metres to city transport, local shopping centre and childrens park.  Waterfall and wetlands reserve creek walk is in 2 different directions starting 5 houses away.  20 minutes walk to nearest surf beach.   This is the large upstairs house, there is a seperate sandstone 3 bedroom apartment underneath and a cottage further down the property, all on 1100 sqm of grass and garden backing onto reserve
neighborhood_overview: Beach, walks, sunshine, long lazy barbecuues, friendly neighbours and yet a sense of the local shopping, cafes and outdoor activities that make a holiday so much fun.  We are surrounded by the relaxiing lovely outlook of bush and nature.
notes: On request we can supply baby and children toys and books, porta cot, potty, feeding chair, stroller and beach equipment.   We have a very extensive selection of books, dvds, videos and games for those rainy days or for those who find just lying around a perfect holiday.
transit: While the outlook from the living, kitchen & sundeck helps you feel like you are in the middle  of the country with a nearby beach, the entry has quick access to all.  Main shopping complex 3 minute walk and buses to the city a 60 metre walk away. Taxi from the airport is between $100-$170 however it is worth looking into Northern  beaches aIrport shuttle options which may work out more economical.  Car hire is an option with about a 45 minute drive north to the beaches - along the way you will see the Opera House and drive across the famous Harbour Bridge.  Alternatively a train can be caught direct from the airport and we can arrange pickup from Chatswood or Gordon Station on Sydneys North Shore for $60 per group of 4 however the train fare will likely have already cost $15 per person. Or you could catch a train to Wynyard Station and then the L85 bus direct to the house from outside of the Menzies hotel in the city.  This would best suit those with limited luggage.
access: You will have sole and direct street access to the parking in the front of the property and the private courtyard that can be locked.  There is also a smaller seperate courtyard off one of the front bedrooms if you plan on hiding from the children!  It has a safe high pool fence lock with external access but can also be locked. If you would like to wander to the reserve and creek at the bottom of the property please email or call for access details once here. We are in the process of creating a large entertaining area at the bottom of the property.
interaction: We are available via telephone or email contact if guests require anything however we tend to minimise our presence so you may not meet us at check in or during your stay. Alternatively if you are wanting an 'Aussie' at home cultural experience let us know and we can facilitate a 'barbecue package' or beach trip including 'summer bay' tour to Palm beach and ferry to the Ettalong markets and cinema on the beautiful Central Coast north of Sydney. We can also coordinate hair and make up pampers on a boat in the Pittwater at Newport.
house_rules: *Smoking strictly in front courtyard only *No animals without prior consent *No large group parties only special events with prior permission *No hard soled shoes or heels on floorboards Have a relaxing rest, fun, enjoy the sun, nature, walks, shopping, dining and beaches
host_about: We enjoy travel, our family and friends, the beach, music and home improving often using recycled materials. We hope you enjoy Best of Both Worlds 4 bedroom in the large top home, the Garden Retreat 3 bedroom or the quaint 2 bedroom cottage on the reserve/creek.  People always feel peace, safety and relaxation when they stay at this property of 'country' near the conveniences of northern beaches 'city'.

name: Loft Style Apartment in Sydney
space: Loft Style Apartement in Sydney's trendiest suburb.  On the border of Redfern and Surry Hills this great apartment is located in a spanish style 2 story block surrounding a leafy tropical courtyard.  Great Character.  Great Location. The (phone number hidden) buses leave every 10 minutes to the City and Circular Quay via Hyde Park and the M20 leaves every 20 minutes towards Central Station and Chinatown. Only a short walk to Moore Park which leads onto Fox Studios, The Entertainment Quarter and Centennial Park. Surry Hills itself is renowned for its stylish eateries and funky cafes, with vintage clothing stores and eclectic shopping.  Redfern in recent years has taken over in the hip and trendy department as far as eateries, cafes and bars. Redfern is where Sydney's nightlife is now hopping.  With the Crystal Street Shopping depot at your door step.  Within 2 min walking distance there are 2 x Supermarkets, Pharmacy, Bakery, Cafes and Newsagents available.  The apartment is close enoug

neighborhood_overview: Close to Redfern and Surry Hills both trendy and hip Sydney suburbs. Quick bus ride to city. Walk to Centennial Park.
transit: There are three buses that take you straight into the city from Baptist St. M20 take you straight to central and Darling Harbour from across the road on Phillip St.
access: Full use of apartment.
interaction: Available online or via text for duration of stay.
house_rules: You break it - you fix it or replace it. Smoking on Balcony or in Common areas only. Please remove your dirty sheets from the bed post your stay.
host_about:
I am a single parent in Sydney with a split level loft style apartment in Redfern. During the major holidays I always get out of town and look to rent my home out for the duration of my holidays.  My home is cosy and clean and has everything you'd need for a comfortable holiday in Sydney's vibrant City.
When I book accommodation through airbnb for my own holidays - I do always travel with my young son.  He is a great kid and really very well behaved but he is a kid so the accom I look for would have to be child friendly.

name: Woollahra/double bay2
summary: This bright modern 4 bedroom house is within 20 mins of the city or beach. Woollahra is a trendy, smart suburb abounding with coffee shops and parks.l invite you to share healthy breakfasts with other guests or in the leafy garden. There is a queen bed, ample wardrobe space, a computer work station and it is bright and sunny.  There are other rooms also to accommodate a family or couples holidaying together. Please, no use of the home as an office.
space: Hi, Being an avid traveller I am very happy to host you and show you my exciting city from this leafy suburb of Woollahra... my home is just 10 mins by bus or train from the city, Bondi beach. Double Bay and Bondi Junction. Both shops and transport just a10 minute walk away. Woollahra is a luxurious suburb with exciting coffee shops, fashion shops in the famous Queen Street, beautiful parks for meditation and walks, friendly and safe. The house offers free wireless,free and  easy parking, a great sustainable garden with barbeque and lots of seating. You are welcome to help yourself to a great salad fresh from the garden. The brand new kitchen is fully equipped.  I offer you unlimited tea and coffee and surprise treats!   The bedrooms are sunny and large with a queen bed. You would share a bathroom with other guests if there are any, otherwise it would be all yours.  The lounge/dining room are great relaxing spaces with television and lots of greenery to look at.  I can provide a cooked

neighborhood_overview: The charm of queen street  Proximity to a swim Rainforest park Level 10 min walk to Double Bay, touch of Europe and a ferry to city in 10 mins. Easy access to all transport if you're happy to walk 8 mins, or bus at bottom of street to city.
notes: Occasionally I look after a dog. Free tea, coffee, meals or treats.
transit: Parking at the door. Bus on street to stations and shops. Walking around is very safe at all times.
access: You will enjoy your own spacious bedroom, shared bathroom if there are other guests, brand new kitchen and living room, garden and bbq.   Absolutely no smoking on the premises please. Only 2 guests per room please
interaction: I am often available to show you around, what I call "added value" above the hotel hospitality. Lifts to ferry and bus or beach are frequent. There is a large information folder of "what's on in Sydney"
house_rules: no smoking please free access to tea/freshly ground coffee, breakfast etc The occasional use of kitchen OK but prefer not every evening. I'd appreciate considerate use of water - a precious commodity - short showers and conscious use at the sink!! laugh a lot please be respectful - no showers or dinners after 10pm Maximum 2 guests per room
host_about:
Active epicure  Ardent traveller People eater
I have been a French teacher, English to migrant teacher, many other things but now I have a catering business and work from home making delicious smells.
I've been living in Oz for 40 or more years, originally from UK...
Spend my leisure scuba diving, walking, gym, gardening, swimming and lots of theatre... in fact anything that's on offer! 
I especially love travelling, music festivals around the world and meeting new people.  I guess my motto is to work hard, play hard!
I really enjoy meeting all my happy guests, showing them my favourite places and just being there for them.  We learn so much from each other.

Of course I am sensitive to your privacy, and there if you need more wine!

name: Woollahra/Double bay3
summary: This modern bright 4 bedroom home is in a leafy safe suburb yet just 10 mins walk to  trains, buses and ferry.  The ferry is just 10 mins to Circular Quay, the train just 7 mins to the city, the bus just 8 mins to Bondi beach. The use of the house as an office/workplace is discouraged.
space: Hi, Being an avid traveller I am very happy to host you and show you my exciting city...having stayed with airbnb hosts I understand your needs also... my home is just 10 mins by bus or train from the city, Bondi beach. Double Bay and Bondi Junction. Both shops and transport just a 10 minute walk away. Woollahra is a luxurious suburb with exciting coffee shops, fashion shops in the famous Queen Street, beautiful parks for meditation and walks, friendly and safe. The house offers free wireless, easy parking, a great sustainable garden with barbeque and lots of seating with morning sun for a smiley breakfast.  The brand new kitchen is fully equipped but I ask you to respect my working space as I'm a caterer.  I offer you unlimited tea and coffee and surprise treats!  and my last guests have also scored a few family dinners !   You may help yourself to fresh garden produce!  The bedroom is sunny and large, with a queen size bed and large wardrobe and desk, a library of books on Australia

The house offers free wireless, easy parking, a great sustainable garden with barbeque and lots of seating with morning sun for a smiley breakfast.  The brand new kitchen is fully equipped but I ask you to respect my working space as I'm a catere
neighborhood_overview: I love the safety, the proximity to many beaches and also the city. The rainforest park Queen street village Buzzy cafe on my street
notes: The ferry is just 10 mins to Circular Quay, the train just 7 mins to the city, the bus just 8 mins to Bondi beach. The advantage of staying in this central but not city or beach area is that you can explore north/south/east/west with ease! The neighbourhood is smart, safe and very social. If you're a jogger or walker, I'm surrounded by lovely parks and yes, it's a hilly area so nice and challenging! If you have an issue with hills don't stay here!!! I live near the bottom of a short but steep hill . It is necessary to walk 10 mins  gently uphill to Bondi Junction and its transport hub. Or a level 10 min walk to Double Bay also takes you to the city by ferry or bus.
transit: Buses, trains and ferries are all within 10 mins.
access: Guests may have limited use of all the facilities, occasional evening access to the kitchen .  Lounge room, garden and fridge space available.
interaction: I am very sensitive to the needs of my guests - happy to drive you around, share my secrets and friends, or just "disappear"!
house_rules: no smoking in house free to help yourselves to all hot drinks, treats and breakfast goodies.  Prefer only occasional use of kitchen in the evenings. please be respectful after 10pm - no showers, dinners etc
host_about:
Active epicure  Ardent traveller People eater
I have been a French teacher, English to migrant teacher, many other things but now I have a catering business and work from home making delicious smells.
I've been living in Oz for 40 or more years, originally from UK...
Spend my leisure scuba diving, walking, gym, gardening, swimming and lots of theatre... in fact anything that's on offer! 
I especially love travelling, music festivals around the world and meeting new people.  I guess my motto is to work hard, play hard!
I really enjoy meeting all my happy guests, showing them my favourite places and just being there for them.  We learn so much from each other.

Of course I am sensitive to your privacy, and there if you need more wine!

name: Modern Spacious  1bdrm Apartment !!
space: We have a wonderful 1 bdrm apartment that is fully self contained . You will have 1 bdrm with queen bed and comfy mattress , bedside tables and built in wardrobes , lovely big windows and ceiling fan . The bedroom will accomodate a child as well and we have portable blow up mattress available .  Fully equipped kitchen with modern cooktop and oven , microwave , fridge , freezer . Just purchased a new Espresso machine for the kitchen !! Brand new 26" TV with DVD player in bedroom !!  Large bathroom with toilet , shower and vanity basin plus loads of storage , hairdryer provided . Living room off kitchen with  42' Plasma TV , ADSL wireless internet plus computer provided , lounge and ceiling fan . Foxtel Cable TV Platinum package .You will also have a washing machine and dryer , Iron and Ironing Board . Our apartment is beautiful and bright , living areas have porcelain tiles while the bedroom has soft carpet , it is also fully air conditioned throughout . We have a lovely home that is qu
description: We have a wonderful 1 bdrm apartment that is fully self contained . You will have 1 bdrm with queen bed and comfy mattress , bedside tables and built in wardrobes , lovely big windows and ceiling fan . The bedroom will accomodate a child as well and we have portable blow up mattress available .  Fully equipped kitchen with modern cooktop and oven , microwave , fridge , freezer . Just purchased a new Espresso machine for the kitchen !! Brand new 26" TV with DVD player in bedroom !!  Large bathroom with toilet , shower and vanity basin plus loads of storage , hairdryer provided . Living room off kitchen with  42' Plasma TV , ADSL wireless internet plus computer provided , lounge and ceiling fan . Foxtel Cable TV Platinum package .You will also have a washing machine and dryer , Iron and Ironing Board . Our apartment is beautiful and bright , living areas have porcelain tiles while the bedroom has soft carpet , it is also fully air conditioned throughout . We have a lovely home that is qu
neighborhood_overview: We live in a beautiful neighbourhood , we have tree lined streets and beautiful well cared for homes . We live opposite a reserve and we have walking tracks just opposite us and wide open spaces if you wish to exercise  . There are also 2 shopping centres very close by and you can be sure that you can find anything you wish for . Many restuarants plus Cinema Complex at the shopping centre .
transit: We have a great Bus Service that runs every 10 minutes or so , more often during peak periods . The Bus will take you to the City and back and almost anywhere you wish to go to .
access: You will have access to your very private apartment .  Foxtel Cable TV  Platinum Package . Our beautiful Community Swimming Pool , Spa , Barbeque area and Tennis Court . Internet ADSL is complimentary .
interaction: We interact as much or as little as you like . Peter and I like to give our guests complete privacy but we are happy to help out and chat . We are almost always available and can be contacted by phone , email , text or a simple knock on our door .
house_rules: No smoking indoors but smoking allowed out side with ashtrays provided  . Parties and loud music would not be suitable .
host_about:
We are a couple in our 50's , we have a large home and an empty apartment that we would love to fill with travellers who are looking for  a comfortable place to stay . Peter and I have travelled through europe several times and Asia frequently , we loved Venice , Turkey , France and Spain ....our favourite food is Italian !! 
We are easy going and easy to negotiate with , we would like you to feel like you have a home away from home , be it a short stay or a longer stay , maybe a base for you to use whilst traveeling through Australia . We live in a beautiful area with many Parks and tree lined streets  , walking tracks , new Shopping Centres , Churches and every convenience ....we love our home and where we live !! 
We would love to welcome you into our home whilst you are enjoying our beautiful country .

name: Rainforest garden apartment - deck
summary: Fabulous location for  travellers and business people working in the CBD of Sydney or North Sydney. Transport very close with even the ability to walk either to the city or North Sydney.
space: Charming apartment with one room to rent, 5 minutes walk to Kirribilli Village with great choice of restaurants, cafes, small supermarkets and boutique shops.  5 minutes walk to Sydney Harbour Bridge, a ferry to the city or train to the city or suburbs. 2 minutes walk to a bus into the city, harbour foreshore and the Ensemble Theatre.  Added bonus is the rainforest garden and outdoor deck. Kirribilli is across the harbour from the CBD, so you can easily avail yourself of the transport or get some exercise walking across the bridge - spectacular.  There are beautiful harbour foreshore walks from here too in different directions   There is a charming single room for one person with a bathroom to share.  Wifi is available, along with landline to Australian phone numbers.  Digital TV is there for your enjoyment but with local entertainment being abundant, I doubt it will be necessary.   How often can you enjoy a rainforest garden so close to the CBD of a fabulous city?
description: Fabulous location for  travellers and business people working in the CBD of Sydney or North Sydney. Transport very close with even the ability to walk either to the city or North Sydney. Charming apartment with one room to rent, 5 minutes walk to Kirribilli Village with great choice of restaurants, cafes, small supermarkets and boutique shops.  5 minutes walk to Sydney Harbour Bridge, a ferry to the city or train to the city or suburbs. 2 minutes walk to a bus into the city, harbour foreshore and the Ensemble Theatre.  Added bonus is the rainforest garden and outdoor deck. Kirribilli is across the harbour from the CBD, so you can easily avail yourself of the transport or get some exercise walking across the bridge - spectacular.  There are beautiful harbour foreshore walks from here too in different directions   There is a charming single room for one person with a bathroom to share.  Wifi is available, along with landline to Australian phone numbers.  Digital TV is there for your enjo
neighborhood_overview: Kirribilli is a wonderful neighbourhood with a delightful village feel - great coffee shops, with a terrific choice of local restaurants and bars - seafood, Asian, modern Australian, burgers - all very close to the harbour.
transit: For the immediate village walking is the best mode of transport, but for ventures further afield you can walk, ferry, train or bus it and then the airport is only 15-20 minutes by car and 30 -40 minutes by train.
access: Guests have access to the entire apartment apart from the master bedroom.
interaction: I'm happy to orientate my guests to the area and Sydney in general, and should the opportunity arise I am happy to introduce them to hidden treasures of Sydney. Chatting over the odd glass of wine is always a bonus for both guest and host.
house_rules: No smoking and please be careful placing glasses on furniture surfaces - there are plenty of coasters for such use.   Breakfast prepared for you and served in the rain forest garden, weather permitting - homemade granola, a variety of breads and fruit along with tea or coffee and juice. All very pleasant indeed.
host_about:
I am a single woman, who is now retired from paid work.  I now do a bit of volunteer work and spend time connecting with friends old and new, and play boules and mahjong when I can.  I am also enjoying discovering walks in various parts of Sydney - I am amazed how I can be delighted by new discoveries in the city of my birth. All the better informed for guests from out of town. 
I have lived and travelled extensively - San Francisco, Tokyo, Saigon and outside of London when I was a child.  Love to travel and meet new people, particularly those from other places.  Have travelled in Asia, and a bit in Europe. Love Italy and la dolce vita.  Have seen quite a bit of the US (my dad took me to New York for my 14th birthday!!) and been on safari in Africa but not made it to other continents yet.  
Can't imagine life without friends, good spicy food and the prospect of another travel adventure.  Have backpacked, and travelled in style, kayaked down rivers and even hiked the Kokoda Track sharing a backpack with my boyfriend of the time.  I continue to travel now with perhaps the focus being on catching up with beloved friends all over the world from the days of living and working overseas.
Now prefer softer options along with a good bottle of wine, delicious food of the region wherever, classical music or some great rock.
Age is a state of mind rather than the years lived, and it is good to be able to look backwards and forwards.
I love meeting people through airbnb - different chats over a glass of wine and if the opportunity arises showing them the lesser known beauty of Sydney.

name: Top Floor Apartment Steps To Darling Harbour & ICC
summary: Positioned within walking distance to Darling Harbour & ICC, on a quiet sunny street that will instantly make you feel welcome. This sunny top floor split level apartment is the perfect place for your next city visit. From the high ceilings, polished timber floors throughout, generous bedroom with queen bed and large kitchen, this apartment is not only spacious and comfortable but is also located in a quiet boutique building.

neighborhood_overview: Ultimo and nearby Pyrmont are ideally located for walking access to the city and Darling Harbour, as well as nearby Glebe. There are a wide range of local attractions in walking distance from the apartment including great cafes, restaurants and bars, the Powerhouse Museum, the Acquatic Centre with full pool and gym facilities, the fish market and the Star Casino. There are great walks around the Harbour Foreshore and parkland at Pyrmont.
notes: When you arrive at the property you will find a kitchen and bathroom welcome pack with travel size amenities to ensure you do not need to head to the shops on your first day. We also provide top quality linen and towels. Extra services: - Early check-in and late check-out are available at an extra cost subject to availability. Please request at the time of booking - Cleaning services are available during your stay at additional cost, just let us know and we'll get it organised for you  Copyright © MadeComfy. transit: Ferries to the city leave from directly out front, buses to other suburbs from around the corner. I highly recommend using ride sharing service Uber. Check out the TripGo app for transport timetables.
access: You’ll have access to the entire property when you stay here, so it will feel like your own home.
house_rules: - Self check-in with Lockbox - Please keep noise level at a minimum between 10pm-8am in consideration to our neighbours. Excessive noise could lead to an on-the-spot AUD500 fine and/or eviction of the property

name: Private Art Deco Garden Apartment
summary: This is a lovely bright, quiet and sunny art deco apartment close to absolutely everything.
space: This stylish art deco semi-sized apartment is set on the ground floor of a boutique security block of 4. It features a large shared garden at the rear as well as a sunroom. The apartment has original polished timber floors and high ornate ceilings and a garden outlook from every room. It's north facing with lots of large windows so it is very bright and light.  The apartment block is set on a leafy quiet residential street and Bondi Junction's retail hub is only a short 5 min walk where you will find great cafes, restaurants, banks, Westfield Shopping complex with luxury shopping and a multiplex cinema.  It's a 15 min walk to stunning beaches (Bondi, Bronte, Tamarama) from where you can do the world famous Bondi to Bronte coastal walk. You can also walk to beautiful Centennial Park. We have two bikes that you are welcome to borrow. The Bondi Junction transit interchange (buses and train station) is a 5 minute walk away and from there it's a 6 min train ride into the CBD. Features: Two

interaction: I will be away during your stay but am always contactable.

host_about: I live with my husband Marc in our Bondi garden apartment. We absolutely love living in the eastern suburbs of Sydney and spend our time going to the beach, cooking at home, exercising in Centennial Park, having BBQs, eating out and catching up with friends and family. There is so much to see and do in Sydney and the weather is generally always pretty good so you can enjoy the outdoors. Our apartment has a lovely feel to it and is in a nice central location yet still very quiet and private so you get the best of both worlds. If you're thinking about coming to Sydney, do it. AirBnB is the perfect way to experience this beautiful city. We love travelling and meeting new people and look forward to hosting you in our home.

name: Large creative 1 bedroom flat @Bondi Beach
space: Just 2 blocks from Bondi Beach and less to your morning coffee, this spacious apartment is on the first floor of a ninety-year old character block of four, Accommodation consists of a large bedroom with a wonderfully comfortable queen size bed leading to a sun room which is set up with workspace.  The large fully equipped eat in kitchen leads onto a balcony and outdoor dining area shaded by trees. The interior of the apartment is creative and comfortable while retaining abundant character with ten foot ceilings, designer furniture, beautiful art and other items picked up by the owners on their travels. Plenty of cafes, supermarkets and Bondi's main shopping precinct is less than 5 minutes walk away so you are right next to it but far enough away to ensure a good night's sleep. I'll supply plenty of local information to ensure you have a perfect for a visit to Sydney. Buses to the city are less than 5 minutes walk away. 20 minutes from the airport by taxi.

neighborhood_overview: Close to cafes and beach in one direction.  Close to supermarkets, restaurants, Bondi village with everything you need for day and evening entertainment  Ten minutes up the hills to full shopping precinct at Bondi Junction. Walk to nearby swimming holes and beaches. Easy access to city by car, bus and train
house_rules: Up to two people only for this room. No dinner parties or other guests permitted. Smoking only on the balcony.
host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I'm a designer. I have lived in many cities, countries and travelled to many more. I still travel frequently for work and pleasure. It's fantastic living here. In summer you can start and finish your day with a swim and in winter I love to walk or do yoga on the beach when its much less crowded. 

Sydney's a great place to visit with lots of great place for coffee, breakfast, dinner and/or drinks. There's always plenty to do with movies, galleries, theatre, dance, walks, yoga, kayaking, days away. I know Bondi and Sydney well so can recommend lots of great places so you can pack in as much as you can or do as little as you wish.

name: Sunny Oceanside Deco Apartment
summary: Arty, light-filled apartment across the road from the ocean and a coastal stroll to cafe's, bars and Coogee beach. Incredible views!
space: Literally ocean-side, minutes to Coogee Beach, Wiley's Baths, the Ladies (ocean) Pool and 5-10 mins coastal wander to cafés, bars, restaurants and shops. 10 mins drive to University of NSW (UNSW), Prince of Wales Hospital, Royal Hospital for Women and Sydney Children's Hospital.  Walk the coast-walk and swim in some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. If you're lucky, depending on the time of year, you'll even see whales. Late June and early July is the best time to see them. This location is truly amazing. Everyday stepping out and seeing the sun on the ocean, great days on the beach, swimming, snorkelling, walking along the coast and then seeing the moonlight on the water coming home. Winter is Coogee is even more chilled out than usual. Click on the Guidebook icon on this page for more details of just some of the places to eat, see and do in walking distance.   Regular and easy bus ride into town, if you need to work or want to see some of the city sights, however most city-

neighborhood_overview: Coogee is part of the Eastern suburbs of Sydney. A relaxed vibe with plenty of cafe's, a few bars, lovely beach and a few ocean baths.
notes: Currently there is a construction occurring next door. The good news is that this gives direct 180 degree views of the ocean and cliffs plus direct sunshine into the apartment - perfect on chilly Winter days. I have even seen whales spouting water our at sea whilst doing the washing up! The bad news is that there is extra noise during the daytime.
transit: Free on-street parking is available. If arriving by plane Taxi will cost approx $30AUD. Bus stops into the city of Sydney, Bondi Junction, Universities and Hospitals a 10 min walk away.
access: Guests have access to entire apartment, however there is a small study that is locked. This is my home and I store some of my things in this room so you have more room for your things.
interaction: I have regular contact by email and leave guests to themselves when here. If anything is needed welcome to contact my mum - contact details will be in the apartment and available on booking.
house_rules: No smoking  No pets - there is a dog park across the road, you can love them there...but no pets allowed in my block No parties Please have an Air BnB profile and references, including with a photo which shows your face, thanks.  Please respect the neighbours in the small and friendly block, I'd like to keep them friendly :)  Enjoy the space
host_about:
I am a Sydney-sider born and bred and totally love this city. It really is one of the most beautiful places in the world. I love meeting people, including people from different cultures and places, which I get to do with my work (most frequently in Timor-Leste) and enjoy this element to Air B and B. 

Although I love to live, work and play in different places, I still and currently call Australia home. Living right on the coast and seeing the sunshine and moonlight on the water everyday is amazing. Totally topped by seeing whales passing by too (at certain times of year) - come and stay at my place and you will want to move to Coogee, Sydney, Australia as well :) I love Summer and swimming in the ocean at all points of the day (and occasional dips during Summer eves too) and also yoga overlooking gorgeous Coogee beach. Also, have just gotten into cycling- as have many Sydney-siders and it is great riding to Surry Hills (where I work and one of the best places for great cafes, shops, theatres and galleries) and do so via Centennial Park, a truly beautiful park. 

I love festivals, particularly world music festivals and film festivals. Sydney has heaps of festivals, so come and enjoy :) food festivals, short (Italian, Human Rights, Gay/ Lesbian/ Transgender, Docos, Bike) film festivals, music festivals, etc etc. It's hard to choose, even when you live here....and when it is equally fun just hanging out at the beach. 

Contact me for dates as I'm not great at keeping my calendar up-to-date and also sometimes I can be flexible with dates, so I like to hear from peeps directly.

We do have sleeping that would accommodate 5 adults in proper beds and a sofa bed that will comfortably sleep another 2 adults (additional fees for more than 5 adults as an additional room is required).  Our pantry is free for anyone to use and shelves in the fridge are cleaned out to allow proper use for all guests.  We have a good relationship with our neighbours and are keen to keep it that way!  Please note that during Christmas and new year the house is only available for a min of 7days at a time  Linen is provided but guests must bring their own towels. Towels can be provided but an additional cleaning cost is required.

name: SYDNEY BUSHLAND WATERFRONT HIDEAWAY
summary: Hideaway Cottage is nestled on the shores of Fisherman's Bay in Port Hacking in the Royal National Park,  just 50 klms drive south of the Sydney CBD.  It is a quiet location abundant with wildlife and wonderful bushland walks.  There is so much to explore locally but yet it is within comfortable distance of also exploring the main sites that Sydney has to offer.
space: Experience the best of the Australian bush and Sydney city life with a holiday in this spacious open plan and comfortable waterfront cottage, located on the shores of beautiful Fisherman's Bay in the Royal National Park within 50kms from the Sydney CBD and just 40 minutes from Sydney Airport. Whether you are traveling from overseas to experience Sydney and the surrounds or just want a great short getaway without having to travel miles, Hideaway Cottage is just for you. Accommodation consists of 3 bedrooms, 2 with Queen sized beds, another large bedroom with 2 single beds. . There are 2 large bathrooms one with spa, plus an extra outdoor rock shower. The open plan living area with fire place and fully equipped gourmet kitchen will delight the most fastidious of travelers. Whether you enjoy swimming, snorkeling, fishing, kayaking, bush walking, discovering ancient Aboriginal rock carvings, biking, tennis, whale watching or just relaxing over a bar-b-q on the huge wrap around deck and tak

neighborhood_overview: A special part of the world.  If you want a slice of the Australian Bush and also like the water and still do not want to travel for hours to find both.  Then this is for you. The Maianbar/Bundeena basin is an artists haven and there are plenty of  small studios to explore.
notes: Although the pantry is always fully stocked with all the basics, guests should provide their own fresh produce and meat supplies. Fresh milk, bread, butter will be supplied on arrival. If a shopping list is supplied, I will ensure that all the groceries etc are in the fridge/pantry ready on your arrival.
transit: A car is definitely required but there is a little ferry from Bundeena across to Cronulla.  From there you can take the train into the city if you do not feel like driving.
access: This listing is for the entire house and all facilities. In most instances, guests will be met at the property, otherwise instructions for keys will be provided prior to arrival.
interaction: I can arrange to meet guests and escort them to the cottage if required A car is definitely required.
house_rules: Hideaway Cottage has a standard set of rules for guests which will be provided at the time of booking.  It is strictly a no smoking cottage
host_about:
I spent 2014/15 taking a much needed break and spent the time exploring hidden gems in Europe.  I was based  at a friend's place in Surrey in England and spent much of my time in Germany, Portugal and Wales, before setting our on my own.  
I enjoy meeting people of all ages and exploring different places and cultures.  I have two sons who thought I was a little crazy traveling on my own but the people I met and the places I have stayed were fantastic.
I am looking forward to hosting so I can repay some of the kindnesses shown to me.

name: Stunning room + own bathroom + POOL
summary: Staying in Newtown means you get all the fun of Sydney, with all the fun people. This is seriously the best part of Sydney. Newtown is known for its eateries, coffee shops, book stores, art galleries, cinema and bars. It is awesome.
space: The house is in Newtown in a quiet street with large trees and a park. You just have to cross the park to get to King street. The shops, train station, hospital and the University are 5 minutes away. The house is very modern with a lap pool. Spread over 3 floors it has 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a large open plan kitchen, lounge, laundry and garage. The bedroom has a nice comfortable queen bed, a desk and chair, lots of wardrobe space, a fan, air/con and a balcony.  There is facility for tea and coffee in your room. You can put breakfast stuff in the kitchen but no cooking allowed. I live with one cat( a Devon Rex) who is no problem with people with allergies. There is wireless internet for you to use. The house is quiet except for the birds at sunset. You can use the pool anytime. The bathroom  is immaculate and yours only.

The house is quiet except for the birds at sunset. You ca
neighborhood_overview: Newtown is very convenient to the Airport and Sydney's CBD. The Sydney University and Royal Prince Alfred Hospital are also within a short stroll away. Once a modest working class area, Newtown now boasts one  of the most popular restaurant strips which this city has to offer. Excellent eating from many nationalities abounds here. Best of all you don't have to be on an endless budget to enjoy breakfast, lunch and dinner. There are 600 restaurants close by in Newtown and most of them are very reasonably priced. Our local area is now one of the most sought after residential addresses. Businesses, particularly restaurants, have flocked to King Street, which is at Newtown's heart. The area is well serviced with smart shopping and is now a far cry from its modest beginnings in the 1960's. Culturally Newtown is like no other suburb in Sydney, or, quite possibly, Australia. Here is the highest concentration of live theater venues found anywhere in the country. Newtown is a stimulating melting
notes: There are 300 restaurants close by in Newtown and most of them  very reasonably priced.
access: If you are coming to Sydney, you can take the taxi straight to my house for about $40.00 or the train to Newtown station. I have traveled all my life and will help you whenever I can.
interaction: As much or as little as you want.
house_rules: Be gentle with the animals and kind with the resident. You can use the kitchen for breakfast only.
host_about: I am a French Canadian woman who came to Australia long time ago just to visit and I never left. I love traveling more than anything and love meeting new people. I fell in love with Sydney and it's people because it is a new country, it is free and the climate is semi-tropical. What's not to like?

name: Harbour Foreshore Shared Accommodation with views
summary: Located in the place of first European settlement in the late 1700's this is one of the earliest houses of the wealthy merchant class which grew the colony with private wealth. It is in the heart of The Rocks overlooking the Harbour adjacent CBD.
space: Welcome to Dawes Point! Single room with spectacular views of Sydney Harbour Bridge in an historic colonial stone townhouse c.1841 in the heart of The Rocks. Close to everything, walk to Opera House, Quay and city! Public transport at the door. Shared bathrooms (two). Village atmosphere in the city with colonial architecture, harbour views, theatres, restaurants, shops and museums. Tree lined street in local diverse neighbourhood. Vibrant and colourful with weekend markets, food stalls and entertainment. The building is listed on the National Register of Historic Buildings and is undergoing complete conservation back to its colonial Georgian origin. Buses at the door or train and ferries 10 minute stroll away. Watch the sun setting on the Parramatta River over drinks from the cast iron lace balcony openning off the formal dining room or walk to the water's edge for a picnic under the Bridge watching the harbour traffic Amenities: Wireless Internet Thanks and look forw
description: Located in the place of first European settlement in the late 1700's this is one of the earliest houses of the wealthy merchant class which grew the colony with private wealth. It is in the heart of The Rocks overlooking the Harbour adjacent CBD. Welcome to Dawes Point! Single room with spectacular views of Sydney Harbour Bridge in an historic colonial stone townhouse c.1841 in the heart of The Rocks. Close to everything, walk to Opera House, Quay and city! Public transport at the door. Shared bathrooms (two). Village atmosphere in the city with colonial architecture, harbour views, theatres, restaurants, shops and museums. Tree lined street in local diverse neighbourhood. Vibrant and colourful with weekend markets, food stalls and entertainment. The building is listed on the National Register of Historic Buildings and is undergoing complete conservation back to its colonial Georgian origin. Buses at the door or train and ferries 10 minute stroll away. Watch the sun setting on t
notes: This is an important historic building listed on the national Register of Historic Buildings. As such, it should not be compared to an hermetically sealed and air conditioned hotel room; you are sharing a private home. The bedrooms are generally on the top two floors with the lower levels reception rooms, formal dining, breakfast room and library. If stairs pose a difficulty or other medical conditions which you feel may be compromised, satisfy yourself as to the suitability of the accommodation before booking.
access: All service and most reception areas but formal dining rooms by prior arrangement.
house_rules: No smoking in heritage listed building. Lost keys charged at $50 per key. ($150 for Georgian door keys) As shared accommodation, it is expected that the amenity of others will respected. Bathrooms and kitchen must be kept clean and tidy after use.
host_about: Easy going guy who enjoys meeting new people and is passionate about tango (I own a tango school) when I am not working as a conservation architect. My home is a unique experience being an early stone Georgian townhouse from the first period of white settlement, restored to museum standard as it was when finished in 1841. Step back in time to a more gentle, elegant life style in Australia's oldest precinct on the doorstep of the city and all that Sydney has to offer the visitor.

name: Family Home on Willoughby Park.
summary: This beautiful and meticulous family home has the best of everything. Including an outdoor kitchen onto a cabana complete with foxtel and a huge tv! The leafy, quiet outlook on Willoughby park is ideal for a rest or a great holiday. Please get in touch if you need further info! The separate cabana works well for teenagers or grandparents seeking some solace!   I will never cancel!  We are away December  2019 and January 2020 so I've reduced the rates to have someone in our house!  Read more!
space: Welcome to our meticulously presented and stylishly decorated, federation style four bedroom family home.   The House  The house is set on 630 sq. metres of level grass making it a perfect family home. The large master bedrooms offers sweeping views of Willoughby Park. The second bedroom also has panoramic views of the park. The 3rd and fourth bedrooms have leafy views and contain queen and double beds. . The house could sleep 8 in total.  In the cabana you can sleep 1.  There are 2 complete bathrooms with a large laundry, clothes line and modern BBQ facilities. Wi Fi throughout the house.   Location We are located on Willoughby Park which is just 10 minutes to the city on the bus, bus stop is just across the road. It is also 7 minutes to Chatswood and 10 minutes to beautiful Mosman, Taronga Zoo  and Manly beach.  There is room for 2 cars in the drive way.   I'd love to be able to offer a great rate  especially January 2020  as we will be away and I’d love to have someone in our wonder

neighborhood_overview: Very quiet and peaceful with close access to fabulous coffee shops, fresh bread and a huge Harris farm! All within walking distance or there are bikes in the garage which you are welcome to borrow!
notes: Please let us know if you require a linen service. There will be a small additional fee if you would like sheets and towels.
transit: Bus on the doorstep to Bondi and the city. Or anywhere else you want to go! There is a bus stop outside the church on the corner of Warrane /Mclelland and more bus services on Eastern Valley way (other side of the park) and also on Penshurst st - just across from Harris Farm.  I’ll leave detailed notes in the house for all transport.
access: Guests have access to a wonderful row of unique shops and restaurants. All in a 7 minute walk. The park is ON your doorstep and is a really beautiful place to relax or to exercise. The proximity of the city 12 minutes by car or public transport makes it an ideal location with only a 10 minute drive to the beach. Really there is nothing that is inaccessible - and makes for a great holiday destination.
interaction: Im only ever a phone call away and I always organise a duty manager to be on call should ever the need arise. I will always meet and greet and walk you through the workings of the house.
house_rules: this is a quiet neighbourhood please respect that. Garbage Bins go out on Sunday nights.  Yellow for recycling and red for rubbish please do not park across the footpath. the cars will adequately fit inside the driveway
host_about: Hi! I I am Kristin. I  Love outdoor activities like going to the beach, surfing and cycling.  Hope to see you soon.  The location of our house makes all this possible and easily accessible.  If you enjoy these activities then you'll love this spot!

name: Stunning North Bondi Beach Pad
summary: AWESOME LOCATION!! Fabulous 3 air conditioned bedrooms 2 bathrooms. 135 square metre ground floor apartment. Walking distance to all things Bondi. Bars, beaches and restaurants.
space: We have a renovated, elegantly arranged apartment, this classic art deco apartment combines ornate period features with stunning contemporary finishes and an incredibly seamless flow. Privately set within a boutique period block of only four, its exceptionally well maintained interiors are brimming with character and a northerly aspect. Features include: - Open living/dining flows to a stunning stainless steel kitchen - Three bright large size bedrooms, all with air conditioning - Immensely private sunny courtyard with BBQ  - Two freshly schemed bathrooms, main features a bath  - Convenient internal laundry with washer and dryer - Private entry via gardens and a private front porch - 3m high decorative ceilings, cornices and picture rails  - Polished floors throughout - B&O wireless speaker - Wireless internet - Dishwasher - Spitting distance to all things Bondi. beach, pool, restaurants, shopping, bars - All linen and towels and beach towels supplied - Public transport bus is 1 min wa

host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I have been working in Advertising for 15 odd years working for many of the top shops around town from M&C Saatchi and Saatchi & Saatchi to DDB and BBDO.

I love living near the beach.  There is nothing better than getting up and going for an early morning swim before work.  I have lived in Bondi for over 10 years and for some reason never learned to surf.  Stupid really as it's so accessible for me.  I have had a few lessons over the years but never followed it through. Anyway I just enjoy everything else the beach has to offer.

If you can't live near the beach full time, my home is a great place to experience it for for a week or so.

name: Design Oasis  in Newtown Close to Centre
summary: My beautiful, bright and quiet designer apartment will be your oasis in the middle of diverse and bohemian Newtown.  It's close to everything, but also a great space to retreat.  Bright and airy in the day time and cosy at night- this is the perfect place to come home to, whatever your day entails.
space: My gorgeous award-winning apartment is located in the heart of Sydney's Newtown. The architect-designed, open plan, 1-2 bedroom apartment will offers you everything you need to turn your Sydney visit into an experience.  The apartment is in a small block, with only 2 others. It's surprisingly quiet for somewhere so close to the action. The architects who designed my place, originally made it for themselves, so they put a lot of thought into the light and space and feel of it.  With the terrace extending the space into the outdoors, you really can enjoy a little outdoor oasis in the middle of the apartment. Upstairs you will find the open bedrooms with two comfortable beds (a queen and a double)  that will invite you to count the stars, while under your blanket.  My place is equipped with fast internet, fridge, washing machine, tv etc.  Newtown is about 3.5km from the city centre. It's a lively, interesting suburb, with cinemas, markets, lots of restaurants, bars and live music venues.

With the terrace extending the space into the outdoors, you really can enjoy a little outdoor oasis in the middle of the apartment. Upstairs you will find the open bedrooms with two comfortable beds (a queen and a doub
neighborhood_overview: Newtown is one of Sydney's most vibrant and eclectic suburbs. The Historic 19th Century inner city precinct of Newtown balances classic Victorian Architecture with cutting-edge modern city life. It is home to Sydney's most colourful mix of cosmopolitan and bohemian cultures. All of this is prominently on display on King Street, the central Newtown promenade and a mecca of alternative street life. King Street is packed with cheap restaurants, quirky cafes, late night bars, off-beat fashion stores, left-of-centre bookshops, cinemas and much, much more.
transit: Newtown is a great place to base yourself as there is lots of fast public transport options going to the city, darling harbour, Sydney olympic park. the beach you name it. Train is 5 mins walk from my place and bus is about 1 minute away. Newtown is close to Sydney Uni, Central Station, hospitals, parks, theatres and pools.
access: You will have access to the entire apartment. I will keep some of my personal belongings in the apartment and hope that you treat it the same respect as I do.
interaction: I will be available via Airbnb, phone, text and email during your stay.
house_rules: - This is my home, please look after it. - Please respect the neighbours, and do not make significant noise or play loud music after 10pm. - No parties allowed. - If guests lock themselves out of the property OR they do not place keys in the lockbox at checkout, an $80 fee will apply. If a guest loses a set of keys during their stay, a $300 fee will apply.
host_about:
Hello - I'm a gallery director from Sydney Australia. I love art and travelling and meeting new people. I have been both a host and a guest with airbnb and have really enjoyed the experience. 



 (Hidden by Airbnb) Likes:
CarriageWorks Arts Centre, ICP - International Center of Photography, Radiolab, 505, MOP Projects, Stills Gallery, Art Month Sydney, Animal Kingdom, Samson & Delilah, Kiki Smith, This American Life, The Moon, QIRKZ, American Suburb X

name: A beautiful house near Bondi Beach!
space: Our 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom modern home is in a quiet and family friendly street, within walking distance to the beach, cafes, restaurants, shops and public transport. The ground level offers an open-plan kitchen-living, with all kitchen appliances (including a dish washer), timber floors, flat screen television and DVD. There is free Wi-Fi in the house. Downstairs there is an open space and a lovely back yard with a nice timber deck, gas bbq and even a cubby-house for your children to enjoy. Upstairs there are three bedrooms, all with built-in wardrobes. The master bedroom has an ensuite (with a bath and a shower) and a balcony over-looking the garden. The second bedroom has a single bed and third bedroom has two single beds. There is a washing machine and dryer for your use and a second bathroom. Also, baby crib and high chair will be provided for your request. There is plenty of parking on the street and a bus up the road that will take you shopping in Bondi Junction or to the heart o

name: BEAUTIFUL COOGEE BEACH OCEAN VIEW
summary: You can see the ocean from your balcony and it's only a ten minute walk down for a swim or a short bus ride into the city to enjoy all that Sydney has to offer
space: Welcome! I do a lot of traveling so am happy to host you in my home & show you my part of the world. My apartment is a short stroll down to Coogee one of Sydney's most popular beaches, and only a 20/25min bus ride into the city & Sydney Harbour. Coogee itself is full of cafes & restaurants to suit all palettes & purses & has a wonderful coastal walk winding past Gordons Bay which is great for snorkeling, Bronte which is a good surf beach & ending at Bondi Beach. Balcony and Ocean View! My apartment has a balcony off the living area and one also off your room with views over the Pacific Ocean where you can watch the sunrise. Or if you prefer, enjoy the walk and watch it sitting on the beach!  There is also an ocean pool nearby & tennis courts. You'll be sharing the bathroom with me along with the kitchen if you choose to cook occasionally. There is internet access, easy parking out the front of the building & the bus stop is only a few minutes away. There is also plenty of free street p

neighborhood_overview: Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood (think Soho London, The East Village NYC). During the last decade Potts Point has become recognised as one of the most desirable places to live in Sydney. Many empty-nesters have sold their family homes in the suburbs and bought an apartment in the neighbourhood. Many young families now choose to live here, so much so that the sight of prams, once as rare in Potts Point as koalas, are now part of the diverse mix of locals. And why wouldn't anybody want to live here? It is the most cosmopolitan 'hood' in Australia. It is beautiful, grand old art deco buildings, and harbour side parks; it is a walk to the city through the Botanic Gardens; you can get a coffee downstairs, and have a drink after dinner. It is all about amenity. It is a vibrant, living, inner-urban community.
notes: ★ Parking. Parking is subject to availability. The cost is $25 per day and must be booked at the time of your reservation.
transit: It is two minutes walk to the nearest train station or you can walk into the CBD in fifteen minutes. There is a go-get car for hire by the hour on the street. Harbour-side parks are 5 minutes walk. The surf beaches are also a short train/ bus ride away. Within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens, Opera House, Art Gallery, Australian Museum, central business district & most tourist sites  AIRPORT: - Taxis takes about 20 minutes and cost about $50 (depending on the time of day).  - Shuttle bus stops at nearby hotels. This costs approx. $14 but takes much longer as it makes a number of stops. - Train. Domestic Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.22 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station - Train. International Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.81 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station
access: Guests have access to everything in the apartment and direct access to the best food and drink Sydney has to offer.
interaction: I like to welcome Guests and show them their accommodation. My family and I live across the road, so I am close by if Guests need something.
house_rules: ★ Prior to the day of your check-in, ONLY CONTACT ME via the Airbnb message thread. Keeping your booking requirements here in one place keeps me organised. ★ Arrival and Departure times. Please advise: • your estimated ARRIVAL time in Sydney, and • your planned DEPARTURE time from the apartment (checkout is before 11am) I need the times for your convenience so I can plan check-ins and schedule cleanings. If I do not know the times in advance or you are delayed without contacting me, your check-in maybe POSTPONED till later in the evening. ★ Check out. Leave the apartment as you found it is probably the best guide. Please: • wash dishes • take out rubbish • leave used towels in the shower • close windows • put things away (hairdryers, plates, pots etc) • turn off lights and air-conditioning • leave BOTH sets of keys IN the apartment. • message me to say you have left ★ Sheets and towels. Please DO NOT wash the sheets and towels before your departure. I appreciate the effort, but I prefe
host_about:
My family and I live in Potts Point. We love it and think it is the best neighbourhood in Sydney. It is full of life - cafes, restaurants, bars, markets, shops and parks. If Potts Point does not have it, it is nearby by foot, taxi or public transport. It is rated as the most liveable part of Sydney.

We like to travel. I have been fortunate enough to live in Singapore (Tanglin School), France (Dijon - Universite di Bourgogne), Holland (Delft), Italy (Perugia - Universita per Stranieri), UK (London), PNG (Moresby) and Germany (Hamburg). Our experience in travelling and living abroad has been distilled into our apartments.

Airbnb gives us the opportunity to offer to you the five homes we own (not just manage) in this neighbourhood for your stay in Sydney.

All our homes are well designed, comfortable, clean, secure and fully equipped with everything you will need to enjoy your holiday or business trip. We live a minute away so we are available should you need something.

HELPFUL TIP: If you are new to Airbnb, and have not yet completed your profile, it is highly recommended by both Airbnb and myself, that you do. If this is not completed prior to contacting me, then please take the time to introduce yourself in your first contact message when sending in an inquiry or booking request. We would like to know who is coming to our homes. 

The homes we have on Airbnb can be found below.

name: Wow factor Harbour & Fire works
space: Lifestyle - Enjoy spectacular views of the Opera House Harbour bridge and CBD from this stunning renovated apartment in a exclusive building in the heart of Sydney`s most diverse cafe and restaurant precinct. Accommodation - relax in the immaculate living and dining areas which feature Japan black timber flooring opening out to a generous terrace. Postcard views can be seen from all rooms through floor to ceiling glass sliding doors. Spacious bedroom has built in wardrobes and mosaic tiled bathroom  with oversized walk in shower. A fully equipped designer kitchen with stainless steel bench tops and Smeg appliances. Features - The prime central address includes security parking for one car, 24 hr. concierge, video security and intercom, level lift access, pool gym and sauna. Public transport and extensive shopping is on your doorstep, surrounded by extensive array of restaurants, bars, pubs and shopping. Amenities like Wifi internet access and Cable  are included.

name: Your own little Sydney terrace close to everything
summary: This is a real little home that you can relax in as a single, couple or a small family. Complete with bikes, books, games, sports equipment to use you will be 15 minutes from everything. There is a super cute garden to chill out in, some gym equipment and a stunning park just over the road. You are a short walk from bars, restaurants and seconds from excellent public transport. Do Sydney like a local!
space: Within walking distance of Erskineville, Redfern shops and Chippendale, this two bedroom terrace is super conveniently located close to public transport, has a secure carpark, as well as bicycles available to use. Recently renovated, it has a designer bathroom, courtyard with BBQ for entertaining, a double bed in a quiet room and single bedroom perfect for a child. There is Foxtel, Netflix, wi-fi and all of the bits and pieces (books, games, crockery) you need to make it home.

This includes a cute little, garage with some gym eq
neighborhood_overview: The terrace is located in the Redfern side of Alexandria.  Opposite is a beautiful park full of fig trees, a playground and BBQs. It is close to the Fountain Street entertainment precinct where there are some excellent cafes and restaurants. There are two IGA grocery stores within a 15 minute walk, some great small bars and pubs around Redfern and Erksineville and Newtown is really close by. It's a friendly neighbourhood and there are also a bunch of clothing and shoe outlets nearby if you don't mind a little bargain shopping. If you're up for a short bike trip, The Grounds of Alexandria is just up the road.
notes: We would love if you wouldn't mind giving the plants the occasional drink of water. There are loads of books, games and equipment to play with and meander through. I will also give you all of my hottest tips for Sydney Festival.
transit: There is a bus stop on the opposite side of the road that takes you to Bondi and Coogee, and another bus stop a couple minutes walk away that takes you into the City. If you're eager, you can walk into town via Darling Harbour in around 35-40 minutes. Redfern is the closest train station, but Green Square on the airport line is walkable also. We have two adult bikes that can be used, there is a carpark on site and free parking near the park on the other side of the road.
access: You have full reign over the entire place - all to yourself. This includes a cute little, garage with some gym equipment.
interaction: I will be available on the phone.
house_rules: Smoking allowed outside.  Small gatherings allowed but no big parties. It's a great place for kids. We don't mind pets, but obviously not super keen on puppies destroying things and please pick up the poo.
host_about: Originally from the Mornington Peninsula, but have called Sydney home for almost 12 years now. Cyclist, biophile, lousy cook.

name: Inner city terrace house in trendy Newtown
summary: Terrace house double room near cafes/restaurants, cinema, shopping mall and parks. Quiet, friendly and safe neighbourhood. Short train or bus trip to city, Sydney University, Bondi/Coogee Beaches and Central Station. Short taxi ride or train to Airport. Good wifi connection. Breakfast with home made muesli. Almost sole use of bathroom next to room. Stay 3 nights or for up to two months. Flexible arrival and departure time with prior agreement. Extra storage for bicycles, surfboards or suitcases.
space: Bright and airy fully equipped home, close to everything you need including cafes, cinema, restaurants, park, city and tourist attractions. The house has two bedrooms (1 for guests), two bathrooms and laundry facilities. Small backyard.  Self help basic breakfast, including home made muesli. Close to trains, buses and all attractions.  Easy walking distance to cafes, restaurant, hotels, gym, swimming pool, cinemas, shops, park and Sydney University.  Lots of local cheap cafes, restaurants and hotels. Some live music at local hotels and other venues. Short train ride to Central Station for country and interstate destinations. Close to the international and domestic airports.  The house is close to a shopping centre with supermaket, baker, deli, Asian grocer and other shops. Stay in a safe and friendly local neighbourhood.
description: Terrace house double room near cafes/restaurants, cinema, shopping mall and parks. Quiet, friendly and safe neighbourhood. Short train or bus trip to city, Sydney University, Bondi/Coogee Beaches and Central Station. Short taxi ride or train to Airport. Good wifi connection. Breakfast with home made muesli. Almost sole use of bathroom next to room. Stay 3 nights or for up to two months. Flexible arrival and departure time with prior agreement. Extra storage for bicycles, surfboards or suitcases. Bright and airy fully equipped home, close to everything you need including cafes, cinema, restaurants, park, city and tourist attractions. The house has two bedrooms (1 for guests), two bathrooms and laundry facilities. Small backyard.  Self help basic breakfast, including home made muesli. Close to trains, buses and all attractions.  Easy walking distance to cafes, restaurant, hotels, gym, swimming pool, cinemas, shops, park and Sydney University.  Lots of local cheap cafes, restaurants and h
neighborhood_overview: My trendy neighbourhood is friendly and close to everything.  Coffee culture 50 cafes and restaurants, a shopping mall and a cinema complex within walking distance. A gym, swimming pool and Sydney Park are all close for anyone wanting exercise. A shopping centre with supermarket, alcohol shops, butchers, bakers, Asian groceries and deli. Some novelty and clothes and phone shops.
notes: There is a wardrobe and drawers for storage in the room and lots of space in the house for luggage, two bicycles or surfboards. Unrestricted parking is only available on one side of the street so it can be tricky as it is on a first come basis.
transit: The nearest train station is St Peters Station and it is 17 minutes to Circular Quay (for ferries, Opera House, the Rocks) and all the tourist attractions. Buses go to the city, Sydney University, University of Technology Sydney and Coogee Beach.  It is also easy and fun walking around the King Street shops or going to Sydney Park for a walk or run.
access: Guests have their own keys and can come and go as they please but please no parties. Good wifi connection. Access to washing machine, clothes drying line and drying rack, kitchen, dishwasher and a small backyard to observe the wildlife of inner Sydney (parrots, bats, lizards).  There are no dangerous spiders.
interaction: I can assist guests with local information and transport options in Sydney and Australia. Some guests want the non tourist walk options and one couple brought their bicycles for transport and parked them in the front room.  Guests are free to use the shared facilities.
house_rules: Main use of the bathroom next to the bedroom. I have a second en suite bathroom upstairs.  Joint use of the kitchen, dining and lounge room.  No smoking, no pets, no children as the house is not childproof for safety.
host_about: I love retirement, working out at the local gym, snorkelling, reading, movies, dinner outings and overseas travel most recently to Poland and Tasmania.

name: Warehouse Loft Conversion
summary: A true inner city warehouse conversion, what used to be a printing factory is now a sanctuary for plant lovers, chefs, audiophiles and creatives alike. Located in a cull-de-sac lane with street level entry, a shared rooftop with BBQs, views and more.
space: Welcome to Sydney! Beautiful high ceilings with exposed wooden beams and an open plan layout are what make this space unique. It's an airy private loft apartment in a surprisingly quiet laneway in Darlinghurst/East Sydney.  2 minutes walk to Oxford Street, 5 minutes to Hyde park in central Sydney. Not many people live this close to Sydney city centre.  The kitchen is equipped with everything you need. We like to cook!  The loft has plenty of wardrobe space and a cosy setup for sleeping and watching movies. It has a new queen size mattress, fine bamboo sheets, and nice pillows. The living area is spacious and with a vintage sound system and record player with plenty of records for you to flick through. You can also plugin your iPod or device or use the bluetooth adaptor.  Perfect for entertaining, the apartment is very close to the busy Stanley Street, Crown Street and Oxford Street. Walking distance to the best bars and restaurants the city has to offer, this cul-de-sac lane will be a
description: A true inner city warehouse conversion, what used to be a printing factory is now a sanctuary for plant lovers, chefs, audiophiles and creatives alike. Located in a cull-de-sac lane with street level entry, a shared rooftop with BBQs, views and more. Welcome to Sydney! Beautiful high ceilings with exposed wooden beams and an open plan layout are what make this space unique. It's an airy private loft apartment in a surprisingly quiet laneway in Darlinghurst/East Sydney.  2 minutes walk to Oxford Street, 5 minutes to Hyde park in central Sydney. Not many people live this close to Sydney city centre.  The kitchen is equipped with everything you need. We like to cook!  The loft has plenty of wardrobe space and a cosy setup for sleeping and watching movies. It has a new queen size mattress, fine bamboo sheets, and nice pillows. The living area is spacious and with a vintage sound system and record player with plenty of records for you to flick through. You can also plugin your iPod or devic
neighborhood_overview: Darlinghurst is the 'cool' part of town.. Neighbouring Surry Hills, Kings Cross and the CBD. This is the area where the fun stuff happens, loads of bars, restaurants, cafes and clubs etc. Check the map for a few tips.
notes: Our apartment is a converted warehouse with exposed raw timber ceilings throughout. We have a fancy Blue Air air purifier which does an excellent job of keeping the place as dust free as possible.
transit: Our home does not have designated parking, there is plenty of street parking which is metered during the day, but free at night. While Sydney is NOT renowned for its amazing public transport, we are located in an area that is well connected. Oxford street has buses to the beaches, Museum train station is 5 mins walk, Town Hall is less than 10 min walk. Taxis are everywhere. You can find everything you need like supermarkets, shops, bars etc. on foot - no need for public transport unless you are heading further out!
access: If playing loud music or sitting outside, please don't make too much noise after 10pm on weeknights (sun-thurs nights) or midnight on the weekends (fri/sat nights).   The rooftop area is shared with the other apartments in the building, so please treat it with respect, take all rubbish down with you and leave it as clean as you found it. The rooftop is equipped with two BBQs, one gas one coal. You will need to bring your own coal if using the fire BBQ. There is a bathroom and a kitchenette up there, everything else you have to bring up.
interaction: The place is all yours. We are generally away when you stay but if we are around when you arrive we will happily talk you through anything or go for a drink and show you some local treasures, or if you prefer we'll just leave you alone... Always available on email and phone.
house_rules: The rooftop is a great spot for an afternoon sundowner or a sunny weekend BBQ. The main key provides access to the roof, there is a bathroom and sink etc up there as well as a big gas BBQ. You'll need to bring your own plates etc and take the cooler bag with some ice packs. Be kind and respectful, its a home not a hotel - most importantly have fun & enjoy!

name: Bellevue Hill Designer, Beaches, City and Views
summary: Wake up to sunrise skyline views at this top-floor boutique apartment, then step out onto the balcony for a morning cup of tea in the fresh air. Kick back on the comfy leather sofa with a magazine, or fire up the grill on the shaded, private terrace.
space: This designer home features two spacious bedrooms with built-ins and private balconies, secured covered parking for 1 car and large terrace for indoor / outdoor living.  Guests will share exclusive access of the rooftop garden which enjoys stunning 360 views of Bondi Beach, the Sydney Harbour, & City skyline. Central air conditioning.  Free WiFi.  Lift access. This home accommodates up to 6 guests and is child friendly.  Travel cot and highchair are available.    Everything is included to make your stay most comfortable for short and long term stays:   Two spacious bedrooms with queen sized beds and built in wardrobes: - Master bedroom with ensuite and balcony - Guest room with small study and balcony - WiFi internet - Air Conditioning/heating  - 2 LCD flatscreen TV's with surround sound stereo system - Large open plan indoor/outdoor living room and kitchen - Sun drenched deep terrace off the living area with a light & leafy  view - Fully equipped designer kitchen with all appliances;
description: Wake up to sunrise skyline views at this top-floor boutique apartment, then step out onto the balcony for a morning cup of tea in the fresh air. Kick back on the comfy leather sofa with a magazine, or fire up the grill on the shaded, private terrace.
neighborhood_overview: Located in one of the city's most sought-after suburbs, the apartment sits on a tranquil, leafy street in the heart of Bellevue Hill, only five minutes from world-famous Bondi Beach. Take a short stroll to cafes, eateries, and bus and train stations.
transit: Cafes, eateries, and all essential amenities are within short strolling distance including bus and train transportation.
access: Guests have unlimited access to the entire home and one car space.
interaction: We are available to assist guests at anytime.
house_rules: 1. STRICTLY No partying is allowed in our properties and parties or noise disturbance may result in loss of bond. 2. No pets are allowed 3. Number of guests must be known (inclusive of kids and babies) by Bondi Beach Holiday Homes when booking. An extra guest outside the agreement will not allowed and will result is deduction from security bond. 4. There is no smoking in our holiday homes. There is a $200 fee charged for special cleaning to rid of smoke odor. 5. You are welcome to hire a port a cot and high chair for an additional $60 AUD ($30 each) CHECK IN Letterbox lockbox AT PROPERTY. Keys will be available for collection from 3pm onwards. We require a scanned/photo of ID to be sent by email prior to arrival to receive your access code. The second set of keys will be in the apartment and both sets should be left INSIDE the apartment please when you depart.  CHECK OUT Before 10 AM or at the pre-arranged time with the owners. Please leave keys in the apartment and lockup when you go.
host_about:
Welcome to your one stop for holiday accommodation in & around Bondi Beach. 
We offer a selection of beautifully furnished holiday homes with modern comforts & spacious living areas. All homes are immaculately kept & located in prime locations near the city & beach with public transportation nearby.

Our holiday rentals include complimentary Wi-Fi, luxury bedding and much more.

Perfect for guests looking for a beautiful home away from home. We invite you to enjoy Sydney in one of ours.

See you at the beach!
Gina & the team

interaction: I try and be as helpful as possible providing local tips on where the best places are to eat out and enjoy Sydney's great cafe culture.  If I am in Sydney when you visit, I will greet you myself and be happy to answer any questions you may have. :)
house_rules: Please enjoy my home, but take care of it as if it were your own.  Thank you.  - I LOVE animals but unfortunately building does not allow them - Feel free to have a dinner party but please keep late night noise to a minimum so as not to disturb the neighbours - Leave the apartment as clean as you found it - No smoking and no candles (my friend just burnt her place down with a candle) - Please let me know if there are any problems so that we can find a solution together
host_about:
I am a well seasoned traveller and lover of life with an insatiable curiosity and thirst to discover the world. 
I love interesting people, places of natural beauty, design, architecture and art and would be happy to share my home with like minded people who appreciate nice things and who will treat my home with respect.
----
Je m’appelle Edwina et je suis Franco-Australienne. 
J’adore les voyages, le design et l’architecture. 
J’ai pris soin de créer un environnement invitant, relaxant et un peu stylé pour mes invités et je serais ravie d’accueillir chez moi une personne ou un couple qui aimerait ma maison autant que moi et la traitera avec respect. 
Merci et bonne journée.

name: Inner city terrace near attractions
space: Close to city with good public transport to tourist attractions. Walk to cafes, restaurants, take aways home delivered, cinema, shops, gym, parks, Sydney University and swimming pool. Short taxi ride to international and domestic airline terminals.  Bright and airy house with two bathrooms, two bedrooms, washing machine, clothesline and yard. Share comfortable living area with dining, kitchen and lounge with TV/DVD. Free limited local phone calls. Friendly and safe neighbourhood. Take a train to visit Sydney Harbour, The Opera House, Museums, the historic Rocks and Art Galleries. It is a short train ride to Central Railway to catch a train to country or interstate locations.      Sydney is well-endowed with open spaces and access to waterways, and has many natural areas, even in the city centre.
