name: SUNLIT BONDI HOLIDAY PAD
summary: Sunlit unit just 500m from the beach, on first floor overlooking the leafy neighborhood from 2 balconies. Lay in bed looking out to the sky & trees. Just 1 minute to the main hub of Bondi with top restaurants, grocery, wine bars, pubs, chemist etc.
space: Fully furnished 1 bedroom beach pad with 2 sunny balconies,  located on a quiet, leafy street, just 500m walk to beach, 1 min to cafes, restaurants, wine bars, grocery store and pubs. Would suit overseas visitors. It's a 2 bedroom unit so is larger in size, but one bedroom is not available to guests. Spacious sun-lit living area with floorboards, big screen smart tv with cable, 1 x king bed, linen supplied. Bathroom with shower and separate bath. Washing machine/drying racks and dishwasher. Parking available in garage. Balconies perfect for books, afternoon drinks & sunsets. Wi-fi internet included. If you want to explore, bus stops to Bondi Junction and the city are two blocks away, with three routes available.  Walk in & enjoy a holiday - locals style...

neighborhood_overview: We are one block away from the main street/hub of Bondi – on the first floor of a quiet corner. Laying in bed you will see sky & trees. Just blocks from the south end of  Bondi, you can walk down for a morning swim, grab a coffee along the way. It's the perfect location without all the noise.
transit: Various bus routes are available (389 two blocks away, 333 express service to the city / 380 to city / 381 to Bondi Junction two blocks away at the beach). 380 service also available to the well known  Watsons Bay.
access: Guests have access to the full apartment and one bedroom (the second smaller bedroom is off limits/will be locked).
interaction: Cleaning charge leaves the place as clean as it was when you arrived and provides you with new linen & towels.
house_rules: OCCUPANCY: No smoking inside. The residence has a maximum occupancy and restricts events of any nature unless otherwise agreed in writing prior to your arrival. The rent rate is based on a specific number of people in the guest party. NO children under the age of 10. Additional guest(s) may alter the rent rate. CHECK-IN TIME: 3 PM CHECK-OUT TIME: 11 AM MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS: We make every effort to ensure that all equipment within the residence is in working order. Guest agree that Landlord or its agents may enter the premises for effecting repairs and/or maintenance or for other necessary purposes. We cannot guarantee that the television, appliances, etc. will not break down during your stay and therefore, no refunds or adjustments will be made for mechanical failure. Furthermore, there will be no refunds or adjustments made for any other unexpected situation beyond our control such as but not limited to bugs, rodents, birds, weather, noise, construction, repairs, and the like. FURN

name: Bushwalkers - near Gt North Walk
space: Own double bedroom and exclusive bathroom in the hallway also another single room upstairs but will need to share the bathroom with the double room.  Also a double sofa bed in another room off the garage with own shower and toilet - wii fi available.    Included in the cost is a continental breakfast - fresh fruit, yoghurt, mousli/cerials, toast and jam tea or coffee - this is help yourself. Parking in lay-by at the back of townhouse.  Use of 2 train lines to the city and also to the Central Coast/ Newcastle and to Macquarie Uni. Please note Hornsby is a suburb and is about 35/40 mins by train to the centre of Sydney - the train line is quite safe to travel home late in the evening. Walk to Hornsby Station is about 10 minutes or there is a local bus right outside the door.  Taxi's always available at the Station if you come home late approx. $8. In Hornsby we have a great Westfield shopping centre which is in walking distance plus 2 cinema's.  Restaurants available in Hornsby and surro

neighborhood_overview: I love the fact we have access to so many lovely bushwalks and national parks in our area. We have a great Westfield shopping centre with great shops and competitive prices. Access to small local cinema and also Greater Union cinema complex.  Great new restaurant in Wahroonga (next suburb) called Butchers Block for breakfast and lunch fantastic food. Other good restaurants in Hornsby particularly some of the Japanese small restaurants
notes: Please note Hornsby is a suburb of Sydney and is about a 40 min train ride to the city.  My house is a 10-15 min easy walk to Hornsby station or there is a local bus right outside the door.  I am a early riser and go to the gym 3 mornings at 6am and therefore go to bed fairly early in the evening Breakfast is help yourself
transit: Easy access to the city with 2 train lines with express trains  Bus service to Parramatta  Trains to Macquarie Uni
access: Kitchen available for making quick meals - please no lengthy roast dinners etc.  Wii Fi  Balcony to sit and relax and eat meals
interaction: I am happy to chat to guests but often find they are ready to retire to their rooms after busy days
house_rules: Consider others in the house with regards to noise  No smoking  No pets  Kitchen can be used for light meals but please no roast dinners and baking and please leave clean and tidy
host_about: I guess my life motto would be to help others and give back to society.  I am a people person and love meeting new people from other parts of the world.  I have volunteered for various charity events and do visit an elderly lady once a week .  Travelling has been my passion since I turned 17 and I worked as a travel consultant for many years in England and also when I arrived in Australia.  I like to stay in apartments and live like the locals travelling on trains and buses to get around.  I have travelled extensively in Asia and stayed in guest houses which has been a wonderful experience.

name: Beachy Art Deco Apartment near Manly & 11k to CBD
summary: Newly renovated, light & airy Northern Beaches apartment with a leafy outlook. Walking distance to parks, beaches, restaurants & shopping malls. Centrally located on the transport line w/buses to Manly & the city on the doorstep. Charming, comfortable double room, ideal for couples & singles.The perfect location for a business trip where a swim or surf before work is possible and an ideal holiday getaway close to the beach with the convenience of easily seeing all Sydney has to offer.
space: The perfect location to enjoy Summer in Sydney!  Christmas and New Year celebrations in Sydney are not to be missed and this is the ideal location to enjoy all that Sydney has to offer. With high ceilings, sash windows and wooden floor boards this art deco apartment, set among the trees, is the perfect blend of convenience and charm.  Walking distance to several beaches, supermarkets, restaurants and parks. Getting to Manly's cafe scene and busy nightlife is an easy bus trip away.  Buses to the City, Manly, North Shore and the Northern Beaches are right on the door step making seeing all that Sydney has to offer an easy journey.  Fairlight Beach, Forty Baskets Beach, Delwood Beach and Clontaf Beach are all close by with North Harbour Reserve walking distance and offering BBQ facilities. The 'Spit to Manly Walk' runs along the back of the suburb and several cafes and restaurants are nearby and easy to walk to. Wifi, Netflix and Apple TV provided.
description: Newly renovated, light & airy Northern Beaches apartment with a leafy outlook. Walking distance to parks, beaches, restaurants & shopping malls. Centrally located on the transport line w/buses to Manly & the city on the doorstep. Charming, comfortable double room, ideal for couples & singles.The perfect location for a business trip where a swim or surf before work is possible and an ideal holiday getaway close to the beach with the convenience of easily seeing all Sydney has to offer. With high ceilings, sash windows and wooden floor boards this art deco apartment, set among the trees, is the perfect blend of convenience and charm.  Walking distance to several beaches, supermarkets, restaurants and parks. Getting to Manly's cafe scene and busy nightlife is an easy bus trip away.  Buses to the City, Manl
neighborhood_overview: Balgowlah is a great area and has the luxury of being close to the beach while having the city easily accessible as well.  Surrounded by natural beauty, the area is blessed with several beaches and stunning nature reserves where you can while away the time picnicking, barbecuing and sunning yourself or enjoying many of the adventure or sporting activities the area has to offer. Not far from the cafe culture and Bar scene of Manly, Balgowlah also has an array of restaurants and cafes right on the doorstep
transit: There are plenty of buses right out the door that get you to the city, the local malls, Mosman, Neutral Bay, Crows Nest, Manly and along the Northern Beaches. Buses are frequent in all directions and on-street parking is also available. The Manly Ferry wharf is only 2km away with Fast Ferries to Watson's Bay and the Eastern Suburbs, or the traditional ferries taking you in to the heart of the city.
access: The apartment is on the first (top) floor, and is at the end of the hallway near  the window and away from the other apartments.
interaction: Available via text to answer any questions you may have.
house_rules: No one likes rules, but this is my beloved home so please treat it as if it were your own.  SAND - Please do not bring sand into the house. Living close to the beach this is an occupational hazard. Sand ruins the floor boards and gets into everything. Please rinse sand off at the beach and be sure any towels with sand in them are free of sand before entering the apartment and washed at a Laundromat as sand also ruins washing machines.  Noise - Please respect the neighbours, this is a quiet block. Noise is to be kept to a minimum in common areas and strictly after 10pm. Noise restrictions apply after 10pm in NSW.  No party policy - please do not entertain at home.  Check in/out - Please communicate check in times with me so that I can offer as much assistance as possible.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Lucy. 

I’m all about coffee, health &  fitness, good food & wine, exploring cities, discovering great restaurants, nightlife and enjoying live music.

I’ve travelled to over 30 countries, so I respect people and places and know how great it can be to experience a slice of home while being away. 

Sydney is a beautiful city and I’m so lucky to live here!

name: Darlinghurst Studio: Sky Oasis
summary: Decidedly cool. Chill out in this bright & beautiful Darlinghurst Studio, right in the heart of the best of Victoria St cafe's, back street art galleries, theatres plus chic eateries on Stanley St. Live in Art Deco history with best view in town!
space: Entire home, not shared. This top floor apartment (5th floor, accessible via fully working, brand new quiet lift or easy stairs) with very high ceilings and 1920s heritage art deco features is a space that is full of light all day long with an incredible vista day or night.  Don't stay here if you don't love character with an oldy worldy Parisian loft feel as this studio is filled to the brim with character and charm for those who love original details. Included in the old world charm are old world building sounds like a distant clunking sound when the lift is operated. Older buildings were built so well and the thick walls mean no neighbour sounds, the culdesac street means no traffic noises whilst right in the heart of the restaurant filled village. Brilliant for a single or couple, sleeping maximum two people, on the chiropractic, comfortable queen bed. The kitchen is separate to the main living space, in a small galley way, with a full sized fridge, gas stove and oven (no microwave

neighborhood_overview: This leafy inner city suburb offers stunning residential streetscape. A pocket of pulsating options, the streets come alive at night in this most convenient of locations in Sydney.  Darlinghurst is a very safe inner city suburb. The closest train station, Kings Cross, is sometimes sketchy, but like all blue light areas, there is a high police patrol, so we feel very safe there. Darlinghurst is the next suburb and has a cafe and restaurant vibe, so it's very different to Kings Cross. Darlinghurst has all the best attractions and is walking distance to CBD, the harbour and Oxford Street shopping.
notes: Rates are seasonal and change throughout the year. NYE dates require minimum one week booking. To find the rates and date availability, please go to our home page and click your dates on the top right hand corner. This will also provide rates for dates selected. The studio does not have AC. Installing AC in this studio would be in vain as the studio does not need extra cooling. The studio is on the top floor and has a wonderful cross breeze that all have loved and enjoyed. It also faces east so only gets the morning sun, not the hot afternoon western sun, were it on the other side of the building it would be a different story. The studio has a large ceiling fan if extra cooling is required, but beyond the fan, AC is not needed at all. We are sorry but we do not have the means to check in guests after 11pm.
transit: There are many buses and trains all within a close walking distance from our studio. Our street has a 99% walking score! You can walk anywhere to Sydney's biggest attractions and just a bus to beaches such as Bondi Beach :-)
access: Guests have free unlimited wifi, access to a small original Art Deco wardrobe, under bed storage perfect for suitcases, the three ottomans also have storage, use of bathroom and 80% of the kitchen. We reserve one kitchen cupboard and one trunk, these are the only areas that are locked. We have a stove top but not an oven or microwave. We are sorry but we do not have the means to check in guests after 11pm.
interaction: I am a super speedy responder and here to answer and assist with any questions at all. We like to know when guests have settled in, so that we know guests have their keys and all is as expected. We also keep this in our rental agreement as we need to know if anything is not working or broken upon arrival so we can fix and replace items. Sometimes it is just a matter of usage instructions and rather than guests tell us at the end of their stay that items weren't working we would prefer to know so that we can send instructions if there is any issue. We are sorry but we do not have the means to check in guests after 11pm.
house_rules: Standard Terms and Conditions of Temporary Holiday Accommodation Note: Variances can be agreed on but only by arrangement with the owner in writing.  Provided will be: Pillows, Tea Towels, Blankets and Doona’s. Linen for one set will be supplied, if you require further linen, we can arrange a linen hire service that costs up to $75 a delivery. Payment of the rental deposit constitutes the clients acceptance of these Terms and Conditions. We are sorry but we do not have the means to check in guests after 11pm. All bookings made accept these terms. Cancellation, if caused by the client, 50% cancellation policy is not refundable unless the house is re-let for the entire period and only a $50 cancellation fee applies. The owners will make every effort to ensure the property is available as booked. However the owners reserve the right to make alterations to bookings due to unforeseen circumstances. To maintain a good standard for our guests we require certain conditions to be complied with.
host_about:
Hi, We have a character filled studio that we love hosting to travellers and guests. We used to have 3 properties on Airbnb so you'll see reviews for other places no longer run as holiday rentals. We cut back because our family expanded so we are now focusing on our children for a few years and might put our homes to holiday rental again one day.

We both work in the design fields, my husband on shows like The Voice and Master Chef and I have worked in design marketing for over twenty years.

We are the owners and managers of our properties. We are not subletting a rental so you won't be evicted should landlords discover you! We do not live in them, so you can be sure of the highest standard and quality as we are dedicated solely to you. We have been doing this for over seven years (long before Airbnb), so we are familiar with the process and have ironed out all the bumps that a newby might not have.

We absolutely love making a space beautiful and want our guests to enjoy our spaces as much as we do.

You are welcome to come and stay and enjoy our little city studio :-)

name: Leafy North Shore House in Trees 1
space: We have a large family home in leafy East Lindfield on Sydney's North Shore with 2 lovely private B & B double bedrooms available with bathroom facilities.   Each room is comfortable for a couple or single. Not suitable for a roll-away, but we do have 2 rooms available, next to each other. Wi-fi, TV, Foxtel in house, ceiling fans in the rooms. Washing machine and dryer, refrigerator, tea and coffee facilities available for your convenience. Fantastic pool and BBQ area - great place to relax after a hard day sight-seeing or working, particularly in Summer months. Only a short walk to Lindfield Train Station and shops, or the bus to the city is just one block away (We can always drive you to the station if we are around). Chatswood is 2 trains stops away. 20 minutes to the central city by train. 20 minutes to most North-side beaches. Good run through by car to all these spots.  Easy access to North Ryde & Macquarie Uni for business travelers. A great peaceful base for tourists, or a quie
description: We have a large family home in leafy East Lindfield on Sydney's North Shore with 2 lovely private B & B double bedrooms available with bathroom facilities.   Each room is comfortable for a couple or single. Not suitable for a roll-away, but we do have 2 rooms available, next to each other. Wi-fi, TV, Foxtel in house, ceiling fans in the rooms. Washing machine and dryer, refrigerator, tea and coffee facilities available for your convenience. Fantastic pool and BBQ area - great place to relax after a hard day sight-seeing or working, particularly in Summer months. Only a short walk to Lindfield Train Station and shops, or the bus to the city is just one block away (We can always drive you to the station if we are around). Chatswood is 2 trains stops away. 20 minutes to the central city by train. 20 minutes to most North-side beaches. Good run through by car to all these spots.  Easy access to North Ryde & Macquarie Uni for business travelers. A great peaceful base for tourists, or a quie
house_rules: Check in 2pm.  Check out 11am - we can be flexible depending on other guests and availability. Please note that Price quoted is per room and we have 2 double rooms to offer. Airbnb only allows one room to be booked on the Calendar system so we have to list them separately as 1 & 2.  Check out my other listing if you want to book them together. We do have a cat, so to avoid pet hassles, would prefer no animals. Ours is a family home, with professionals who have to get up early for work,  so it is not a party house - kindly choose another property if this is what you would like for your holiday. Please only use the pool area if you can swim.
host_about: We are a family who travel ourselves frequently for business and pleasure and know how much more pleasant it is to be in a home situation rather than an impersonal hotel. So we have decided to make our home available for others to enjoy.  We know the best travel advice comes from local people, so love to share our city with fellow travelers. We are happy to provide bed and breakfast to those who would like a quiet base or oasis for their Sydney or San Francisco visits.

name: Stylish Home In Great Location
summary: - At the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane - Classic terrace house with recent renovations - Private room with queen futon - Shared bathroom and kitchen, 2 shared living areas - Helpful, but hands-off hosts
space: This is a private room in a recently restored character terrace house in Darlinghurst, Sydney.   The room isn't huge, but it has a queen-sized futon with mattress topper and built-in wardrobes. There's a big window with a nice outlook and blinds, warm bedding, bedside lamp and power points. It is up a narrow flight of stairs with the bathroom downstairs, so if you have a small bladder and a hip replacement, it might get uncomfortable during the night.
description: - At the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane - Classic terrace house with recent renovations - Private room with queen futon - Shared bathroom and kitchen, 2 shared living areas - Helpful, but hands-off hosts This is a private room in a recently restored character terrace house in Darlinghurst, Sydney.   The room isn't huge, but it has a queen-sized futon with mattress topper and built-in wardrobes. There's a big window with a nice outlook and blinds, warm bedding, bedside lamp and power points. It is up a narrow flight of stairs with the bathroom downstairs, so if you have a small bladder and a hip replacement, it might get uncomfortable during the night. Bathroom is new and shared with us. There are toiletries here for you. There's wireless internet for your use, a printer for tickets etc, a washer/dryer in the bathroom, a clothesline in the backyard and a dishwasher in the kitchen.  There's a living room in the front, extra sofa in the kitchen and
neighborhood_overview: The terrace is in a leafy lane and very quiet but is steps from 3 of our favourite suburbs: Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and Paddington. We spend time in Surry Hills for our hipster fix, restaurants and groceries; Darlinghurst for bars and the new Eternity Playhouse theatre and Paddington for people watching and shopping.
notes: Thanks for reading our description. If this sounds like what you're looking for, please get in touch. We look forward to meeting you.
transit: Aside from the beach, we rarely have reason to venture more than a few blocks from the house for shopping, restaurants, cafes, bars, parks and friends.  It´s a half-hour walk through Hyde Park to the business district and a 15 minute (hilly) walk to Central Station. Buses to the beaches go from around the corner: ~20-40 minutes depending on which beach you choose and the traffic. Our favourite is Bronte. You can also walk to Bronte in just over an hour through gorgeous Centennial Park.  There are lots of GoGet pods if you're a member and we're very well serviced by Uber (their app sometimes thinks our street's one-way, so you might want to walk outside and meet them on Hannam St a few doors down)
access: Bathroom is new and shared with us. There are toiletries here for you. There's wireless internet for your use, a printer for tickets etc, a washer/dryer in the bathroom, a clothesline in the backyard and a dishwasher in the kitchen.  There's a living room in the front, extra sofa in the kitchen and table and chairs outside, so there's room for us to spread out.
interaction: We live here too. We often rent out the space when we're both away for the weekend, so you may have the place to yourself. We have our own lives with work and socialising, but are always happy to give you tips and hear about your day.
house_rules: - Please lock the front door as you come and go - Read the description quickly before booking
host_about:
Hi. I'm Anna. 
I'm a Sydney-based doctor who loves to travel.
I also host in Sydney with my boyfriend, and we love having interesting visitors here enjoying our neighborhood. As hosts, we have plenty of recommendations for you, but will otherwise be pretty hands-off. We're at the work most days, and enjoy cooking dinner at home. Looking forward to speaking to you, Anna.

name: Executive 3 BDRM House, Glebe Point
summary: Beautiful luxury large light filled home. Close to light rail a very short trip into the city. The bohemian village of Glebe at the door step
space: Welcome to Sydney! Luxurious 3 bedroom house with garden in Sydney's exclusive Glebe Point. Walk to the city (3km), Glebe foreshore, cafes, restaurants, bars. The Location: Glebe Point is a fantastic location to be based in Sydney. it is surrounded by the Glebe foreshore parklands, and is a only 3km to the city centre, which is about a 40 minute walk. Glebe Point Road has a plethora of restaurants for every budget (high class and cheap and cheerful), as well as cafes, bars and book shops. It's a great place to wander. Transport: Regular buses go from Glebe Point Road (300m away), into the city. The House: Historic house architect designed in the 1920's, and recently renovated with modern new kitchen and bathrooms. Bedrooms: 3 large sized bedrooms, perfect for 3 couples or a largish family. All top quality mattresses and linen. Kitchen: Newly renovated gourmet kitchen with everything you could wish for! 6 burner gas cooktop, electric oven, mi

host_about:
Hi, I’m Kathy
I am a retired high school teacher, and now spend time travelling with my husband, spending time with the family, reading and going to movies. I am privileged that I have been able to have over 70 families or groups of guests from all over the world over the last 4 years who without exception have thoroughly enjoyed their stay in Glebe.

summary: 2  bed apartment. Lounge room has French doors to balcony with  water views. Master bedroom is newly built is very spacious with en-suite, WIR and balcony. Second bedroom has 2 single beds  bed and has a built-in wardrobe. Downstairs  bathroom has bath & shower. Separate laundry. Well equipped kitchen with large breakfast bar and dishwasher. The dining table seats 8. Patio with table and chairs leads to small garden.  ****Only available 4th May to 28th July 2020. minimum period 4 wks****
space: Only available for period 4thMay to 28tjJuly 2018 for a minimum period of 4 weeks. Often booked by people emigrating to Australia or parents visiting their children and grandchildren. Fully self contained ground floor of house with front and back entrances, front balcony has beautiful bay views. Small backyard which is low maintenance. Help yourself to oranges, lemons, limes, passion fruit,parsley, thyme, rosemary, bay leaves, oregano.  Malabar beach and ocean pool are only a 5 minute walk away. Easy access to many beautiful bays and beaches and lovely walks. Golf course 5 mins walk, swimming, paddle boarding, kayaking, bushwalking. Light filled living area with well equipped kitchen including dishwasher, large bedroom with electric blanket & built-in wardrobe. Second bedroom has trundle bed and built in wardrobe. neighborhood_overview: Neighbourhood is residential very quiet. Small community are friendly and approachable. Several children's parks and playgrounds nearby - closest is 3 mins walk. Beautiful area to walk around and great coffee shop close to beach, which also opens for dinner Fri, Sat nights for seafood and pizzas. Local RSL is well priced and with good variety of food. Golf club also has bar and restaurant. Maroubra Junction or La Perouse both 10mins drive away have more choice of restaurants i.e. Thai, Indonesian, Chinese, Indian,Italian and others. Randwick golf course is 5 minutes walk as  is Malabar rock pool.
notes: Minimum 4 weeks from May 4th to July 28th 2020

house_rules: Please turn off heating/aircon when leaving during the day as it only takes a few minutes to get up to speed. Also turn off after 10pm per regulations.
host_about: We are from Ireland, but have lived in Sydney for over 30 years.  We enjoy travelling, theatre, movies, nature, walking, and meeting  people. We are happy to help in any way we can, but you can be assured of total privacy if you just want to relax and do your own thing.

name: Erskineville art house, terrace in heart of Sydney
summary: In the heart of the fashionable, vibrant, inner-city village of Erskineville is a comfortable and pretty family home, close to trains/buses to the city (to Town Hall is 3 stops).  Art-filled, lovingly renovated, 2 bedroom, 3 storey, 1890s terrace house.  From its iron lacework at the front of the house to a  peaceful and pretty garden at the back, it's a classic home of the area. Great kitchen, living areas. 7 mins walk to bustling Newtown.  No backpackers, unregistered guests or parties.
space: The 1890s terrace house features original timbers and new Australian hardwoods, an Australian native plant-filled, sunny courtyard garden with a generous deck, bifold doors and mozzie mesh, a quiet and private attic master bedroom and is located on one of Erskineville's most desirable streets. Available for families and older, mature travellers. No backpackers or party goers. The little village with its cafes, bakery, pubs, interesting local shops, well-supplied supermarkets and little parks is just a quick jaunt to the end of the street. The house is close to two different train stations to the city (6 mins to town) but the trains are a distant sound.  There's a bus to Bondi Junction and buses in nearby Newtown to just about everywhere.  A Woolworths supermarket is 5 mins walk. Walking, it's 5 mins to Carriage Works theatre/gallery/farmers market precinct. 7 mins to quirky King Street, Newtown with its cafes, fashion, music venues and boutique galleries, 12 mins to Sydney University a

Art-filled, lovingly renovated, 2 bedroom, 3 storey, 1890s terrace house.  From its iron lacework at the front of the house to a  peaceful and pretty garden at the back, it's a classic home of the area. Great kitchen, living areas. 7 mins walk to bustling Newtown.  No backpackers, unregistered guests or parties. The 1890s terrace house features original timbers and new Australian hardwoods, an Australian native plant-filled, sunny courtyard garden with a generous deck, bifold doors and mozzie mesh, a quiet and private attic master bedroom and is located on one of Erskineville's most desirable streets. Available for families and older, mature travellers. No backpackers or party goers. The little village with its cafes, bakery, pubs, interesting local shops, well-supplied supermarkets and little parks is just a
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood has a village feel in the heart of the city. It's friendly, vibrant, full of restaurants, bars, boutique fashion and quiet residential streets full of terrace houses, trees and little parks.
transit: Lots of public transport - buses to the beach and two different train stations, on different lines, which take you to the city within 8 minutes.  Each station is just 200 m of the house, but due to the triangle of train line we sit within, the train noise is distant.
access: Guests have access to whole house and garden. One room locked off.
interaction: The house will be entirely yours for the period of the rental.
house_rules: For instant book:  As this is our family home with treasured belongings, instant bookers must be either a family, adults over 30, or have 5 star Airbnb references  Must have profile with full name, and some details about yourself - for eg, who you are, what you do for work, and why you're travelling. Here's some help on that - https://www.airbnb.com.au/help/article/67  But if you don't meet these requirements and would like to stay, you're welcome to get in touch and give me more details - we can probably book you in the standard way, no probs. Quiet time after 10pm.  No unregistered guests. No parties. Please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions you might have.
host_about:
I am a radio documentary/feature maker with the national public broadcaster, ABC Radio National.  It is a wonderful job in which I get to meet all sorts of fascinating people.  I focus on environmental issues, and music in my programs but have covered all sorts of things, from the secret history of lacemakers from France, who came to Sydney to a story of the Amerindians in Guyana. I've also edited a book called In their branches, with short stories about the trees people have loved.
 
My husband Nick is a professional guitarist - both performer and teacher, specialising in Atlantic soul, alt country and has done a lot of tv and session work with singer songwriters.
A few years ago we had a fantastic time touring Europe for a few months with our son and using Airbnb with delight.   
We live in Sydney in the 'inner west' in an old, restored terrace house, and love sailing our 12 foot boat on the harbour, time in the wonderful National Parks that surround the city, and camping on the coast and in the bush. 
We're keen travellers - Europe, America, Asia, and like to use Airbnb and share our own home and beautiful suburb in the same way.

name: Double room @ beautiful Bondi Beach
space: Just 2 blocks from Bondi Beach and less to your morning coffee, this spacious apartment is on the first floor of a ninety-year old character block of four. Accommodation consists of a double bedroom with a really comfortable (everyone tells me:-) queen bed in a 2 bed apartment at the rear of the apartment next to the balcony. The large fully equipped eat in kitchen leads onto a recently completed balcony complete with hammock and another large outdoor dining area shaded by trees. The bathroom has a full size bath. There is a separate lounge room with a long, large luxurious sofa and other reading and lounging chairs. It's the perfect respite from the hot afternoon sun for a nap or reading The interior of the apartment is modern and comfortable while retaining abundant character with ten foot ceilings, designer furniture, beautiful art and other items picked up by the owners on their travels. Plenty of cafes, supermarkets and Bondi's main shopping precinct is less than 5 minutes walk aw

Accommodation consists of a double bedroom with a really comfortable (everyone tells me:-) queen bed in a 2 bed apartment at the rear of the apartment next to the balcony. The large fully equipped eat in kitchen leads onto a recently completed balcony complete with hammock and another large outdoor dining area shaded by trees. The bathroom has a full size bath. Plenty of cafes, supermarkets and Bondi's main shopping precinct is less than 5 minutes walk aw
house_rules: You will likely be sharing the flat with me. I am pretty much out all day and often in the evenings too. No dinner parties and no more than two guests. No real rules just respectful of each other and let's all have lovely time.  Ask if you need anything. More than happy to help.
host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I'm a designer. I have lived in many cities, countries and travelled to many more. I still travel frequently for work and pleasure. It's fantastic living here. In summer you can start and finish your day with a swim and in winter I love to walk or do yoga on the beach when its much less crowded. 

Sydney's a great place to visit with lots of great place for coffee, breakfast, dinner and/or drinks. There's always plenty to do with movies, galleries, theatre, dance, walks, yoga, kayaking, days away. I know Bondi and Sydney well so can recommend lots of great places so you can pack in as much as you can or do as little as you wish.

name: Funky Victorian Terrace in Newtown
summary: Our house is in a lovely street super close to Camperdown Memorial park, cool cafes, bars, restaurants and public transport. It's a friendly and relaxed neighbourhood with a very hip vibe.
space: We rent out our funky and eclectically furnished 3 bedroom terrace when we go away for the weekend or school holidays. Our house would particularly suit cat-lovers, as we have 2 cats who will need feeding.  The rent is low because of the cats, so take advantage if you're cat lovers! The house has a large living room and kitchen dining room opening out onto a backyard, 2 bathrooms and three bedrooms.  - The main bedroom has a queen size bed and a balcony overlooking the street.  - The second bedroom has bunk beds.  - Downstairs bedroom has one single bed.  - Outside, there's backyard with chairs and a table.  - The laundry has a washing machine and a dryer. There's also a washing line in the back yard. We have broadband wifi, ipod/cd player, TV with PVR and blue-ray player with wifi connectivity. The house is located in Newtown, a funky inner city suburb of Sydney. It's very close to the University of Sydney and Royal Prince Alfred hospital. There's a train station and bus stops a 5 min

I'm an educational designer working at the University of Sydney, married to Josef, a teacher. We have 2 kids and are yoga enthusiasts.
We love traveling, eating and meeting new people.

name: Large room Sydney harbour views
summary: This lovely hillside house in a leafy neighbourhood features a huge terraced garden with views over the bay and the Harbour Bridge, while the bedroom looks onto the Harbour and Cockatoo Island. It has a well equipped kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Great shopping centre a 4 min walk away. 15 mins from the CBD by bus. All local buses go to the CBD, so waiting time is minimal. You can also catch ferries to Circular Quay (CBD). There is all-day street parking. An ideal location for visitors to Sydney.
space: Comfortable room with queen-size bed, sheets and towels supplied, in a character home overlooking the harbour. It features a huge terraced garden visited by rainbow lorikeets every morning for breakfast. The garden has views on the Harbour Bridge, while the bedroom looks onto Cockatoo Island. The kitchen and the washing machine are at your disposal. There are 2 bathrooms and wireless Internet. The house is 10 to 15 minutes from the CBD by bus. Bus stop is a 5 minute walk away. All buses go to the CBD (i.e. waiting time is minimal). You can also catch ferries to the CBD. I am in my early fifties, from Brittany and Paris and I will gladly give you tips on what to do in and around Sydney (I also work as a tour guide). Fluent Breton, French, German, Italian, Spanish spoken in the home. All-day street parking. A 4 minute walk to the Birkenhead Point Shopping Centre with stylish boutiques as well as discount outlets, restaurants and cafés. Non smokers only.
description: This lovely hillside house in a leafy neighbourhood features a huge terraced garden with views over the bay and the Harbour Bridge, while the bedroom looks onto the Harbour and Cockatoo Island. It has a well equipped kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Great shopping centre a 4 min walk away. 15 mins from the CBD by bus. All local buses go to the CBD, so waiting time is minimal. You can also catch ferries to Circular Quay (CBD). There is all-day street parking. An ideal location for visitors to Sydney. Comfortable room with queen-size bed, sheets and towels supplied, in a character home overlooking the harbour. It features a huge terraced garden visited by rainbow lorikeets every morning for breakfast. The garden has views on the Harbour Bridge, while the bedroom looks onto Cockatoo Island. The kitchen and the washing machine are at your disposal. There are 2 bathrooms and wireless Internet. The house is 10 to 15 minutes from the CBD by bus. Bus stop is a 5 minute walk away. All buses go to the C
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is quiet and leafy. We have a great unobtrusive and stylish shopping centre nearby, with stylish shops and cafés. The location of our neighbourhood is ideal for touring and practical purposes.
notes: There is restricted street parking in the neighbourhood but I have a resident's permit. The permit may have to be shared with visitors. You might have to park some distance away from the house as it is a bit difficult to park directly in front of the house during the day, unless you park temporarily in front of my garage. From late afternoon, parking is plentiful.
transit: It is easy and quick to reach the city centre by public transport: Bus (15-20 minutes), taxi/Uber (10 minutes), ferry (45 minutes). The location of our neighbourhood is ideal for touring and professional purposes.
access: Apart from your room, your will, of course, have access to the living room, kitchen, bathroom, verandahs and garden. And do not forget to have a turn basking in the hammock.
interaction: Having worked as a tour guide, I like to share my knowledge of Sydney and the area with my guests and have a chat over a coffee, or a meal.
house_rules: I love pets, but they must be quiet, for the neighbours' sake. To preserve the tranquility of all in the house, please do not cook meals and wash dishes after 8pm.
host_about:
My aim is for you to feel at home. Being a linguist, I like to discuss any subject. I also like travelling, trekking, swimming, dancing... I teach or have taught English, French, Italian, Spanish and German, so if you are from those background, we have a language in common. I also like cooking, particularly Asian food, but I also prepare French and Breton dishes.
My house is simple and has always had a good feel about it. The lovely little lorikeets that visit everyday are one of its blessings. One the best features of the garden is the hammock on the top tier, from which there is a beautiful view over the harbour.

summary: Room w/views of tranquil park Delicious continental breakfast 5 min to beach Close to Bondi, Bronte and Clovelly beaches Public transport outside my door 30 min from airport and city centre Available for ONE guest only.  No children

Snorkelling, fishing, diving, fitness classes, yoga, and great cafes. I love living here and look forward to your inquiry and hosting you while in Sydney. Sydney is well-endowed with open spaces and access to waterways, and has many natural areas,
neighborhood_overview: Village atmosphere and very quiet
transit: Bus just outside my door  20 min from airport
access: Wifi - within reason! Kitchen
house_rules: No Smoking Mature No guests No parties  This is a small space that you will share with the host so a considerate, cheerful and tidy person would best suit this arrangement.
host_about:
I work as an International Health Advisor.   My work has taken me to Africa, Cambodia, China, Fiji, Indonesia, Iraq, Laos, Papua New Guinea, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Timor-Leste, Vanuatu and Vietnam.  This year, I just want to 'sit still' and enjoy my beautiful apartment at Coogee Beach and I look forward to meeting interesting people to share it with.  I have a good sense of humour and get along with most people!  

My interests are music, dance, film, sport, rugby, yoga  and food!

name: Resort Style minutes from the City
summary: Only a couple of blocks away from busy North Sydney, Wondakiah offers a quiet nature oasis with resort facilities.
space: Welcome to Waverton The Apartment Room with exclusive bath/shower/toilet and private access to terrace is available in a high class, modern 3 br apartment. I am inviting you to share lounge, kitchen and outside areas. As our guest all facilities are included for free. Walk through the gardens or in the bush. Have a game of tennis. Enjoy the gym and a sauna. Have a swim in the long indoor lap pool or in any of the two outdoor pools and relax in the spa whenever you want. If you have a car we offer secure undercover parking. The Local Area We live in the beautiful Wondakiah Estate in Waverton and offer you to join us for your visit to Sydney. A quiet oasis very close to the city, Wondakiah offers landscaped gardens between two nature reserves and waterfront to Sydney Harbour. Public Transport Waverton station on the Northern train line is 4 minutes' walk away. From there, it is only a 10 minute train ride into the bustling CBD.  We look forward to having you stay with us. Gregory and Mag

name: Ruby's Oasis at Bondi Beach! Sunny corner studio.
summary: Sunny, breezy, top floor studio with balcony, less than 100 metres to Bondi Beach!
space: Ever dreamed of waking up to uninterrupted sunlight gently filtering in, as you luxuriate in the hotel quality sheets on your four poster bed? Then stepping outside to find a variety of specialty cafes offering tempting breakfasts and excellent coffee, before wandering down to the beach? Spend your days at Ruby’s Oasis exploring what Bondi has to offer. The Bondi to Bronte coastal walk starts at the Bondi Icebergs, where you can also swim laps in the ocean pool, or relax in their sauna that looks out over the water.  Discover the airy yoga studios, cafes, and restaurants, boutique shops and mini galleries before sampling the delicious drinks and live music on offer at one of the many vibrant bars that open their doors at sunset. A luxury beachside lifestyle, plus easy public transport to the CBD! Featuring a sunlit balcony, this renovated  studio comes with a beautiful, four poster queen size bed, fully equipped kitchen including microwave and dishwasher, and an enviable location.

house_rules: Sorry but parties are strictly forbidden. No under 30 year olds can book. No smoking inside. Smoking only outside.
host_about:
I have had a holiday rental business, Ruby's Holiday Residences, for 13 years now. I feel like I am running my own private hotel, but the rooms are just spread out over many sites!
I love to travel (my friends call me a gypsy!) and spend my year between Sydney, London and Nice. I run my business from anywhere. But it's work everyday in this industry! No rest for the wicked!
Travel, food, cinema, more travel and more food are my passions. I love all things French, so any travel in France, French food or cinema are my favourites.

name: Sydneys garden suburb, bright & SC
space: G'day!   Our studio apartment is self contained with a Queen size bed, sofa, dining table and chairs, work bench and plenty of storage space.   It is equipped with TV, Wi Fi, Air Cond, well stocked kitchen, bathroom with shower and a private entrance.  You would also have the use of our pool and we can do your washing for a small fee if need be.  We live in what is known as Sydney's Hills district and are within walking distance to Muirfield Golf Course and Westfield shopping Centre, North Rocks.  Macquarie University, one of Australia's leading universities is not far away. The studio apartment is attached to our house which overlooks Bidjigal Reserve, a place of rugged natural beauty and full of hidden treasures; a time capsule of ancient ecosystems, aboriginal shelters and colonial history with sheer sandstone cliffs, towering eucalypt forest, sparkling creeks and sheltered rainforest gullies, it is an oasis of natural habitat in the middle of urban Sydney. The reserve supports a wi

It is equipped with TV, Wi Fi, Air Cond, well stocked kitchen, bathroom with shower and a private entrance.  You would also have the use of our pool and we can do your washing for a small fee if need be.  We live in what is known as Sydney's Hills district and are within walking distance to Muirfield Golf Course and Westfield shopping Centre, North Rocks.  Macquarie University, one of Australia's leading universities is not far away. The studio apartment is attached to our house which overlooks Bidjigal Reserve, a place of rugged natural beauty and full of hidden treasures; a time capsule of ancient ecosystems, aboriginal shelters and colonial history with sheer sandstone cliffs, towering eucalypt forest, sparkling creeks and sheltered rainforest gullies, it is an oasis of natural habitat in the middle of urban Sydney. The reserve supports a wi
notes: For a small fee we can organise to do your washing.
house_rules: No smoking in the flat. No pets allowed. Please always lock the front door when you leave, thanks. You can arrange to use the washing machine if need be and clothes are dried on the line in the garden.  The dryer is strictly for emergency use only. We also appreciate if you turn off electricity if you are not in the rooms.
host_about:
Friendly and fun-loving; I'm a retired businesswoman, mother of six children and five gorgeous grandchildren.  Together with my partner I love to travel the world far and wide although there are still many countries we have yet to experience.  We occasionally host international homestay students, having had visitors from the USA, Turkey, Japan, Korea, Thailand, China, Colombia, Peru, Argentina and Germany and would love to host Airbnb members visiting Sydney.

“One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion”  Simone de Beauvoir (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

name: Townhouse in heart of Sydney/Dlg Hrbr/Chinatown
summary: Family terrace house in the heart of Darling Harbour/ Chinatown. Easy walking distance to most Sydney attractions and very close to Central Station and the light rail. Advice about the local area and restaurants provided. 15 minute walk from the ICC convention centre. Child friendly - cots, toys books and parks nearby.
space: Two storey terrace house minutes away from Darling Harbour, Imax, Tumbalong Park, Maritime Museum, ICC Exhibition Centre, Chinatown, paddys markets, entertainment centre and Powerhouse Museum. Short walk to central station, Sydney city centre, lovely cafes and restaurants in pyrmont, star casino, broadway shopping centre and movie cinema.  Surrounded by lots of little parks. Good coffee available nearby. Free wireless Internet available. Very close to some delicious Japanese,Thai and modern australian restaurants! Pubs and bars within walking distance. Friendly neighbourhood area. Balcony off the main bedroom and courtyard off the back lounge. Two lounge areas and a laundry/toilet in addition to an upstairs bathroom. Pet friendly and dog door into the courtyard (for a small dog). Lovely and light and in an amazing neighborhood.  Third bedroom is a single bed with a pull out trundle bed. And we have a blow up camping mattress if you needed to get a couple more people in. Very close to a

neighborhood_overview: Incredibly friendly people and community and so close to everything that you never have to get in a car! Plenty of parks nearby including kids parks. Close to shops and restaurants.
notes: We have a cot, childrens toys and books and a highchair which are available on request.  Please note that you will occasionally come across a cockroach or two which is one of the only downsides of living in Sydney.
transit: This is one of the best suburbs in Sydney for convenience. Most things like Darling Harbour, the City, Chinatown, King Street Wharf, Aquarium, Wildlife World, Madame Toussard's, Tumbalong Park, ICC and Chinese Gardens are walking distance. Central Station is 15 minutes walk and buses leave from Harris Street which is minutes away from the door. Also a short walk from the Light rail.
access: You will have access to the whole house and we encourage you to make yourself at home and use the kitchen and facilities. We have free wifi available and will provide milk and bread for your arrival.
interaction: Very little. We are very available to answer questions and give advice and assistance prior to your visit and while you are here but leave you very much to your own devices so you can relax and enjoy the home as if it were your own
house_rules: No smoking The house is pet friendly if you want to bring small dogs. Please be aware of noise levels and be considerate of our neighbors. No parties please.
host_about:
Very easy going, accommodating and helpful and very happy to share  advice about the local area including best places to eat and drink.

Live with my partner Nick and our three year old. I work in Indigenous education. Enjoy swimming, camping, picnicking and reading. My mum and sister live very close by because we love our neighborhood so much. Can't imagine living anywhere else.   

I have stayed in Air B n B residences in lots of locations in Australia and overseas including in New York and London which has been so much nicer than staying in a hotel. 

Our house is so perfectly situated for anyone who loves the city and wants to be able to get out and about and walk everywhere but still want a bit of peace and quiet. We love living where we do and get a lot of enjoyment out of Sydney and like the thought of other people getting to experience that and enjoy our house when we are away. 

We have cots, high chairs etc for people with kids so there is less for you to bring.

We are also happy for people to bring a small dog if they would like as we have a dog door and courtyard and lots of dog friendly parks nearby.

name: Leafy North Shore House in Trees 2
space: We have a beautiful and large family home in leafy East Lindfield on Sydney's North Shore with 2 lovely private B & B double bedrooms available with bathroom facilities.   Each room is comfortable for a couple or single. Not suitable for a roll-away, but we do have 2 rooms available, next to each other. Wi-fi, TV, Foxtel in house, ceiling fans in the rooms. Washing machine and dryer, refrigerator, tea and coffee facilities available for your convenience. Fantastic pool and BBQ area - great place to relax after a hard day sight-seeing or working, particularly in Summer months. Only a short walk to Lindfield Train Station and shops, or the bus to the city is just one block away (We can always drive you to the station if we are around). Chatswood is 2 trains stops away. 20 minutes to the central city by train. 20 minutes to most North-side beaches. Good run through by car to all these spots.  Easy access to North Ryde & Macquarie Uni for business travelers. A great peaceful base for touri
description: We have a beautiful and large family home in leafy East Lindfield on Sydney's North Shore with 2 lovely private B & B double bedrooms available with bathroom facilities.   Each room is comfortable for a couple or single. Not suitable for a roll-away, but we do have 2 rooms available, next to each other. Wi-fi, TV, Foxtel in house, ceiling fans in the rooms. Washing machine and dryer, refrigerator, tea and coffee facilities available for your convenience. Fantastic pool and BBQ area - great place to relax after a hard day sight-seeing or working, particularly in Summer months. Only a short walk to Lindfield Train Station and shops, or the bus to the city is just one block away (We can always drive you to the station if we are around). Chatswood is 2 trains stops away. 20 minutes to the central city by train. 20 minutes to most North-side beaches. Good run through by car to all these spots.  Easy access to North Ryde & Macquarie Uni for business travelers. A great peaceful base for touri
house_rules: This is the home of working professionals - it is not a party house.  If you want to party, please choose another property as we have to get up early for work.  Please note, price quoted is per room  as airbnb does not have facility to list both rooms on same listing - contact me and I can alter the price to accomodate 2 room booking or book both at the same time through our other listing Leafy North Shore House in Trees 1. Please only use the pool if you can swim - children must be supervised by an adult at all times. We do have a cat, so would prefer no animals. Check-in 2pm, check-out 11am, however, we are flexible if there are not others coming in to the rooms.
host_about: We are a family who travel ourselves frequently for business and pleasure and know how much more pleasant it is to be in a home situation rather than an impersonal hotel. So we have decided to make our home available for others to enjoy.  We know the best travel advice comes from local people, so love to share our city with fellow travelers. We are happy to provide bed and breakfast to those who would like a quiet base or oasis for their Sydney or San Francisco visits.

name: Massive Warehouse Loft Apartment
summary: Now that Instant Book is being forced on hosts, we might not have a chance to chat before you book. Read the FULL description and look at the photos carefully. It's a big space on the first floor of an old warehouse. Downstairs is a working art studio - The Bakehouse Studio Marrickville run by Lisa Hoelzl. The guests who love our place the most are the ones who like the idea of staying in a warehouse flat on top of a studio and engaging with our odd extended household and neighbourhood.
space: A while ago, Airbnb sent a New York photographer/artist/writer called Todd Selby around the world to stay in 5 Airbnb properties. He went to London, Paris, LA, Tokyo and....... Marrickville. Airbnb and Todd thought ours was the most interesting Airbnb property in Sydney.  A guest recently said our place was 'what Airbnb used to be like'. I know what they mean. In the beginning, Airbnb was about interesting spaces and active hosts who liked to meet guests and help make their stay interesting. Now, there are people managing multiple properties for absent hosts. They are more like serviced apartments full of IKEA furniture. There is no IKEA furniture in our pad. Last year, when Qantas did their frequent flyer partnership with Airbnb, they picked this property as one of the best in Airbnbs in Sydney. I think it got the 'quirky' vote. Yes, it does seem strangely inexpensive compared to many other Airbnb listings considering how big it is. Keeping the price down means we attract more interes
description: Now that Instant Book is being forced on hosts, we might not have a chance to chat before you book. Read the FULL description and look at the photos carefully. It's a big space on the first floor of an old warehouse. Downstairs is a working art studio - The Bakehouse Studio Marrickville run by Lisa Hoelzl. The guests who love our place the most are the ones who like the idea of staying in a warehouse flat on top of a studio and engaging with our odd extended household and neighbourhood. A while ago, Airbnb sent a New York photographer/artist/writer called Todd Selby around the world to stay in 5 Airbnb properties. He went to London, Paris, LA, Tokyo and....... Marrickville. Airbnb and Todd thought ours was the most interesting Airbnb property in Sydney.  A guest recently said our place was 'what Airbnb used to be like'. I know what they mean. In the beginning, Airbnb was about interesting spaces and active hosts who liked to meet guests and help make their stay interesting. Now, there
neighborhood_overview: We are in an area of Sydney called the 'inner west'. Politically, it's a left leaning area with lots of immigrants - Greeks from the 1960s and Vietnamese from the 70s. It also has lots of artists and is gay friendly. About 700 metres from our place is the train to the city - 15 minute ride. There is also a bus to the city just up the road.
transit: Parking on the street is free and always available.
access: The stairs up to your pad are in the art studio, so you will pass through that space often. You are of course welcome to hang around and have a chat and a drink and maybe make pot or something. The backyard has a hammock and chairs and is a nice place to sit in the afternoons. If you are a gardener and missing your garden, I've got plenty of tools you can use. If you are a DIY guy and missing your shed, I'm always keen for company in my shed.
interaction: Our house is attached to the warehouse building. We are around all the time. After 6 years of hosting, I am pretty good at helping people - and I enjoy it.
house_rules: Now that Instant Book is being forced on hosts, we don't get a chance to talk before you make a booking. This space is NOT suitable for children of any age. The pictures show the space very well. It is a big, old space in a warehouse. Beneath the pad is a working art studio (mostly ceramics), so there are times when people are in there doing arty stuff. They like it when people come down for a chat or a glass of wine and you might like to join in and make something. I hope you will respect the apartment. It is a separate building, so you can come and go as you please. It's not a place for parties, but I don't imagine many travellers have wild parties? The backyard is for smoking. And gardening if you feel like it. If in doubt about anything, you can ask us - we live next door.
host_about:
That's the only photograph I could find. Looks a bit corporate, doesn't it. I'll have to find one of the family or one of me doing something whacky.
Lisa and I live in the house next door to the building where the apartment is.
Over the years, we've had various people living with us at our rambling property. And now, thanks to Airbnb, we are sharing the place with the world. There are three buildings: the house, the studio/apartment building, the garage where one long term visitor is still living (11 years and counting). There are often interesting people hanging around our place and we'd be keen for you to be part of all that if it suits you.
I work in the city - office job. My wife is far more interesting. She's an artist and does great stuff in the downstairs studio (The Bakehouse Studio Marrickville) as well as teaching art and design at a university. (I might have to make up some stuff about myself.)

name: Serendipity in the Suburbs
space: Welcome to Pennant Hills! Your Space One bedroom available in leafy suburban friendly family home in Sydney's northwest, 1/4 acre yard with gardens, fishponds, chickens and a black Labrador dog. Large sunny deck overlooks the back yard. Walk to shops and train (45 minutes to CBD). Free wireless internet. Breakfast is included. Local attractions The entry to the Great Northern Walk (a bush walk which goes from Sydney all the way to Newcastle) is at the end of our street. Koala Park, where you can see and even pet a wide range of native animals, is also in Pennant Hills, with an easy bus service to it. Pennant Hills Park is a large public sports complex with tennis courts, soccer fields, netball, and archery. Your Hosts We are a relaxed older professional couple, we enjoy meeting travellers from around the world. He is a research scientist/inventor. She is a videomaker and ESL teacher.

name: 1br, Parking, WiFi, Garden
summary: Newly renovated, fresh and clean art deco apartment with own courtyard.
space: Available September 2nd to October 31st for maximum two people at $595.00 per week. Large eclectic and cosy open plan one bedroom furnished apartment in an Art Deco building in Summer Hill. Tastefully furnished, floorboards throughout, 3 metre high ceilings and two huge built in  wardrobes. Queen size bed. Dining area. The apartment includes a delightful, furnished and established garden at your disposal. Kitchen is generously equipped including microwave, gas stove and oven, fridge, crockery, cooking utensils and glassware. Without dishwasher. Bathroom includes bathtub and shower. All in fresh and clean condition. Internal laundry without dryer. Cleaning products and washing powder provided. Basic toiletries - soap, toothpaste, shampoo and conditioner provided. Tea and Coffee. Iron. Vacuum cleaner. Umbrella. Access to outdoor clothesline. Linen and bath towels provided. Hair dryer. Gas heater. TV. WiFi. Secure car
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quaint and well equipped by local businesses.
transit: Access to public transport is fantastic. Train, bus, tram and taxis within 5 minutes from the apartment.
access: Outside clothesline in shared.
interaction: The apartment will be at your disposal the entire time of your booking. I will be nearby house-sitting. You are welcome to contact me at any time.
house_rules: Please keep the premises clean and aired.  If you'll be using our secure car park ensure you close the electric gate after entering or exiting the car park.
host_about:
Hi,
I'm a prop stylist from Sydney. I live with my husband Michael who is a musician and school teacher. We have a wonderul art deco apartment in the sweetest suburb on the inner west side of Sydney by the name of Summer Hill. We are renting our home for two months while house sitting nearby.  
 We like to host friends for dinner parties that don't go too late. We are respectful of our neighbours and their working hours and expect the same from our guests. We love all forms of visual art and we absolutely love music. When we travel, we like to travel light so we can spend most of our time exploring other places. We loved visiting the south of France and I fell in love with Berlin.  If you like being close to the city and not being woken up in the middle of the night then this is the place for you.

name: Lux pad in Potts Point
space: A luxurious apartment in the Parisian heart of Sydney. Potts Point boasts the best restaurants and cafes in Sydney. Kings cross train station is a 5 minute walk to anywhere you want to go. The apartment is a short walk to the opera house and the water front on Elizabeth Bay and beautiful Rushcutters park, a great spot for running and tennis. Elizabeth bay is 100 metres around the corner with its beautiful park and tennis courts. The apartment itself is highly sought after. It has a heated pool, sauna and a fully equipped gym. There is central heating or cooling in the apartment and it is very modern. There is also a blow up mattress to accomodate an extra person. The apartment is sound proofed and very quiet. Free high speed wifi available in apartment. Local phone calls can be made on my landline. Cable TV , DVD and a BOSE soundtouch to play your own music via bluetooth or Spotify  are available plus plenty of books for your perusal while you relax over a glass of wine, watching the c

neighborhood_overview: I love my street!! it's treelined, dotted with the best cafes and restaurants in a vibrant district. its very cosmopolitan, a cross between Paris and New York. It also sits on the harbour.
notes: There are a couple of beautiful parks just around the corner, Elizabeth Bay and Rushcutters park....
transit: Yes, Kings Cross station is 5 minutes walk away. You can walk to the city and our world famous opera house in about 20 minutes.
access: Guests have access to the pool, sauna and gym in the building
interaction: I generally welcome my guests at my apartment to do a handover of the keys and show them around or will organise for a friend to do it if I am away.
house_rules: No smoking ,pets or parties please. Apartment to be kept clean and to be considerate with noise levels. Please water my indoor pot plants once a week on Mondays. Please throw rubbish in the rubbish room on the same floor regularly. A no shoes indoors policy also applies as the apartment is carpeted. Please do not make a booking until I have confirmed it and also, I will lease my apartment out to those who have photo verifications and good reviews etc. In addition, no downloading of movies or big files on my wifi account as it takes up my quota for the month and slows the speed down immensely for my other guests.  My home should be treated like it was your home as its not a hotel. Concierge services are meant for residents of the building only as per the strata rules. Thank you.
host_about:
I am a registered nurse and travel a fair bit . I am able to short lease my apartment to neat , like minded (Website hidden by Airbnb) life motto is carpe diem. I cannot live without my iPad ,iPod, iphone,my family and my friends. You can tell I am an apple freak!
My style of traveling is mostly based on comfort...the more comfortable, the better.  Looking forward to hosting you, my airbnb afficionados...

name: Cremorne B&B great quiet central!
summary: Welcome to the stunning area of Cremorne and thank you for checking this listing!  Stay with some real Sydney siders in my modern family home ideally located in a quiet street just 4 km from Sydney city centre!  This home is a fantastic base for a Sydney holiday, business, travel or study.  I have two rooms available for guests, please see the additional listing in AIRBNB if you need another room for friends or family.
space: Welcome to the stunning area of Cremorne and thank you for checking this listing!  Stay with some real Sydney siders in my modern family home ideally located in a quiet street just 4 km from Sydney city centre!  This home is a fantastic base for a Sydney holiday, business, travel or study. The house:  Come stay and enjoy one of our two elegantly decorated guest rooms. The house boasts the luxury of having 2 bathrooms. It has a lovely open plan kitchen and living area that leads to the outdoor dining/ BBQ area, level garden and veranda. My guest rooms have twin beds and can accommodate singles, two friends, couples or family groups.  Wireless internet is available and there is plenty of free street parking. neighborhood_overview: Quite leafy area, across the road from a very large harbour front park ideal for walks. Also located on the city link cycle path and guests are welcome to bring their bikes. Otherwise it is a 400 metre walk to regular city or beach buses.
notes: About your Host:  I have three very friendly small cross poodle dogs and a cat who make everyone welcome. I have hosted travelers and international students in my home for more than ten years and enjoy welcoming people to Sydney.
transit: Designated bike/cycle way at door, alternatively 400 metre walk to bus stop, can walk to the city via harbour bridge in about 45 minutes. There is lots of free street parking if you drive or taxis are always available. Reddy GO is a local bike sharing company so it is very easy to rent a bike and pick it up locally, sometimes just out front of the home (gps tracking bikes can be dropped off anywhere just need to download the app). Car sharing is also available locally through GoGet if you need cost effective rental car, can be picked 300 metres up the road.
access: Shared access to living room, kitchen, bathroom, laundry, garden and terrace.
interaction: I am available in house for information and advise.
house_rules: No smoking on the property, this is a shared home with normal consideration and respect for other guest or residents is requested.  For safety no unregistered guests allowed to visit. Kitchen is available to guests for heating and light meals only. If you have any question or special requests please ask.
host_about: I am interested in sport, cinema, music, reading, theatre, travel, pets, foreign cultures, photography, gardening, the outdoors, watching movies and documentaries, talking with friends, computer/internet, going to the beach or walking in the mountains.  I try to live everyday in a positive way.

In life you need something to love, something to look forward to and something to do!!

name: Lovely spacious 3 bedroom home
space: We're located in Sydney's Inner West, about 6km from the city centre.  The nearest train station is an 8 minute walk with a 12 minute ride to Central Station. Only a stop or 2 more and you have easy access to the Harbour, Opera House and museums and galleries. We're also 15-20 minutes drive from the airport. As for most of Sydney there's a huge range of cuisines and cultures on your doorstep. Our neighbourhood and close surrounds feature strong flavours of Portuguese, Italian and Vietnamese cultures.  Our neighbourhood has many nice old houses and established trees. There are several parks within walking distance as well as a local swimming pool. It's an area with many families as well as people who just want to live in a nice area in close proximity to the centre of Sydney and easy access to the bush, harbour and bay walks, cycling paths, city cafes and Sydney's 'arty' areas in the Inner West. Our home is open plan, light and has a lovely feel. The original house dates from the 1880s,
description: We're located in Sydney's Inner West, about 6km from the city centre.  The nearest train station is an 8 minute walk with a 12 minute ride to Central Station. Only a stop or 2 more and you have easy access to the Harbour, Opera House and museums and galleries. We're also 15-20 minutes drive from the airport. As for most of Sydney there's a huge range of cuisines and cultures on your doorstep. Our neighbourhood and close surrounds feature strong flavours of Portuguese, Italian and Vietnamese cultures.  Our neighbourhood has many nice old houses and established trees. There are several parks within walking distance as well as a local swimming pool. It's an area with many families as well as people who just want to live in a nice area in close proximity to the centre of Sydney and easy access to the bush, harbour and bay walks, cycling paths, city cafes and Sydney's 'arty' areas in the Inner West. Our home is open plan, light and has a lovely feel. The original house dates from the 1880s,
house_rules: Dinner parties are fine, but no "house parties" please.  No smoking anywhere in our house or grounds.  No house belongings to be taken off premises.  Two sets of house keys will be issued. All doors and windows to be locked when the house is unoccupied.   Please do not attempt to clean the oven AT ALL (it's a pyrolitic with a special process)! Only fruit and veges in the compost please.
host_about:
I'm originally from the UK and although I've been here almost twenty years I still LOVE going back to London and traveling in Europe. I'm a bit partial to Spain, Italy, Greece and Scotland, but give me a beautiful house and garden anywhere with my family and I'll love it.

We're a family of 3. Myself, Kent and Liam our six year old son. Fortunately he's a fab traveler (Liam that is) and we take advantage of that and take ourselves off on overseas trips and we've recently become avid campers too. When we're not doing that I'm a mum and a designer and painter. Kent's very clever and does stuff I don't understand with Internet protocol and tv.

We love our house and I especially like spring and autumn and having all our doors and windows open, that inside outside living thing (obviously we do that all summer too). I think our house is great for hanging out in and we really enjoy having many guests and visitors. If we're at home, social occasions are relaxed and friendly, preferably with kids running in and out. If you're staying at our house we hope you like the feel of it as much as we do.

name: Quiet Location Near Universities!
summary: Convenient, quiet location. You will have your own private bathroom, and your bedroom has a double bed, wardrobe, smart TV (with Netflix) and a desk. Easy walk to the University of Sydney and University of Technology Sydney, and a short bus/train ride to the CBD (but it is walkable). (Please note that during the Christmas and New Year holiday period we are only accepting bookings of 7 days or more)
space: Thanks for checking out our apartment in Chippendale. We are located on the fringe of Sydney city, and it’s a quiet location near the University of Sydney and the University of Technology Sydney, as well as Central Station/Chinatown Yours is a 9 sqm bedroom in a large 2-bedroom apartment with balcony and a courtyard garden. You will have your own private bathroom. Your room has a double bed, built-in wardrobe, smart TV (with Netflix and other online entertainment apps), and a desk. We are quite flexible with check in time; we’ll try our best to accommodate your estimated time of arrival. We have set the check out time at 10 am. If you wish to have a late checkout, please  discuss with us. We’ll try to accommodate your request if possible.  Central Railway Station is only 8 minutes walk and then it's only one stop to the city centre on the bus straight up George street, or you can enjoy an easy 25-minute walk to the city centre, and onto Circular Quay, the Opera House, the Rocks and Har

neighborhood_overview: Chippendale is the creative hub of Sydney. It's so close to the city, yet it's such a quiet and peaceful suburb. Plenty of restaurants and cafes in the immediate vicinity and the neighbourhood. There are two shopping centres close by: Broadway and Central Park. We have lived here for more than 10 years, and still loving it!
notes: You are welcome to use the kitchen to make a cup of tea/coffee and light snacks/meals at anytime you like, but we prefer it if you are not cooking full meals.
transit: We practically walk everywhere when possible - to the city, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay (Sydney Opera House), Newtown, Glebe, etc.  Central Railway Station and Redfern Railway Station are an easy 10- to 15-min walk, and the bus stops along Broadway are about 5 min away.
access: Private Bathroom
interaction: As much or as little as you like.
house_rules: No shoes in the apartment please; there is space at the front door for your shoes.  Non-smoking apartment; if you want to smoke,you can use our private courtyard. You are welcomed to use the kitchen to make a cup of tea/coffee and light snacks whenever you like, but we prefer it if you are not cooking full meals.

We are an Asian-Caucasian gay couple.

9 sqm bedroom in a large 2-bedroom apartment with balcony and a courtyard garden, you will have your own private bathroom.
