name: Modern family house in Bondi Beach
summary: Our large 4 bedroom house with parking is located in a quiet street yet close to cafes, restaurant and fabulous Bondi Beach.  It is well equipped and comfortable, with a gourmet kitchen and a leafy outdoor area with BBQ. Ideal for large families. Sydney CBD is 30mn away by public transport.
space: Modern, comfortable and with a gourmet kitchen, this two levels semi-house is located in North Bondi and will provide an ideal setting for a family holiday Popular cafes and restaurants are a couple of blocks away and beautiful Bondi beach is a 5 - 10 minute stroll The house if fully equipped including WiFi,  TVs, washing/drying machines, dishwasher etc.  All rooms have ceiling fans. Parking in our driveway. By arrangement, we will provide access to bicycles (adults and kids), surfboards and our Netflix subscription. Rental prices vary as per calendar. We usually take bookings for minimum 6 nights, with possible discounts for longer stays over 7 days (email us for more info). Standard check in at 2pm and checkout 11am, however we'll accommodate times suitable to you provided we do not have contiguous bookings.
description: Our large 4 bedroom house with parking is located in a quiet street yet close to cafes, restaurant and fabulous Bondi Beach.  It is well equipped and comfortable, with a gourmet kitchen and a leafy outdoor area with BBQ. Ideal for large families. Sydney CBD is 30mn away by public transport. Modern, comfortable and with a gourmet kitchen, this two levels semi-house is located in North Bondi and will provide an ideal setting for a family holiday Popular cafes and restaurants are a couple of blocks away and beautiful Bondi beach is a 5 - 10 minute stroll The house if fully equipped including WiFi,  TVs, washing/drying machines, dishwasher etc.  All rooms have ceiling fans. Parking in our driveway. By arrangement, we will provide access to bicycles (adults and kids), surfboards and our Netflix subscription. Rental prices vary as per calendar. We usually take bookings for minimum 6 nights, with possible discounts for longer stays over 7 days (email us for more info). Standard check in at 2p
neighborhood_overview: Trendy cafés, restaurants, shops and transport are within a short 2 min stroll.
notes: Amenities Include: - 2 x TV / Sound system - Internet / wireless Internet - Gourmet kitchen, dishwasher and Nespresso machine - Heating and ceiling fans in bedrooms - Parking / garage - Cotton linen - Washer and Dryer - Family friendly, happy to leave child car seats toys bikes etc
transit: Buses are just 100m away and will take you to the train station and to the centre of Sydney in 30mn
access: The house has four bedrooms - One with a King size bed, another a queen size one, two with 2 single beds each  The lounge, kitchen and dining room open out onto the courtyard, which has a BBQ and an outdoor dining table sheltered from the sun by surrounding palm trees. There are a separate TV room, two modern bathrooms and an external laundry.  A car spot is available (a real bonus in summer!) and you can enjoy our lovely upstairs terrace.
interaction: We usually will be travelling in Australia or overseas while are guests are enjoying Bondi. However we are never more than an email or phone call away
house_rules: We value our neighbors in this family friendly part of Bondi, so not the right place to stay if you intend to have noisy evenings.
host_about: Originally respectively from France and Colombia, we met in Sydney in 2001 and decided to stay. Now a family with three young kids, we enjoy the outdoors in Bondi as well as travelling around.

name: EntireModern DesignerTerrace House
summary: *Please note a minimum of 5 nights is required for January 2019 bookings* This is as central as it gets! Surry Hills is close enough to walk to the city with an array of great restaurants, cafés and a variety of nightlife choices right at your doorstep, yet situated in a leafy, quiet lane-way for peaceful sleeps with a friendly neighbourhood.
space: Generous two bedroom modern fully renovated terrace with everything you need at your doorstep in the heart of Surry Hills yet very quiet and secure in leafy laneway. Light-filled throughout yet cozy and comfortable within. Comfortably sleeps 4. Queen size bed in bedroom 2 and with balcony access from master bedroom which has a King bed. Open plan living area and access to sunny front courtyards. Balinese garden in back courtyard with an outside shower. Full use of Wifi, Cable TV etc. Help yourself with basics, Coffee or tea, please feel free to use. Wifi included. No parties or smoking anywhere in the house. Strictly 4 people maximum. No children under the age of 12.  If I'm in the neighborhood, I'm happy to direct you to nearby hot spots. You won't feel you're right next to one of the buzziest streets of Surry Hills at all. The house is tucked away in a friendly neighbourhood. You will be sure you'll feel relaxed and have good nights sleep while you are here. Buses are literally right

Surry Hills is close enough to walk to the city with an array of great restaurants, cafés and a variety of nightlife choices right at your doorstep, yet situated in a leafy, quiet lane-way for peaceful sleeps with a friendly neighbourhood. Generous two bedroom modern fully renovated terrace with everything you need at your doorstep in the heart of Surry Hills yet very quiet and secure in leafy laneway. Light-filled throughout yet cozy and comfortable within. Comfortably sleeps 4. Queen size bed in bedroom 2 and with balcony access from master bedroom which has a King bed. Open plan living area and access to sunny front courtyards. Balinese garden in back courtyard with an outside shower. Full use of Wifi, Cable TV etc. Help yourself with basics, Coffee or tea, please feel free to use. Wifi included. No parties or smoking anywhere in the house. Strictly 4 people maximum. No children
neighborhood_overview: Surry Hills is well known for being the buzziest inner city suburb with a diverse range of bars, excellent restaurants and shopping. It is surrounded by parks and tree lined streets, charming laneways and many gorgeous heritage listed terraces. It champions as the suburb that has the most cycle lanes. It has the most number of designers, creative people living and working here as it's demographic in Sydney. Over 60% of people are creatives and over 90% are small entrepreneur businesses. Groceries, cafés and galleries are at my doorstep. Public transport are all within minutes walk.  Bus stops are all within 2-8 minutes walk. Central Train station - 10 mins walk 20 mins walk to the inner city.  15 mins by bus to the city.  20 mins by bus to Bondi beach.  All in all, you're probably be saving close to $40 a day on taxis fares if you're further out as everything is close enough. If you're well travelled and keen to explore all that Sydney has to offer, This is the perfect spot, The house
notes: Guests that stay for longer than 14 nights, please advise I will charge an extra $100 cleaning fees for any nights after 14 nights of stay. I like to keep it tidy and clean.  0.5% drop out over this year. From time to time check minimum stays over some months with Special Notes attached.  Please note: Please treat this place and things as your own. As this is my primary residence and NOT an investment property. I'm not making some fat profit - I'm just a strong believer in the sharing economy as you are. Thank you.
transit: Bus station 5 minutes walk Central Station 10 minutes walk Parking is off-street. Please check for restricted times. Uber is highly recommended around Sydney as it's close to 40% of normal taxi fares. Getting here from the airport via taxi around $35-40 or by train which is around $16 (not recommended if you have luggage as it's hilly from the station around 15-20mins walk).
access: Wifi, DVD, Xbox, Cable-TV Laundry facilities Washer and Dryer Microwave Cooking essentials Quality fresh linen Tea/Coffee Nespresso machine Hairdryer
interaction: Only If I'm in town, I will drop by to collect mail. I'll gladly have a glass or two if you're free for a chat.
house_rules: There's no smoking inside the house. I have courtyard spaces for that. No hosting parties/events. There's plenty fun places just around the corner. I'd appreciate if you feed my two goldfish.  Fish feed will be provided. I'd appreciate if the place is left in a reasonably clean state so it is nice and clean for the next guests. Treat the house as is your own during your stay. Thank you.
host_about:
Hi, I am a friendly Creative Director having lived in Surry Hills for the last 10 years plus. Hosted many housemates, guests and travelers with many good memories shared over the years. I love traveling and meeting new people and appreciate sharing life experiences. Sydney is a fantastic place to live and it has been my 7th city that I have lived so I'm easy going of people from all walks of life. Being a professional in the Creative industry I appreciate all sorts of art and design related stuff. So do feel free to use my library.

I am respectful of your privacy. I look forward to welcome you to Sydney in the near future!

name: Central + Surry Hills + Views + YAY
space: Stay in the heart of Surry Hills, the best neighbourhood in Sydney. This comfortable, secure and clean one bedroom apartment on the 4th floor has fantastic city views and is only a short stroll to Central Station, Crown street cafes, bars and restaurants, Oxford street, Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the City. It's the perfect base to explore Sydney from, with everything you'll need for a great stay. And facing north, it gets great light throughout the year. name: Beautiful 2 Bedroom Apt Min Walk to the City
summary: If you are looking for something nice, spacious, convenient and close to everything, this is the place for you!
space: We have a 2 bedroom apartment, in a very easy and handy location, minutes walk to the city, shops, restaurants and transport.  We are in Chippendale, there is plenty of good cafes, funky restaurants, wine bars and art galleries around,including the world famous White Rabbit Gallery. We are also 10 minutes walk to Redfern or Central train Stations, 20 min walk to the city, close to Broadway Shopping Centre and the new Central Park where you can do your shopping and 20 min walk to the buzzing Newtown, Surry Hills and Darling Harbour with all of their restaurants and pubs . It is very very easy to get to all Sydney's major attractions from here - you are one easy 15 min bus ride or train ride away from the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. We are also minutes drive to Bondi Beach and walking distance to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital (RPA), Sydney University (USYD), University of Technology Sydney (UTS) and Carriageworks, From the airport it is only a 20 minute drive, or a short train rid
description: If you are looking for something nice, spacious, convenient and close to everything, this is the place for you! We have a 2 bedroom apartment, in a very easy and handy location, minutes walk to the city, shops, restaurants and transport.  We are in Chippendale, there is plenty of good cafes, funky restaurants, wine bars and art galleries around,including the world famous White Rabbit Gallery. We are also 10 minutes walk to Redfern or Central train Stations, 20 min walk to the city, close to Broadway Shopping Centre and the new Central Park where you can do your shopping and 20 min walk to the buzzing Newtown, Surry Hills and Darling Harbour with all of their restaurants and pubs . It is very very easy to get to all Sydney's major attractions from here - you are one easy 15 min bus ride or train ride away from the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge. We are also minutes drive to Bondi Beach and walking distance to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital (RPA), Sydney University (USYD), University o
neighborhood_overview: Chippendale is a small suburb in Sydney,  and it is quickly becoming one of the coolest, most underground, creative and funky suburbs in Sydney with all it's cafes, art galleries, restaurants, bars, parks and it's big sustainable community, which keeps verge gardens full of fruit, vegetables and herbs for all to share!
notes: To get to our apartment from the Airport the 2 easiest options are: Train - about AU$18 per person. It comes every 5 to 10 minutes and it takes about 10-15 minutes into Redfern or Central, then you have to walk for about 10 minutes to the apartment. Taxi - the easiest option and most cost effective if there is more than 1 of you. It cost between $25-$45 and it takes about 20 minutes (allow a little more time to get into and from the International Airport).
transit: My favourite way to get around is by bike, or simply by foot (note it is a 20-55 minute walk into the city depending on where you are going). We have 2 train stations walking distance from the apartment, Central Station (+or- 12 min walk) or Redfern Station (+or- 8 min walk), we also have buses all around us.
access: Entire apartment.
interaction: I will be there to welcome you in and answer any questions you might have, then I will be just a phone call away! Guests will check themselves out and leave keys on the table.
house_rules: Check in time is after 2pm and Check out time is by 10am. Having fun is mandatory in our place, but our home is also a sacred place to us, where you get to relax and just be, hope it will the same to you on your stay, but please keep these in mind: - strictly no smoking anywhere in the apartment, including the balcony. Your security bond will be forfeit in total if evidence of smoking is found; - no pets, - keep it clean and tidy and give it back how you found it otherwise an extra $50 cleaning fee will apply; - no more than 4 people staying in the apartment; - no parties; - noise restrictions apply in Sydney. The time for these restrictions in residential premises where it can be heard in the living area of a neighbouring property is: 10pm to 8am –  Sunday to Thursday. 12 midnight to 8am –  Friday, Saturday and any day immediately before a public holiday.
host_about:
Me and my husband love to travel and we go away a lot. We started by using Airbnb to rent our place out when we were away, and became really passionate about hosting and sharing our home. 
I love to learn about people's stories and journeys whilst sharing my neighbourhood and its wonders.
I aim to give guests the experience I like having when I am travelling, the opportunity to live like a local in a unique, clean, convenient and homely place.
We care a lot about sustainability and the environment. We love travelling, getting to know new cultures and people, we love hiking, surfing, yoga, skiing, snorkelling, the movies, a good book and good food and wines.
I try to make each day count. 
I choose to be happy. 
I believe we must be the change we want to see in the world.
I believe no one is better than anyone and therefore we must take care of one another.

name: Experience Sydney from Our Huge, Stylish Apartment
summary: Enter a wonderful home with open living area accented by art. Spread out on the chaise-longue, cook in your own kitchen, sink into the soft bed after seeing Sydney. (Please check parking availability if driving here: it’s shared with our other home.)
space: The space In the past four years, we have welcomed people from every continent (except Antarctica!) We have hosted Muslims, Jews, Hindus, Christians, Buddhists, atheists and probably other faiths. All have been welcomed, and everyone always will be here. Very GLBTI-friendly. Very straight friendly too! During these times when the world is on edge, travel is a wonderful way for people to connect. •	Secure undercover parking is available - shared between our other apartments. If you want to park, please inquire about availability before booking. •	This is a huge, stylish apartment on a quiet street, just four blocks to Downtown! This is the size and quality of a suite in a high quality hotel for the price of an average room out of the city.  •	While there is almost no traffic noise, there is a subway one block away. While we are light sleepers, it rarely disturbs us. Many guests comment on how peaceful the apartment is, but as Airbnb works on the basis of honesty we like to point this ou
description: Enter a wonderful home with open living area accented by art. Spread out on the chaise-longue, cook in your own kitchen, sink into the soft bed after seeing Sydney. (Please check parking availability if driving here: it’s shared with our other home.)
neighborhood_overview: With Redfern Station just 5 minutes away, it's easy to travel throughout Sydney and enjoy the city's incredible attractions. Explore the shops and high-end restaurants in the CBD, walk through Prince Alfred Park, and head to the iconic Sydney Harbor.
transit: Central Station is 800 meters away (845 yards) so all train lines - including the Airport Line  are walking distance. The train trip is about 11 minutes, and the walk across Prince Alfred Park is another 10. Redfern Station is 400 meters (430 yards) away. About 1km (.6 of a mile) to Sydney University or the University of Technology, Sydney.
access: Living Room:   LCD TV & DVD/BluRay with good selection of quality movies     Hi speed wireless Wifi for guests    Cambridge Audio stereo with a collection of mainly classical CDs     Tastefully & comfortably furnished    Large chaise longue style sofa for comfortable viewing    Excellent quality Italian-made wallbed folds down from the office, just off the living room. Every bit as comfortable as the main bed. Kitchen:    Dishwasher    Fridge/Freezer    Microwave    Oven/grill    Expresso machine    Quality utensils, cutlery, pots, pans, Royal Doulton crockery etc. Bedroom:    Hotel quality Queen size bed with deep, comfortable latex mattress    Linen, pillows and towels included     Large built-in wardrobe with drawers available for my guests Bathroom:    Oversized shower    Towels included    Hair dryer Laundry:    Washing Machine and Dryer    Clothes rack    Iron and ironing board
interaction: The apartment is offered in its entirety. You have the whole place to yourselves! Keys are left in a secure safe for guests who arrive at different times in case my cleaner and I are not around. I try and meet all of my guests at some stage of their stay, as I feel that is is an important aspect of being a host. As well as providing an apartment, I want to welcome you to my city.
house_rules: This is a lovely, friendly building. All I ask is that you respect my home, and my neighbours with some simple guidelines:   This is a smoke-free building. Please don't smoke  in the apartment, or in the hallway or stairwell - smoke will blow up into neighbours' windows. If you are a smoker, please go outside, and well away from the front door and the door of the neighbouring houses. Respect the space and the things in it.  Please don't use illegal drugs in the house.  Please don't invite visitors (strangers) into the apartment to stay over. No guests except those registered in advance. Friends who wish to join you for dinner or a drink are cool, but remember that they are your responsibility while you are here, so please, no parties. Please be courteous and kind. Hosting requires a good relationship with my neighbours. Please talk quietly in the hallways and use inside voices in the apartment. When moving in and out, please be aware of the noise of bags on wheels on hard surface.  The
host_about:
I (Paul) am a psychotherapist which  is fascinating in terms of the wonderful clients and staff with whom I work.  I spent 12 years as a university lecturer and another 10 doing research on sexuality and gender, having come to academia late after running a manufacturing business, driving trams in Melbourne (a job a STILL have great dreams about!) and a wasted year in a clothing factory after high school. 

Raymond works as an analyst in government and corporate media, a field he has been involved in since graduation. After his honours year, he spent the best part of the next year backpacking around the world. Every continent covered.... except Antarctica. So that's on our mutual Wishlist!

Meeting guests - especially those visiting Australia - is like having a little holiday without leaving Sydney as we get to hear what their home countries are like. We manage to meet over 80% of our guests to welcome them to town! And this is the best part of being hosts with Airbnb. We have also been really lucky to meet a lot of other local hosts, managers from the San Francisco head office, and the wonderful, warm and friendly staff at the Sydney office. Paul was also asked to speak on the SuperHost panel at the inaugural Airbnb Open in November of 2014 and we both attended the Paris Open in 2015. It was really thrilling to be included with such passionate, professional hosts talking to a huge room full of excited people. 

We have traveled extensively including staying in hotels, hotels, on the beach, and latterly in Airbnb homes. So we really know what makes for a good stay. It's both a pleasure and an honour to have folks stay at here, especially international guests who are traveling around this lovely country.

We have three great apartments, close to the centre of Sydney, available as the entire place for up to four guests. We do not stay when guests are staying - you have the whole apartment to yourselves.

Redfern is an original area of Sydney, featuring some of the oldest homes dating back to the 18th and 19th centuries. Prince Alfred Park is nearby, and the city itself is on the other side of that. You can literally walk to town in under 10 minutes, and it is well supported with public transport to all parts of the city only a four blocks from the front door.

name: PRIME LOCATION, HYDE PARK & CBD, transport close
summary: Typical small 2 story terrace house. One block from Hyde Park & short walk to Town Hall & central CBD. 10m train Airport -> Museum. Great local cafes, pubs, restaurants, wine bars, supermarkets, gyms, parks & pools. Single Guest only to share common space & outdoor bathroom with live in Host. Let's not pretend this is a hotel, rather seeking considerate guests to enjoy this cosy & well located home in safe, quiet area. No profit, simply covering costs to live in expensive part of Sydney
space: SHARED SPACE for Host and Guest • Fully furnished traditional Terrace House • 2 levels (stairs), snug but comfortable  • White tiles on the bottom level keep the place cool in summer and contains the heat in winter surprisingly. Beautiful wooden floors in bedrooms upstairs  • Eclectic mix of fresh white, vintage and retro furniture  • Front room features Apple TV and Wifi  • Back door leads into a delightfully old fashioned outdoor bathroom, patio & lush garden, all well covered; plus small clothes line for fresh clothes hanging  • Shoes off and left at front door please GUEST ROOM • Comfortable single bedroom that includes vintage wooden bed frame, mattress + protector, Sheridan bed linen, side table and pouf, table lamp, clothes rack, hanging drawers, window blinds, tower fan, grocery shopping bag,  umbrella, bathrobe • Key to lock bedroom door for privacy • Wifi but reception is better downstairs • Bedroom size, 2.15m length x 2 metres width, one person only!  BATHROOM / LAUNDRY • S
description: Typical small 2 story terrace house. One block from Hyde Park & short walk to Town Hall & central CBD. 10m train Airport -> Museum. Great local cafes, pubs, restaurants, wine bars, supermarkets, gyms, parks & pools. Single Guest only to share common space & outdoor bathroom with live in Host. Let's not pretend this is a hotel, rather seeking considerate guests to enjoy this cosy & well located home in safe, quiet area. No profit, simply covering costs to live in expensive part of Sydney SHARED SPACE for Host and Guest • Fully furnished traditional Terrace House • 2 levels (stairs), snug but comfortable  • White tiles on the bottom level keep the place cool in summer and contains the heat in winter surprisingly. Beautiful wooden floors in bedrooms upstairs  • Eclectic mix of fresh white, vintage and retro furniture  • Front room features Apple TV and Wifi  • Back door leads into a delightfully old fashioned outdoor bathroom, patio & lush garden, all well covered; plus small clothes line
neighborhood_overview: Amazingly friendly and safe given the location and good natured neighbours!   My place is surprisingly quiet given its close proximity to Stanley Street. The location of the guest room is at the back so guests don't get impacted by street  traffic in the evening.
notes: LOCAL ATTRACTIONS • Art Gallery of NSW, Taronga Zoo, Manly, Bondi Beach, the Botanical Gardens and the Domain, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Darling Harbour, Watson's Bay EXERCISE • Swimming or Gym: Cook & Phillip Pool, City Gym and Boy Charlton Pool  • Plenty of yoga places around the corner Stanley Street RESTAURANTS & CAFES • Philosophy on Stanley Street (great coffee and breakfast / lunch) • Bar Reggio for pizza, Reggio Lounge on Stanley Street (well priced Italian / pasta for lunch and dinner) • Sushi on Stanley!! BARS & PUBS • Love Tilly Devine (wine bar) • The Commons (wine bar) • East Village, East Sydney Hotel and Lord Roberts (local pubs) SUPERMARKETS • Woolworth's supermarket is the closest on Crown street Woolloomooloo. IGA on Oxford street (pricey). For fresher produce, try Paddy's Markets in China town and Harris Farm markets in Potts Point only a brisk 10-15 min walk
transit: Transport:  - Public train from Airport to Museum train station. Quickest, best and cheapest - only 10 mins by train (lift access available at both ends ) then 5 min walk up the road to my house - Please don’t take bus or hotel bus drop offs for late checkins as they are unreliable, more expensive and take more time - Free WiFi at Sydney Airport - please message when you are on the train and leaving airport - MESSAGE if any delays please - Opal card is essential to travel on Sydney train, bus and ferry - collect from airport train station or convenience store
access: Kitchen - Simple cooking is fine as it is a small kitchen and facilities (remember no microwave) - Dining out locally on Stanley Street is very reasonably priced option or order delivery online - Cupboard space available to you (middle cupboard above the sink area). Includes glassware, cutlery for your use; fridge space also - Nearest supermarkets: Woolworths (Metro), 75 Crown Street, East Sydney,  or IAG: 23 Oxford St, Darlinghurst Bag storage - Sorry but I am unable to offer bag storage before or after your stay; if you arrive earlier than check in, you can catch a refreshment or meal on Stanley street around the corner - Otherwise g00gle “bag storage Central station” Bathroom is shared with host:  - Includes shared shampoo, conditioner, body wash and own bathroom cupboard space available - Please use shower pressure gently as the water does overflow at full strength. Every house has its quirks;) Bath mat found on the shower door and on the clothes line. Please use small mat to take
interaction: Friendly but slightly introverted Host who doesn’t mind a bit of a chat but also appreciates an independent guest who is keen to get out and explore Sydney and has low expectation of engagement.  Guest and Host don’t eat meals together. Guests need to research Sydney for local attractions. Everything available on G00gle by searching for “what’s on Sydney” Happy to offer local recommendations of course..  My house and location is geared for Guests who take advantage of this beautiful city and discover the magic of this city for themselves. Be adventurous!!
house_rules: UNIVERSAL TRUST Whilst we appreciate this service, we also put our homes at risk. Please adhere to the guidelines so the lovely space can be enjoyed by all. Please don't be the second person to abuse the trust of taking a memento or being a difficult personality! Unfortunately I do also need to mention that this is a home, not a hotel, and I am not the maid :) CHECKING IN Please confirm as soon as possible your arrival time. I value my time as much as yours and am happy to be flexible where possible. DOs & DONT's (sorry, but...) • Host will do majority of house cleaning, however please kindly clean up after yourself   •  Host will do weekend bed and towel linen wash when requested for longer stays. Please leave linen in room when checking out • Please look after the bed and towel linen as they are good quality. No food or drinks in bedroom and on sheets. Water is ok. Make use of plenty of space downstairs for eating etc. Any damages will be paid for by you. Girls, BYO makeup remover fa
host_about:
Hello and welcome! As an Airbnb host for nearly 8 years and a local Darlinghurst resident for nearly 20 years, I am pleased to offer very well priced prime location accommodation in Sydney’s inner city. 

My place is cosy, comfortable and convenient. And the company ain’t so bad either ;). I don’t make a profit, in fact I keep the price reasonable so it offers regular occupancy but covers expensive living costs in Sydney. 70% of your tariff is based on location.

I am a warm and friendly live in Host who works long hours often into the evenings as  a self employed Consultant, so please don’t think I’m being anti social if I’m not up for a lot of social interaction or eating dinner together etc. thanks for understanding ;).

The ideal guest will enjoy getting out of this small but fit for purpose terrace house and explore beautiful Sydney which is pretty much on our doorstep. 

This accommodation is for a single guest only so no couples and no pets, sharing many of the facilities and shared space including the outdoor, sheltered bathroom. 

This typical terrace house is small and space is limited so simple cooking is fine but facilities are limited. So many guests enjoy the many dining options across the road  especially for their short stay.

Stanley St provides well priced Italian, Japanese, Thai, pub food and cafes plus great coffee especially for short stays.

During reservation booking, please tell me a bit about yourself and  the purpose of visit. Also do advise if you are a non English speaker to help with effective communication and please use the translation function on this platform.

If there is anything that you don’t feel matches up with the profile, please do let me know so I can rectify this before we go to the review time.

Thanks in advance and looking forward to welcoming you into my home.

Jac

name: Fabulous Bondi Beach - Australia.
space: Welcome to Dover Heights, one of Sydney's exclusive Eastern Suburbs and thank you for checking this listing!  The apartment: We offer a double room with the luxury of having your own bathroom in our groundfloor apartment. Breakfast is included (self service) and feel free to make use of the kitchen facilities. It is a very quiet complex with no traffic noise. There is plenty of parking available.  In addition the apartment offers:  - Internet / WiFi  - Cable TV available.  The complex has: - Indoor heated pool - Gym - Sauna and steam room.  The area:  It is only a 10 minutes walk from the world famous Bondi Beach. The area had amazing walks along the cliffs. Enjoy the beautiful views and good chances you can spot the whales passing by during the season.  Public Transport: There is excellent public transport on our doorstep. The bus lines have good services in the area. A trip to Bondi junction is only 15 minutes and here you will be connected to Sydney's CityRail network.  We are looki

house_rules: Breakfast not included. Tea/coffee etc provided and free use of kitchen facilities.

name: Master Bedroom w Ensuite &Balcony
summary: Master Bedroom w Ensuite &Balcony Unlimited Wifi, close to buses to Bondi beach and bus to the CBD, Opera house etc  Ensuite has bath, shower, Towels and linen provided.  Living with my 3 x lovely house mates in their 30's, all young professionals
space: Appartment in a great location! Just off Oxford Street  Large Four Bed room house with my three  Fantastic transport:  From the airport:  Train - 29 minutes by train to Edgecliff Station or  20 minutes in a taxi Nestled in the heart of the city this is one of the most charming parts of Sydney. Paddington has a host of great pubs, winebars and restaurants as well as the best boutique shopping in the city. Gorgeous Queen Street Woolahra, Rushcutters Bay, Bondi Junction, Double Bay and Town Hall are all also within easy walking distance ...but theres a bus stop across the road form my apt!! And taxis non-stop.  Shops and grocery store one minute away.  Lots to do in Paddington that some weekends i find i dont even leave my own suburb :)  The apartment:  i have been buying new furniture and decorating it in all my spare time. Lots of windows in the kitchen and a nice view of the leafy out look and blue sydney sky.  Newly refurnbished kitchen and bathroom with shower and bath. Bathroom has

name: Quiet and Private Guest Suite a Short Drive to Manly Beach
summary: Enjoy the quiet atmosphere and swim pool, BBQ on the deck or head out for an invigorating walk around a friendly neighbourhood. This light and airy studio overlooks a sparkling pool, features a shared backyard and is just 10 minutes from Manly Beach.
space: Fully self-contained, quiet, clean, peaceful with a great yard, pool and district ocean views to Manly. Your room is attached to the main house however very private. You have your own access to come and go as you please. On street parking in a quiet street. All you should need. -TV -Wireless Internet -Luxury Swimming Pool -Kitchen (with fridge & microwave) -Own Bathroom -Washing Machine -Queen Sized Bed -Linen & towels Included -Free on street parking
description: Enjoy the quiet atmosphere and swim pool, BBQ on the deck or head out for an invigorating walk around a friendly neighbourhood. This light and airy studio overlooks a sparkling pool, features a shared backyard and is just 10 minutes from Manly Beach.
neighborhood_overview: The studio is behind the main house in a quiet street, near good cafes, a butcher, a bakery, IGA, a bottle shop, and the Westfield Shopping Centre. There are nearby bush walks and the beautiful Manly Dam.
notes: Due to the current regulations on pool fencing, unfortunately we are unable to accommodate children as the pool is directly accessible from the accommodation. Our studio is designed to accommodate 2 people. Smoking is allowed outside. Wet towels need to be hung in the bathroom or on the clothes line and not over the back of the dining chairs. Please leave used towels in bath upon leaving. Wilson our lovely Cavoodle (dog) shares the back yard and loves company and to play ball. Please make sure the side gate is secured to make sure Wilson (our dog) does not get out. We wish you the best holiday and hope you enjoy the relaxing atmosphere at our studio apartment. :)
transit: Public transport to Manly and the City is only a 5 minute walk to the bus stop on Allambie Road. Uber or Taxis are great also for short distances if you do not have a car. There is also a local car hire company who would be happy to drop off a car for your arrival. **If you would like to be picked up or dropped off to and from the airport, I am happy to offer this service at a fee.** Please contact me directly for details once you have made your booking.
access: You have your own keys for access to your room. Utilise the pool and entertainment area. Feel free to wander the yard and very safe neighbourhood. *Wireless Internet *Swimming Pool  (pool towels provided) *Timber deck and BBQ area *Pick up/drop off from Sydney Airport (please contact me for details a fee applies)
interaction: As locals living in the attached house we are readily available to answer any questions and make recommendations as to local attractions and dining etc. Or leave you alone to enjoy our lovely place. If we are not home, we are only a phone call away.
house_rules: Smoking is allowed outside. Wet towels need to be hung in the bathroom or on the clothes line and not over the back of the dining chairs. Please leave used towels in bath upon leaving. Side gate needs to be secured to make sure Wilson (our dog) does not get out. We wish you the best for your holiday and hope you enjoy the relaxing atmosphere at our studio apartment. :)
host_location: Allambie Heights, New South Wales, Australia
host_about: Hi my name is Amanda and my husband Darren and I are excited to be your hosts! Check out our listing and please don't hesitate to contact Darren or myself about any bookings and enquiries.

name: Modern Cottage House in the West
space: 2 storey modern cottage house with 5 bedrooms, 3 full bathroom, 3 family/entertainment area.  It is a walking distance to the bus station and 5 mins drive to the train station.  My place is located in a very quiet and safe place surrounded by beautiful homes and huge nursing home. Public transport is very accessible. Point of interest close to my place are: 1. Sydney Wet'n'Wild (10 mins drive) biggest water park in the        world. 2. Blue Mountains (1hr 10mins drive) 3. Sydney CBD (40 mins drive)  4. Parramatta CBD (20 mins drive) 5. Sydney Olympic Park (25 mins drive) I offer the following services:  light breakfast, internet and for a fee of $10 for laundry. Experience fresh mountain air as you rise above Sydney and enter the spectacular Blue Mountains region. The Blue Mountains is perfect for exploring the best that NSW has to offer. The Three Sisters at Echo Point, bushwalking, galleries, dining, shopping, day spas, golf, and numerous attractions. The Blue Mountains is the ideal

name: Bondi Beach -  Beachfront Stunner
summary: Stunning beachfront residence.
space: Welcome to this Beachfront Stunner and thank you for checking this listing!  This unit is a newly renovated two bedroom unit located in the heart of Bondi Beach and on the Campbell Parade dress circle. It features one queen and one double bed with two single beds on request for an additional fee.  With a designer kitchen, large bathroom with a jacuzzi bath you can't go wrong with this stunning unit. Situated at the quieter rear of the building, this unit also features access to a rear shared courtyard. With all the modcons you need - this place is the perfect holiday rental complete with quality linens and a fully equipped kitchen you cant go wrong - this will go fast! With Campbell Parade as location, truly everything you need is within walking distance! The city and CBD is reached within no-time with the 333 express bus line. The bus stop is right across the street.   A truly fabulous hotel alternative for half the price of a room in the hotel across the street. Please note our rates

name: Stylish/ Central Sydney Apartment
summary: Stylish one bedroom furnished apartment conveniently located in Paddington between shopping district, city, and Bondi Beach and near the iconic Centennial Park The apartment is in a building which is surrounded by tropical garden. Close to shops, park and transport (15 minute bus to City, 5 minute bus to Bondi Junction, 20 mins to Bondi Beach).
space: Stylish one bedroom furnished apartment in Paddington/ Centennial Park with access to gorgeous tropical garden available  over June / July. Apartment is fully private in what was originally a large house. High ceilings, quiet and light filled. Fully furnished with wifi, stereo and TV. Sofa bed, inflatable sofa Great place to base yourself while visiting Sydney. Perfectly 2 minutes walk to fashionable Oxford Street Paddington shops  and Centennial Park and between city and Bondi Beach. Lots of public transport options.  Feel free to ask any questions. There are many amenities including supermarket, restaurants, pubs, night clubs within walking distance. Attractions within 20 minutes bus ride  Circular Quay (Opera House, the Rocks) in 20 minute bus ride, or 20 minutes to Bondi beach. Bike available on request. The apartment has a double bed, clean sheets, quilt with fresh quilt cover, two pillows, freshly cleaned pillow covers, a wardrobe with coat hangers and a desk,  a DVD player and T

neighborhood_overview: Great neighbourhood. Close to the action but very quiet and peaceful. Paddington/ Centennial Park/ Woollahra are some of Sydney's loveliest suburbs.
transit: 2 minutes walk to Centennial Park. Oxford St and Queen Street shops and restaurants.  Buses every few minutes along Oxford st to City, Bondi Junction, Newtown and beaches.
interaction: There'll always be someone to help you if you have any questions.
house_rules: No loud music/ noise.
host_about: I am a professional man happily living in Sydney after having lived overseas in Tokyo, London and New York for 12 years. I rent my apartment out when I'm out of town.

name: Sydney Opera House-20min walk
summary: The perfect base for seeing the sights in Sydney
space: Welcome to Sydney! Large 1 bedroom apartment, centrally located only 50m from the sparkling waters of Sydney Harbour. Please check out my other listing in the same building. This apartment has lovely views and is perfect for 2-3 guests. https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/9615999?guests=3&s=yjfCHYlw Your new base in Sydney's Woolloomooloo, home to actors and celebrities, is the backdrop to this well located apartment and moments from the stunning landscaped Botanical Gardens - 30 hectares/75 Acres of gorgeous gardens nestled behind the iconic Opera House. This apartment suite is the perfect base for the busy traveller. You will sleep well in a king size bed and the kitchen is fully equipped for self catering. If you are coming with friend or bringing the family, then there is a king single bed plus king single trundle bed sharing the living space. This is an open plan apartment but you will be in a seperate room unlike most hotel suites. Indulge yourself to a meal at Woolloomooloo's intern
description: The perfect base for seeing the sights in Sydney Welcome to Sydney! Large 1 bedroom apartment, centrally located only 50m from the sparkling waters of Sydney Harbour. Please check out my other listing in the same building. This apartment has lovely views and is perfect for 2-3 guests. https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/9615999?guests=3&s=yjfCHYlw Your new base in Sydney's Woolloomooloo, home to actors and celebrities, is the backdrop to this well located apartment and moments from the stunning landscaped Botanical Gardens - 30 hectares/75 Acres of gorgeous gardens nestled behind the iconic Opera House. This apartment suite is the perfect base for the busy traveller. You will sleep well in a king size bed and the kitchen is fully equipped for self catering. If you are coming with friend or bringing the family, then there is a king single bed plus king single trundle bed sharing the living space. This is an open plan apartment but you will be in a seperate room unlike most hotel suites. Ind
neighborhood_overview: Woolloomooloo is a s close to the CBD as you can get without being right in the midst of high rises.  You will be within walking distance to some of the best attractions Sydney has to offer. The walk through The Botanical Gardens, Domain or Hyde Park is a great way to start your day. Mrs Macquarie's Chair is a 15 minute walk away and offers one of the best vantage points of Sydney Harbour. This is the iconic Sydney view!
notes: Free Wi-fi
transit: The bus stop is a 2 minute walk from the apartment. Here you can catch the 311 into the city or in the opposite direction to Central. The red Hop on/Hop off bus also stops here. This is a great way to cover a lot of the attractions in Sydney.
access: The washing machines and dryers are located in a shared laundry on the same floor. Theses are commercial size machines so take big loads. You will need 2 x $2.  You will find a clothes horse for air drying clothes behind the drapes in the bedroom.
house_rules: I will do everything I can to make your stay as easy and comfortable as possible.  I am happy to give advice on your new surrounds and about Sydney in general. If you have any questions please ask and I will do my best to give or find you the answer. There are a few rules so we all know what to expect. Please let me know if you think your arrival will be delayed. I like to meet all guests on arrival to pass on the keys and give advice on the area (if you want it). Usually I cannot wait for extended periods and don't want to leave you out on the street until I can come back.  I try to accommodate all check-in and check-out times but sometimes this is not possible. If you are arriving late please be aware that check-in after 8pm incurs a fee of $25 and after 10pm the fee is $40. Please let me know when you book if you need a late check-in so I can confirm that this is available. Please leave our apartment the way you found it. No need to scrub any floors or clean the bathroom. All I ask
host_about:
Hi everyone! 
I love to travel and always enjoy meeting new people. I especially enjoy being a small part of the adventures and travels of others. 
I look forward to welcoming you to Woolloomooloo and introducing you to our beautiful City of Sydney.

name: Private garden studio with bathroom
summary: A private studio-style room with its own bathroom in our backyard. You have a separate entrance and there is plenty of parking. Public transport is close-by. We leave you to your own devices but are very happy to give you all the advice you need.
space: We've built a new guest room with its own bathroom in our backyard. It's private, quiet and has leafy views across to the Japanese maple. Our house is home for our family of four, but you have your own separate space.  We live in a suburban area near the bush but are close to both the city, Chatswood and the business centre of North Ryde. Depending which direction you are heading we are 5 - 15 minute walk from buses to the city, Chatswood and North Ryde. We travel by either train or bus to the city, depending on exactly where we are going. The bus is a 15-20 minute ride into the city. When travelling by train we usually go from Chatswood station.There is plenty of parking in our street and we do have wi-fi. We're happy to give all the advice you need and share the backyard BBQ. There is a Thai takeaway close-by but guests without a car often do the 20 min walk to Lane Cove, where there is a big choice of restaurants. During the day there is a very good cafe open at the end of our stree
description: A private studio-style room with its own bathroom in our backyard. You have a separate entrance and there is plenty of parking. Public transport is close-by. We leave you to your own devices but are very happy to give you all the advice you need. We've built a new guest room with its own bathroom in our backyard. It's private, quiet and has leafy views across to the Japanese maple. Our house is home for our family of four, but you have your own separate space.  We live in a suburban area near the bush but are close to both the city, Chatswood and the business centre of North Ryde. Depending which direction you are heading we are 5 - 15 minute walk from buses to the city, Chatswood and North Ryde. We travel by either train or bus to the city, depending on exactly where we are going. The bus is a 15-20 minute ride into the city. When travelling by train we usually go from Chatswood station.There is plenty of parking in our street and we do have wi-fi. We're happy to give all the advice y
neighborhood_overview: I love the feeling of space, the trees and access to the bush; all within short distance from the city. The bus from half a block away takes just 16 minutes to get to the city, so you are very connected to a lot of the best things Sydney has to offer - including the harbour! Our place is also quiet, something I really appreciate.
notes: We sometimes have a few things in the fridge as we are very social and love cooking dinner. Before accessing anything in the fridge food wise, can you please double check with myself or one of my sons prior to consuming the food.
transit: You will find it easy to park in our street but if you are you are travelling to the city, we recommend using public transport. The city bus stop is 2 minutes walk away, and the bus takes 16 minutes to get to the city.
access: There is no kitchen but you do have direct access to a fridge, microwave, kettle and toaster.
interaction: We tend to leave guests to their own devices - they have a separate entrance and can come and go as they like. We are very happy to help and provide advice as required.
house_rules: We'd prefer if you checked in after 2pm and out before 10am. If you need different times please chat with us and we'll see if we can work something out.
host_location: Lane Cove North, New South Wales, Australia
host_about: David and I are based at home and will most likely be around to greet you. Our two sons are in their early twenties and live here too.

name: Waterfront Collective: Turtle Run .
summary: Summer ! January deals : From $250/night ask for a quote. (Price varies on requirements).  Holiday Cottage on the water Yep.. on the water. Not across the road  or 2 blocks away. True. Not suitable for young children.  (Minimum 2 night booking)
space: Fancy a fabulous waterfront,'50's built, cottage for a holiday with absolute privacy and access by boat only? Or maybe a private weekend with your work mates brainstorming? Then Turtle Run is the retreat for you. This is a sanctuary that truly embraces the layback lifestyle of the northern beaches of Sydney. This waterfront 3 bedroom, 2 level cottage is nestled in the hillside forest at the edge of the Ku-ring-gai Chase National Park overlooking Pittwater Harbour at Church Point, McCarr’s Creek in northern Sydney. Yet incredibly, it is situated only 40 minutes from Sydney’s CBD and 15 minutes from the best beaches in the world. The area has survived the onslaught of development with many surrounding home owners retaining the original 1950’s holiday shack charm. Turtle Run is no exception. name: *FULLY FURNISHED ROOM*
summary: Fully furnished modern 3 bedroom plus landing/study townhouse on 3 levels in a quiet surrounding, offers a great privacy for house mates.
space: The house is well equipped with Built-in and mirrored robes to all bedrooms, open plan gas kitchen, internal laundry with 3rd toilets and 2 bathrooms, tiled lounge/dining area, entertaining courtyard, alarm system and close to all amenities sharing with two friendly and fun professionals. In terms of mobility we are also lucky with our location. Being close to James Ruse Drive and Great Western High way (M4) makes the transport easy to all directions. (We are literally in the center of Sydney with quick access to highways that links east and west as well as North and south bounds. The famous Rose Hill Race Course is the largest entertainment center around the area. They have various shows throughout the year in which the trendy and classic horse racing can be named as the featured ones. We are preferably looking for travelers who care about their staying place to be clean and would enjoys a quiet and peaceful environment, prepared to follow the house rules. (Must be a non-smoker! Age a
description: Fully furnished modern 3 bedroom plus landing/study townhouse on 3 levels in a quiet surrounding, offers a great privacy for house mates. The house is well equipped with Built-in and mirrored robes to all bedrooms, open plan gas kitchen, internal laundry with 3rd toilets and 2 bathrooms, tiled lounge/dining area, entertaining courtyard, alarm system and close to all amenities sharing with two friendly and fun professionals. In terms of mobility we are also lucky with our location. Being close to James Ruse Drive and Great Western High way (M4) makes the transport easy to all directions. (We are literally in the center of Sydney with quick access to highways that links east and west as well as North and south bounds. The famous Rose Hill Race Course is the largest entertainment center around the area. They have various shows throughout the year in which the trendy and classic horse racing can be named as the featured ones. We are preferably looking for travelers who care about their sta
neighborhood_overview: We have an absolutely nice and quiet neighborhood and we are grateful for that.  There is a primary school in Virginia St across the road not far from our house and so parents are expected to hang around during the drop off and pick up times (8:00AM and 2:00PM). Also we are blessed to have Rosehill racecourse right near us. During the events you will get to see a good mix of colour, style and fashion around the area which it tempts you to think, you may as well dress to impress and join the event!
transit: 1. Rosehill train station is right across the road  2. but for more regular trains and express links Parramatta train station is the best option which is25 minutes walk from our place.  3. To get to Parramatta station, Carlingford and Lower North Suburbs, buses are good option. They run quite regular and there are two major stops nearby (Good Street and James Ruse Drive)   4. Rydges Hotel is only 3 minutes walk and there are always taxi's available
access: * Room A (Including balcony)  * Level 1 Bathroom * Level 1 Study area * The entire Ground Floor which includes: The lounge area, Dinning area, Pool table area, Laundry, Kitchen (Specified cabinets and sections for guests)  * Backyard
interaction: Ground Floor and the study area in L1 are the common areas in the house.  Usually weekends are the best chances to interact more with our guests in the mentioned areas above. Some weekends we may not be at home.  Though in saying that I will be always accessible via phone and email in case of an emergency or to meet our guest/s immediate needs as much as possible.
house_rules: House Rules Welcome to your home! The aim for the following house rules is to ensure that all the residents are sharing a happy and healthy life together in a healthy and friendly environment. Hence it is vital to read all the rules carefully and comply with them. Please do ask, if you have any questions regarding the provided information. 1.  Bedroom  •Do not wear shoes in bedroom carpet and all carpet areas. •Keep your bedroom clean and tidy. The vacuum cleaner is available to use and must be cleaned after each use. •No food or drink in the bedroom.  •If you do spill something on the carpet, please tell the landlord immediately.  •If there are any serious stains you will need to pay for it to be cleaned. •Please be considerate with energy consumptions and turn off the lights when you are not in the room or while you are sleeping.  •Add/removal or changes towards fitting and fixtures are forbidden unless approved by landlord.  •Do not use the balcony to dry your clothes 2. Bathroom  •
host_about: I am looking forward to welcome you in my beautiful Sydney home in the near future!

name: Sunny Private Unit near Manly Beach
summary: Our sunny, completely private unit within our home offers a bedroom, spacious living room with second double bed, bathroom, laundry and kitchette.Enjoy the sea breezes as you sit on your own private balcony. The outdoor BBQ is for your exclusive use.
space: Close to Manly beach, 5 minutes drive, self contained unit  contained within our home.  Shops/restaurants close by. Quiet street, plenty of free on street parking. Own private balcony with sea breezes. Kitchenette, washing machine and own private bathroom available. Wireless internet also available. The accommodation offers a large sunny bedroom with built in wardrobe. A spacious living room, with a sofa bed and a well equipped kitchenette. There's plenty of room for lounging, basking in the light that floods through  all the north facing rooms. In the living area a flat screen TV is available for your use.The bathroom is clean and contemporary with a shower. The large balcony has its own BBQ for your convenience, as well as an outdoor furniture setting for your exclusive use.  *Wireless internet included   *On street free parking available Self contained unit within our home. neighborhood_overview: Quiet, tree lined street, in lovely neighbourhood, where the birds are plentiful and the sea breeze is wonderful. On street parking is available and the neighbour hood is very safe. Aboriginal carvings can be seen in the park at the end of the street, a 5 minute walk away. Several local restaurants are within easy walking distance, as is a supermarket, baker, butcher and news agency.
notes: Local shops about 700 metres up the hill, where you find a supermarket, news agency, several local restaurants and great coffee.
transit: 20 metres to the nearest bus stop, which will transport you to the local Warringah shopping mall, or Manly and directly to the city.
access: Self contained unit with own fridge, freezer, washing machine and shared clothes line or your own drying rack. Lots of storage for clothes. Sheets, pillowcases and towels supplied.
interaction: Completely private unit, you may see Marc and I working in the garden. The amount of interaction wanted is completely up to you.
house_rules: No smoking inside the unit  No pets  Quiet residential area so please respect neighbour's privacy and peace and quiet at night.
host_about: Marc and I enjoy travelling and playing sport. We play tennis together each week and have been involved in a range of sports in the local community. As our children our older now we are finding more time to enjoy these things.Both our girls are not living at home, hence we have plenty of extra space to share.

name: Leafy Studio with Tranquil Pittwater View
summary: Relax on the private terrace surrounded by lush gardens and a tranquil view to Pittwater, drinking a glass of wine at the end of the day. This studio makes excellent use of the space and boasts superior furnishings.
space: Welcome to Sydney's Northern Beaches! ABOUT THE STUDIO: At the front of our residence we have a self-contained Studio [includes bathroom, full kitchen - with all cooking essentials, deck, private separate entrance] which can sleep 2 adults in either a king size bed or twin king single beds. There is secured wifi, subject to service provision, throughout the studio and there is plenty of safe carparking immediately in front of our house.  For the benefit of both ourselves and our neighbours we have a No Smoking policy throughout our property.  The Studio is accessed from a lovely garden; the studio terrace has views out to the distant hills of Ku-ring-gai National Park, with the Pittwater estuary in the foreground. The Studio has a floor area of approximately 33m2; the terrace is approximately 16m2.   ABOUT THE AREA WE LIVE IN: Our house and Studio are situated in a  quiet and attractive street in Bilgola Plateau, a small bushland residential area located on an elevated plateau above th
description: Relax on the private terrace surrounded by lush gardens and a tranquil view to Pittwater, drinking a glass of wine at the end of the day. This studio makes excellent use of the space and boasts superior furnishings.
neighborhood_overview: The studio is on an elevated plateau above the village of Avalon, bordered by Pittwater on one side and the Pacific Ocean on the other. Our property is on a scenic and quiet, local traffic-only street. A five-minute walk will take you to an organic coffee shop, 7-11 store, pizza take away and bottle shop. The village of Avalon Beach is a 2-min drive away, where you'll find interesting shops, cafes, and restaurants. Our favourite - Bilgola Beach is a 4-min drive down the hill from the Studio.
notes: CANCELLATION POLICY Please note that we have a Strict Cancellation Policy.  50% of the tariff will be refunded [but not the Airbnb guest service fee]  if you cancel anytime upto 7  days prior to 2pm on the arrival date.  After that, no refund is available.  Please ensure you carry International/Domestic travel insurance to cover you in the event of cancellation.
transit: Sydney/City to Avalon and Bilgola Plateau: The main bus service [bus number L90]  to the city departs every 30 minutes from Avalon; it can also be joined at a bus stop which is a 7-minute walk downhill from the Studio. Tickets can be bought on the bus provided it is not peak hour [6am - 9am; 3.30pm - 6.30pm].  During these peak hours you will need to purchase a pre-pay bus ticket from any local shop, newsagent or service station.  During the week there is an express bus service from Bilgola Plateau [bus number E89]  in the morning and afternoon to and from the city. The bus stop for this service is a 2 minute walk from the Studio.    Driving time in a car to Sydney CBD is about 1 hour. Depending on the time of day, the bus trip is about 1 1/2 hours. Bilgola Plateau to Avalon Village: if you don't feel like walking up or down the hill to Avalon Village there is also a local bus service [bus number L191] which you can join at the bus stop 2 minutes from the Studio. Local trips to conside
access: Your privacy is ensured - easy and separate access from the street to the front door of the Studio.  The Studio, its terrace and the front garden are available for your use. Our house is at the rear of the Studio, so we're close by if you need anything, but otherwise we'll leave you alone!
interaction: We work from our home office, but are respectful of guests' need for  privacy...or company [and local information] when needed.
house_rules: NON-SMOKING: This is a non-smoking property in all inside and outside areas. QUIET: We promote this property as a 'retreat' intending the Studio, terrace and garden to be enjoyed quietly. Council Conditions of Consent governing the operation of this accommodation require that: 1.  any outside areas, including the terrace, are not to be used after 10pm. 2. the airconditioner is always operated in the quiet mode and may have to be turned off after 10pm subject to the Environmental Protection Act's noise abatement requirement for the operation of airconditioners in residential areas.  EXTERIOR LIGHTS: Please ensure the path lights are turned off and the Sensor lights are turned to "Sensor" or "Off" before you go to bed. SAND: The beaches here are great, but our plumbing does not like their sand! Please use the outside hot & cold shower to rinse off after a swim at the beach.  WILDLIFE!: You may share our garden with some local visitors:  birds, bush turkeys, bandicoots, blue-tongue lizard
host_about:
Hello!  A bit about us and why we share our home on Airbnb: Well, most of the kids have left home, and we've decided our house is too big not to share.  Our own memorable travel experiences abroad and in Australia have converted us to being great supporters of homestay accommodation; we really enjoy meeting fellow wanderers and have first-hand experience in knowing what makes for a great homestay experience.
We both work from our home office in two very different fields:  landscape architecture and  organisational psychology - it makes for very interesting discussions across the office desks!  But, these days we prefer to spend less time working and more time enjoying beautiful Bilgola on Sydney's Northern Beaches.  What do we like?  All the usual suspects: great food and wine; music from every century and style [well, maybe not country ]; books you can fall asleep to; but mostly we like to meet people who also enjoy 'the road less travelled'.
You might also like to check out our 'Secrets of The Garden Workshop' offered through Airbnb Experiences.  Combining our professional skills of landscape design and psychology, we use our own garden to demonstrate ways in which to create special outdoor spaces whilst also unlocking the positive psychological and physical benefits of creating such spaces.

name: Relax in a Tastefully Decorated East Balmain House
summary: Socialise with the host in the al fresco brick-paved courtyard attached to this quiet, comfortable and well-appointed wooden cottage. Dark hardwood floors add class to the private bedroom, which comes with a private guest bathroom.
space: The room available is in a cottage in East Balmain, a suburb on the Balmain peninsula, close to the CBD.  It's a beautiful suburb with loads of parks and the house is just a couple of minutes from Sydney harbour.  There are plenty of pubs, restaurants, shops and cafes very close by, as well as easy public transport to the city (bus and ferry within 5 minutes' walk).   The room contains a comfortable queen size bed, bedside tables and wardrobe, and everything that you need for a short or longer stay.  You'll have your own bathroom and there is access to a laundry if needed.   The house is tastefully furnished and you're welcome to use the shared areas, including a courtyard. The house has a really good feel to it and I'm sure you'll find it to be a relaxing sanctuary during your stay in Sydney. I'm happy to assist with recommendations for good restaurants, day trips and of course, everything around the house.
description: Socialise with the host in the al fresco brick-paved courtyard attached to this quiet, comfortable and well-appointed wooden cottage. Dark hardwood floors add class to the private bedroom, which comes with a private guest bathroom.
neighborhood_overview: The cottage lies in East Balmain, close to the CBD. It's a beautiful suburb with loads of parks, and the house is just a couple of minutes from Sydney harbour. There are plenty of pubs, restaurants, shops and cafes nearby.
access: Make yourself at home downstairs. There's the bedroom and bathroom, kitchen, dining, TV area and a courtyard. I have my own bedroom and bathroom upstairs.
interaction: I'll be happy to give you some local advice, share a meal, or get out of your way completely - whatever you prefer.
house_rules: Security cameras have been installed to monitor the exterior of the house and my private rooms (upstairs). There is also a camera in the living room, but this does not record motion while Airbnb guests are visiting.  Access to shared areas, including kitchen, is welcomed during normal hours (until around 10pm). There are plenty of places for a drink / night out nearby. If you're spending lots of time in the house, I'd appreciate it if you could take your shoes off to minimise noise.  Although the check in time is flexible, please let me know your arrival details as soon as possible so I can ensure I'll be around (or I'll make arrangements to have the key available).     Please do not smoke inside the house, in the back yard or on the porch.    I'll give you a set of keys so you can come and go as you need. I expect basic courtesy and respect for privacy. Please don’t go upstairs unless you need to use the laundry. Thank you.
host_location: Balmain East, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I love cooking, eating, looking after my home and garden and entertaining.  I used to work in finance but I've recently changed career and am now working at a non-profit organisation in public health.
I have traveled widely and appreciate good accommodation (but have also stayed in my fair share of rough places).
I like sharing my home with appreciative travelers.

name: Sunny airy flat near beach and city
summary: Charming & sunny art deco one bedroom apartment with balcony in beautiful leafy Bellevue Hill just ten minutes walk to Bondi Beach, 20 minutes walk to Bondi Junction shopping centre and 15 minutes to ferry for Sydney Harbour.
space: Lovely, sunny top floor furnished art deco two bed flat with cream plantation shutters, balcony and dark wooden floors in secure building - great comfortable haven feel. Master bedroom with queen bed. Exclusive Eastern Suburbs location in beautiful leafy residential Bellevue Hill, just 10 minute walk from the world’s most famous beach - Bondi Beach (surfing, swimming, ultra-hip restaurants and bars and cafes) and a range of others beaches in the vicinity where you can snorkel, kayak, paddleboard, surf, dive and swim. -15 minute walk to a 10 minute ferry into the CBD and Opera House. Beaches ten min walk north, harbour ten minutes walk south -Compact art deco balcony with setting for four to eat al fresco -20m walk/5 min bus to large luxury shopping centre, supermarkets, and train centre -Wireless broadband included -Washing machine, 42" mounted LCD, wireless speakers -Second floor (no lift) -Secure building
description: Charming & sunny art deco one bedroom apartment with balcony in beautiful leafy Bellevue Hill just ten minutes walk to Bondi Beach, 20 minutes walk to Bondi Junction shopping centre and 15 minutes to ferry for Sydney Harbour. Lovely, sunny top floor furnished art deco two bed flat with cream plantation shutters, balcony and dark wooden floors in secure building - great comfortable haven feel. Master bedroom with queen bed. Exclusive Eastern Suburbs location in beautiful leafy residential Bellevue Hill, just 10 minute walk from the world’s most famous beach - Bondi Beach (surfing, swimming, ultra-hip restaurants and bars and cafes) and a range of others beaches in the vicinity where you can snorkel, kayak, paddleboard, surf, dive and swim. -15 minute walk to a 10 minute ferry into the CBD and Opera House. Beaches ten min walk north, harbour ten minutes walk south -Compact art deco balcony with setting for four to eat al fresco -20m walk/5 min bus to large luxury shopping centre, superma
neighborhood_overview: On the Bondi side of Bellevue Hill, the apartment is a lovely sunny airy safe flat in a beautiful leafy exclusive suburb that's perfect for dipping in and out of the beach and its amazing nightlife, but still gives you proximity to the City, Bondi Junction and Double Bay. It's just a little less hectic than Bondi. Bondi and Rose Bay have so many great places to eat and drink, favourite chilli margarita is at Bondi Hardware, great rosé and beach views at The Bucket List, wonderful cocktails and modern Asian at China Diner, gelato at Gelato Messina, breakfast (lunch or dinner) at Porch & Parlour, Lock Stock, Brown Sugar or Harry's, a really local place for a beer is Beach Road Hotel or the North Bondi RSL, sushi at Raw Bar in Bondi, people watching at Le Paris Go, pizza My favourite noodle place is Mappen or Ichi Ban Boshi in Bondi Junction, pizza from MAD Pizza....gosh it's endless in Bondi!
notes: There's free, unlimited, unmetered parking in the neighbourhood if you plan to rent a car.
transit: It's very easy to walk up and down to Bondi (ten minutes). There are buses to Bondi Junction to connect all over the city just a two minute walk away and it's a ten minute trip up to the Junction (or you can walk easily).  You can walk for 15 minutes to Rose Bay Ferry terminal to take a 10 minute ferry into the heart of the Harbour, Circular Quay and the Opera House.  Plenty of Ubers and taxis around
interaction: I will be overseas but happy to converse as much as little as you need. I will be here to meet you and let you in if you wish.
house_rules: No smoking inside No shoes in the bedroom  No pets please No parties and no guests other than those who are staying Please just generally respectful of neighbours
host_about: English, business owner, traveller, runner, classic car and two wheel wine lover living in Sydney, Australia. I'm a regular overseas user of Air BnB and decided finally to list my own place! So far this year...Amsterdam, London, Ibiza, Spain with Miami to finish things off for 2015. Next stop: Thailand in January 2016 and Italy and Croatia in June / July 2016.

name: Sydney beach side family retreat
summary: This modern 4 bedroom fully furnished home is situated in a quiet street with ocean glimpses - and is less than 5 minutes' walk to Clovelly beach (fantastic for snorkelling). It comes with snorkelling gear. It is also a short walk to Bronte Beach, Coogee Beach and Gordons Bay. You can easily walk to Bondi Beach as well along the ocean cliff walkway.
space: This modern 4 bedroom fully furnished home is situated in a quiet street with ocean glimpses - and is less than 5 minutes walk to Clovelly beach (fantastic for snorkelling). It is also a short walk to Coogee Beach, Bronte Beach and Gordens Bay. Or you can easily walk to Bondi Beach along the ocean cliff walkway. The light filled home is brand new and has 4 large bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. Bedroom 1: The main bedroom is upstairs and is a large room with a king size bed and own bathroom. It has a balcony overlooking trees/park. Bedroom 2: It is also large and upstairs and has a double bed. This bedroom shares a bathroom with bedroom No.3. Bedroom 3: It is upstairs and has 4 king single beds. There are bunk beds, another king single bed, plus a trundle king single bed.  So it sleeps 3 comfortably and could sleep a 4th person if needed. It is ideal for children - although adults would sleep comfortably in the king single beds as they are very large.  The bedroom shares a bathroom with Bedro

transit: Buses (included express busess) go directly into city and central station.  You can also get buses to Bondi Junction - where you can access the train network
access: The whole house is accessible. We only rent the entire place.
interaction: I can provide as much access and interaction as needed by phone and email. We will welcome guests and we always keen to help them plan their time. One year I arranged our guests New Years Eve activities for them beforehand. We can often recommend restaurants etc.
house_rules: Guest should keep home clean and tidy.  Respect neighbours. Air conditioning must not be on for more than 2 hours - as may damage air conditioning unit.
host_about: Father of 3 and husband of 1. Looking forward to welcoming you to Sydney !

name: Prime harbourside attic suite
space: This is a loft in a harbour side apartment close to the city.  It is an open spaced suite of rooms with a bathroom, separate bedroom with a double sized bed, and two interlinking living areas with an IKEA day bed in one of the spaces that can convert to a large double bed.  There is a fridge, and facilities to make tea and coffee.  This suite which although totally self contained, is part of the apartment and as such it is not separated from the downstairs part of the apartment. There is a kitchen downstairs that can be used in common.  Opposite our home is the C.Y.C.A. Yacht club and a large park with tennis courts, oval, kiosks, and playground, It is very close to the city and a short walk to Potts Point, Paddington, Double Bay and Darlinghurst, with their restaurants, galleries and night life. It is a 20 min drive from the beach.

name: Stylish, light & peaceful apartment on the harbour
summary: Our apartment is a stylish haven on the harbour in Double Bay. Double Bay is a stunning village that has everything you could possibly need.  It's well positioned to explore Sydney and beyond. An easy 2 min walk to Red Leaf harbour pool & cafe.  Within 10 mins are fabulous cafe's, restaurants, bars, supermarket & health store.  Public transport is at your doorstop for the City & Watsons Bay or grab an uber and be in Bondi Beach within 10 mins.  Hop on a Ferry for the best way to see Sydney.
space: Elceste is a gorgeous 1940's building located in a quiet prestigious Double Bay cul de sac surrounded by multi-million dollar waterfront homes. Bathed in natural light the apartment oozes a relaxed vibe. Bright and white and with black wooden floors its a mix of minimalism and contemporary styles with some lovely art on the walls. The apartment is located on the first floor up small flight of stairs. The lounge, dining room and kitchen are light and airy open plan leading on to a small balcony.  There is one large bedroom with a queen-size bed (which is seriously comfy).  The bathroom has a shower (no bath) and the water pressure is to die for. There is a washing machine located in the bathroom, and an iron, iron board and clothes airer are also available. The kitchen is newly renovated and is fully equipped with dishwasher, kettle, toaster, oven, fridge, stove, utensils, cutlery, crockery etc. There is however no microwave. White 100% cotton bedding and towels are provided with spare

Public transport is at your doorstop for the City & Watsons Bay or grab an uber and be in Bondi Beach within 10 mins.  Hop on a Ferry for the best way to see Sydney. notes: The apartment and the common property are non-smoking. No parking is available on-site.

host_location: Double Bay, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
Hi, I live on the harbour in Double Bay with my partner and we love it here.

I meditate most days as my spiritual path is a very important part of my life. I'm fun, happy and playful. I love to cook and eat great food. 

My work background is in advertising, I've been a TV producer for many years. 

Our home is peaceful and so lovely to live in. It has a really beautiful energy.
