name: Bondi Bliss - moments to the sand
summary: Note: From 14 Jan - 12 Feb 2020, the room is only avail as for 28 days or more.  This listing is for a private room. Bondi Bliss is also available as an entire apartment using the following link:  https://abnb.me/i5POuzDh1W  This place is very warm and bright in winter and cool in summer with lovely district views across the golf course to the harbour. The sleepy location is only a street away from the Bondi Beach action - a  great contrast
space: Just moments to glorious Bondi beach, this lovely light filled apartment has the prime top floor position offering delightful district and harbour views. This apartment is completely self contained and fully furnished - just bring your swim suit! Features include: Large smart TV, Stan, Netflix, wifi internet,  leather couch, soaring ceilings, polished floor boards, elegantly crafted built-ins, lush carpet in the bedrooms, bath, washing machine and a gourmet kitchen with European appliances (gas), jarrah bench tops, espresso machine and dishwasher. The bathroom is dated but very clean. This apartment would suit all beach lovers looking for a stylish and comfortable beach pad. Bondi is a cool suburb with lots of little bars and cafes as well as the beach. There are a lot of buses that go to Bondi Junction where you can catch the train. It is also a nice walk to the Rose Bay ferry which can take you to Circular Quay, Watson’s Bay and Barangaroo. This room is available for longer term rent

T
neighborhood_overview: The following are all within close walking distance: Bondi Beach, Rose Bay (harbour), golf courses, Bondi to Coogee coastal walk, cafes, top restaurants (Bondi Icebergs, Sean’s Panaroma, Catalina), inexpensive restaurants (Thai, Mexican, Indian, Italian), tons of great bars, supermarkets (Harris Farm, Woolworths), pharmacies, post office, banks, doctor’s surgery, fashion, surf and other shops.
notes: There may be another guest (2 maximum) staying in the other bedroom. l stay on site from to time. I  am generally nearby though and available either in person or by text/email should you need me.
transit: The apartment is close to a number of bus stops that take you to Bondi Junction, Paddington, Coogee and into the city. There is a train station at Bondi Junction and a ferry at Rose Bay- both of which are approximately 20 minutes walk away. There is also a ‘Go Get’ share car spot across the road. Share bikes (both traditional and e-bikes) are also available in Bondi (normally positioned in bike racks but can be found anywhere).
access: You are welcome to make yourself at home in the entire apartment apart from the other bedroom.
interaction: I am contactable by text, phone or email. Please note a booking is for a private room in a two bedroom apartment. So you may be sharing the apartment with a maximum of two other guests (who would be sleeping in the other bedroom). Please respect the other guests’ privacy and security by not inviting others to the apartment.
house_rules: Smoking is strictly prohibited anywhere on the property- including outside. In particular, please do not smoke outside the front door of the block as smoke blows into people’s windows and through the door into the building. If you need to smoke, smoke on the footpath out the front of the building on Wellington St. There is a wall to sit on. Please pick up your butts and put them in the bin.  Please be respectful of the neighbours. Do not discard unwanted items in the common area and use the correct bins for recycling and general garbage. This apartment has s relaxed vibe. Please take care not to make noise - particularly at night. Maximum of 4 people may stay. Only guests staying at the apartment are allowed. Please do not invite others into the apartment.  Strictly no parties.  If you want to party, there are bars and clubs to enjoy that are within walking distance.  Please let me know if there is anything that needs attention or where we can improve.
host_about: I am looking forward to welcoming you to the special Bondi vibe in the near future!

name: 3 BEDROOMS & POOL IN SYDNEY BEACHES
space: 3 MONTH MINIMUM STAY! Please ask us about a discount for a 6 month minimum lease! Bright & cosy family home located in Cromer  in a quiet cul-de-sac and residential family area, 5 minute drive to Dee Why beach & cafes. Lovely District & bush outlook from the house & deck. Easy access to Sydney CBD & all that Sydneys Northern Beaches has to offer. Brick veneer house with polished floors, large renovated gourmet kitchen with double oven, huge covered deck with BBQ overlooking the pool and backyard. The master bedroom has a modern ensuite, there is also a full bathroom with shower, bath & toilet. Washing machine available. Broadband, digital TV, PS3 etc. Bedrooms 2 and 3 have a single bed and an additional roll-away can be provided, which would be suitable for a child. 5 minute walk to the nearest bus stop with express buses to the city operating weekdays during peak hour, otherwise buses run to Warringah Mall & Dee Why. It is a 40 minute drive to Sydney CBD and a 5 minute drive to French

name: Huge harbour facing home
summary: We open our beautiful home to you as an oasis in the city. Boasting 2 living areas, 2 double bedooms, 3 bathrooms, full kitchen & amazing balcony overlooking Sydney Harbour. Potts Point is a Sydney lifestyle mecca that is perfect for your holiday.
space: Our beautiful apartment in cosmopolitan Potts Point is an oasis in the city, with the sun rising over the Harbour in the morning,  Waiting for you are two comfy living areas connected to an amazing balcony overlooking Sydney Harbour. The apartment boasts 2 beautiful bedrooms, 3 bathrooms and a fantastic kitchen boasting all the amenities you'll need (inc. coffee machine). Our apartment comfortably sleeps 4 people - in two double bedrooms. Guests will have wardrobe and drawer space in each bedroom for your convenience.  It is ideal for two couples or for parents with 1-2 kids. Our security building is one of the finest in the city, and includes a lap pool and a fully equipped gym.  Despite being in Potts Point, a busy New York-style area, our apartment is facing the water so its very quiet and is a great place to relax. Our secure building is considered one of the best in Sydney.  We'd love to have you stay.
description: We open our beautiful home to you as an oasis in the city. Boasting 2 living areas, 2 double bedooms, 3 bathrooms, full kitchen & amazing balcony overlooking Sydney Harbour. Potts Point is a Sydney lifestyle mecca that is perfect for your holiday.   Our beautiful apartment in cosmopolitan Potts Point is an oasis in the city, with the sun rising over the Harbour in the morning,  Waiting for you are two comfy living areas connected to an amazing balcony overlooking Sydney Harbour. Our apartment comfortably sleeps 4 people - in two double bedrooms. Guests will have wardrobe and drawer space in each bedroom for your convenience. Despite being in Potts Point, a busy New York-style area, ou
neighborhood_overview: Potts Point is one of Sydney's most amazing enclaves. Just out the front door you will find great cafe's, some of Sydney's best restaurants and fabulous shopping.  Staying in Potts Point means you’re right in the heart of a Sydney lifestyle mecca! People come from all over Sydney to experience the Potts Point lifestyle with great food, shopping, coffee, day spa's, parks and the water just around the corner! We are adjacent to Sydney’s City Centre, which is a 15min walk through the Botanic Gardens, past the National Gallery. We are a 15min drive to Bondi Beach and only 5min from Paddington's famous shopping.  After a hard day’s sight seeing, there’s nothing better than being able to walk to over 20 local restaurants and bars for dinner, all within 250m from the apartment.
transit: Buses run past regularly, the Kings Cross train station is 700m away, and there's never a moment a taxi isn't passing our front door.
access: Our beautiful apartment, the gym and pool for guests.
interaction: We only let the property when we are away on holidays.  We're happy to help you arrange key pick-up and drop-off. On weekdays our building concierge can assist with directions and local recommendations.
house_rules: We ask our guests to treat our home with the utmost respect.  - Please do not move any of our personal items from storage spaces.  - Please leave all used linen in the laundry when you leave, you are fee to use laundry facilities. - Please turn on the dishwasher when you leave. - Please be careful of the artwork and our decorative items. - You are free to smoke but please do so outside. - For 5+days visitors, our cleaners will clean on the 5th day. This usually takes 2-3hrs and we will happily arrange a time around you. - We welcome you to our home but please leave it as you found it.
host_about:
Hi,

Welcome to our beautiful home in Potts Point, Sydney. We are an outgoing couple who enjoy the best of both worlds, living close to work in the city and  Potts Point, but also close to parks, the harbor and a quick swim at Bondi Beach. We can't live without our son, exercise, our beautiful dog Frankie, great coffee, the sun and a great restaurant.  

Thanks for visiting.

name: Bondi Hideaway
summary: Architectually designed, open plan, small terrace home in a quiet neighbourhood, close to Bondi Beach & Bondi Junction shopping town and public transport.
space: NOTE: AT LEAST 1 WEEK'S NOTICE FOR BOOKING ARRIVALS AS I LIVE IN THE HOUSE SO NEED TO MAKE ARRANGEMENTS.  Minimum stay during peak time period Dec 21, 2017-Jan 6th, 2018 is 7 nights.  Architectually designed, funky, modern, industrial house in Bondi/Bondi Junction Great location, hidden away in a small quite laneway away from traffic and street noise. Beaches, shops, nightlife, public transport are a short hop away. The property is a tall, narrow terrace home, positioned behind a tall, heritage-protected Australian gum tree, north-facing for maximum sunshine. - Showcased in the Sydney Morning Herald's "100 Amazing Small Homes in Sydney". Call it cute, sexy, funky, cool, this house has character. Just 3 metres wide and very tall, it has 2.5 levels, a steep, tree-house stair case, high corrigated iron circular roof, open-plan spaces and very few doors, eco-designed with metal and wood finishings, polished oak floorboards, polished concrete, carpet-less.  - Gourmet kitchen with all modern

access: Access to entire house - owner vacates for your rental
interaction: Contactable via mobile and email
house_rules: Quiet neighbourhood so respect neighbours, no partying Keep house tidy at all times, using waste bins. No smoking indoors No pets Maximum 4 persons (2 queen sized beds) No drugs on premises Have fun!
host_about: Welcome to beautiful Sydney! My name is Paul, I am a full blooded Aussie (with European background), well travelled to over 70 countries, lived and worked in 5 countries, love the adventure, meeting people, appreciating cultures, sharing a laugh or beer. I love the outdoors although I work indoors in a professional financial environment. I am a very easy going, laid back, witty guy with a cheeky sense of humour, always genuine & honest . I don't take life too seriously, keep healthy, fit and well oiled, love the beach and sun and live close to famous Bondi Beach.

name: Wonderland at Tamarama Beach
summary: Beach pad just a short walk to Tamarama beach, the glamourous and exclusive neighbour to Bondi.
space: Nestled above Tamarama beach, on a quiet cul-de-sac but right next to the Bondi Beach action is this amazing apartment. In a classic spanish mission 1940s building, the apartment is renovated and is bright and comfortable. Tamarama beach is a 5 minute walk through a park, and Bondi is about a 7 minute walk. 5 minutes walk takes you to the hip restaurants of Bondi road including Corner House, Panama House and Sefa Kitchen, but with its own carpark, its easy to get anywhere. The apartment is set up for a couple and child, with the second bedroom with sofa bed separated from the kitchen by a sliding wall. The master bedroom has views to the ocean. We spend most Christmas holidays interstate, and like someone to stay while we're away.

transit: Buses run to Bondi Junction and Sydney city from a stop 5 minutes walk away.  5 minute walk to Tamarama beach and 10 minutes to Bondi beach
access: The Beach! Plus wifi, wardrobe space, and all amenities of the property

host_about: I've been living in Bondi for the past 17 years- apart from a couple of stints overseas. It is so great to be able to go for a swim before or after work, and every weekend is like a beach holiday.

name: North Bondi Garden flat near beach
summary: A real home away from home.  Queen size room in spacious garden flat 5 minute walk to the famous Bondi Beach.  Each room looks out onto a leafy garden. Wooden floors, wifi, netflix, laundry, dishwasher and smoochy cat.
space: Double bedroom available in a gorgeous, large sunny garden flat in North Bondi, just 5 mins from the famous Bondi beach and 1 min to transport. It really is a great base to explore both the immediate area and out and about around Sydney. Close to the cafes and shops and all that Bondi has to offer, but tucked away in a quiet community street - nice and tranquil, yet close to everything! The bedroom is a very good size, with Queen Bed, chair, hanging rail. Lovely polished floorboards. The room looks out over the garden - leafy and private. The flat itself has a large living area, in a quiet block of 4.  Polished wooden floor, living room, dining room, new kitchen, internal laundry, sunroom, wifi, plasma tv, netflix, Free on-street parking is available. To share with just myself and my cat, who is a chilled gorgeous affection cat- so fantastic cat cuddles are thrown in for free!! My flat is a real home....plus a  chilled home life is important to me, so no party animals please.  It's a l

neighborhood_overview: It is so close to the beach, yet is very quiet and has a lovely community vibe. So many cafes, bars, restaurants to discover, along with the infamous Bondi Beach and iconic coastal walks. Transport is a few minutes away. There is everything that you need so close and all that Bondi has to offer, but still a tranquil escape.
transit: There is a bus stop directly to the City just 2 mins from the front door. Further buses are just 5-7mins walk at the beach. The Rose Bay ferry is a 20 minute walk or 5-10min drive away.
access: Unlimited wifi, netflix tv, laundry, kitchen, garden, bathroom, living room, dining room - a real home away from  home! Cat cuddles are thrown in for free. He's a gorgeous placid smooch of a cat.
interaction: I work during the day, but happy to interact when home, chats, or whatever, just as a flatmate would.
house_rules: No smoking inside the house.  Please be considerate of my things in the flat whilst I am not there. It is my home and it is important to me. My cat will be in the flat. He is very affectionate and easy. Please do not close the living room or kitchen doors so that he can access his food etc. He is locked in at night and allowed to go outside (back only, not the front door) during the day via the laundry window.
host_location: North Bondi, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I am an honest, open and friendly chick who works in a creative job.
I love my life in Bondi and have a good circle of friends around me. I love getting out and about, visiting markets, beach walks, keeping active and discovering new things and little pockets of life around the place.
My home is my sanctuary and i love a chilled, quiet home life.

name: Close to famous Bondi Beach ,
summary: The house has a  back garden with a beautiful frangipany tree  and outdoor setting and barbecue. The house  has charm and  elegance. You will be near everything, shops and the beach are a short stroll away. Transport also close to get you to Bondi Junction.
space: My place is a very comfortable semi-detached residence 10 minutes walk from the very famous Bond Beach, the famous Icebergs club and all the Hall St cafes and restaurants. The house is charming in its unique older style and is very light, clean, quiet, warm and sunny. There is a small courtyard out the back with a barbecue and setting for use. The room has a built in wardrobe and double sized bed and bedside table. The room also has wifi. The house also has an outdoor laundry with washer for use. The kitchen is older in style and essentially looks like a homely beachhouse kitchen with all amenities provided. It looks very lively in brightly coloured reds and blues. The house is very close to public transport with various buses leaving frequently for Bondi Junction where the majority of shops are close at hand. The bus ride is about ten minutes and takes you right to the train station where you can head off shopping in the city.

neighborhood_overview: My neighbours are lovely and the environment fairly quiet at this south end of the beach.
transit: There is easy access to buses minutes away and these buses will take you to Bondi Junction in 10 minutes or so and the train system will then get you into the city in no  time.
access: Guests have access to free wifi.
interaction: I am always on hand to provide information but also realise that guests like to have their privacy too. This will be respected.
house_rules: Smoking ok outside
host_location: Bondi Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
I am a friendly 55 year old guy that lives in the best place on earth - Bondi Beach! I am happy to share my place. It's fairly casual yet has touches of elegance. I have tried to keep it as close to posssible as a casual and relaxed beachside home.

I love travel and have enjoyed such places as Melbourne, Phnom Penh, Paris, London, Bangkok, New York and Wellington, NZ. I would love to hear of your travel experiences too. Guests need to be gay friendly.

name: Palm Beach-Magnificent ocean views!
summary: You will love this retro Palm Beach cottage from the moment you walk through the door and straight out to the view! Pacific ocean, beautiful Barrenjoey Headland and peaceful Pittwater all in one sweeping glance! A short walk to both Palm Beach and Whale Beach. Weekends or longer stays.
space: Beautiful Palms - a quaint, yet comfortable cypress pine lined cottage on the ocean (NE) side of Palm Beach. Delight in the wonder of sun, surf and sand at your doorstep.  Enjoy your breakfast,  lunch or dinner on the deck overlooking the water. Enjoy surf and ocean pool swimming, long walks along the beach to Barrenjoey headland and lighthouse, Pittwater sunsets.  Can accommodate up to 6 people in three bedrooms - one queen bed (with a fabulous view from the bed), one Californian king bed (which can be split into two king singles) and two long singles (which can be joined together to make a king bed). A comfortable and relaxing atmosphere  - board games, books and broadsheets, the order of the day, rather than the big screen!  Cook your own meals in a cute 80s 'retro', wattle coloured, fully equipped but basic kitchen. Two bathrooms (one upstairs in the main part of the cottage and one downstairs off the laundry - again a bit retro) and an outside shower to wash away the  sand from th

A comfortable and relaxing atmosphere  - board games, books and broadsheets, the order of the day, rath
neighborhood_overview: The beauty, peace and quietude of this magnificent part of Sydney's northern beaches must be seen and experienced. You will be in awe of the stunning natural beauty that surrounds you. Long walks on the beach, relaxing swims in crystal clear waters and relaxing on the deck, soaking up the view, with all the comforts of this cosy cottage at your fingertips!
notes: Standard Terms  and Conditions will be agreed and apply at the time of booking confirmation. A  Security Deposit bond will be required.* * The Security Deposit bond will be refunded subject to the conditions in the Standard Terms and Agreement being met. It is designed to cover any additional costs incurred including but not limited to, any breakage, damage or excess cleaning requirements, extra guests beyond those declared ..etc.
transit: Situated on the ocean side of Palm Beach on Whale Beach Rd if driving. You can catch a mini bus if you are arriving from the airport. The L90 Sydney bus service from the city to Palm Beach runs (Website hidden by Airbnb) is the last stop on the peninsula. I may be able to arrange to pick you and your bags up from the bus terminus, depending on your ETA or it is a 10-15 minute walk to the cottage from the bus stop. Alternatively, catch the B-Line to Mona Vale and call a KeoRide car to drive you from Mona Vale bus stop directly to the cottage. Of course, you might decide to drive or hire a rental car to get here and use it to get out and around during your stay. There is parking at street level on the road just outside the cottage.
access: Weekend stays may request an early check in on Friday or a late checkout on Sunday - unless there are back to back bookings. If you make a booking at the published rates, then you will have access to the cottage in its entirety, for your sole use.   During the Christmas/New Year period and into January and other school holiday periods are peak times. Preference will be given to full week bookings and longer stays of at least 5 days. !!!NOT FOR THE FEINT HEARTED !!! - there are a large number of rough hewn sandstone stairs leading up to the cottage, as the cottage sits higher above the road. Be assured, every step worth it! Please be aware that the cottage is not suitable for those with a disability nor may not be for toddlers or very young children, unless under careful supervision.
interaction: The cottage can be booked for your sole occupation or if you wish to make a booking as my guest, a discount will be applied. If you are a single traveller, couple or small family or group - and just want somewhere beautiful and peaceful to land, this is the place for you!
house_rules: Bring your stories, good humor and laughter with you. Prepare to  relax, unwind and marvel in this beautiful environment. In general, all I would ask is for you to please be respectful and responsible in your use of the space and your enjoyment of the house, the neighbourhood and it's amenity.  Specifically, upon confirming your booking through payment, you agree to the Standard Terms and Conditions of Temporary Holiday Accommodation below: The owners will make every effort to ensure the property is available as booked. However the owners reserve the right to make alterations to bookings due to unforeseen circumstances. To maintain a good standard for our guests we require certain conditions to be complied with. We appreciate most will respect our property but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following conditions. Number of Guests should not exceed the number stated on the Confirmation Notice or subsequently agreed in writing or email.  Fees will apply for excess guests
host_location: Palm Beach, New South Wales, Australia
host_about: Easy going and fun loving. Blessed to live in a beautiful part of a great country! Open space and the peace and calm that only the natural environment can provide, is very important to me. As is the company of friends and family, good books, good food and good times! I am interested in people - their backgrounds, experiences and culture. Love to hear your stories. I swim and walk for recreation, whilst yoga is my preferred 'sport'! Time to travel again, after having raised a family.

name: Private Room - Beach Apartment
summary: Lovely cozy bedroom with soft cotton sheets and wool carpet. Good size double room with built in wardrobes.
space: The location is what really attracted us to this place, its a 5/10 minute stroll to the beach and a stones throw from some great bars and cafes there's also a bus stop no more than 100 meters away. The apartment itself has classic art deco features with grand high ceilings and ornate details throughout with a total of 108 square meters. Has a light airy feel with a sun room that has ocean views.  The room can accommodate up to 2 people with double bed a large wardrobe and towels provided. We also come with a wealth of knowledge of the local area having been residents for the past 10 years. Thanks,  Jules and Mariko

access: Apart from your own private double bedroom, You will have access to the bathroom, kitchen, living & sun room and private Laundry. There is a small shared garden with washing lines.

name: Breathtaking beach and ocean views
summary: Top floor flat with amazing views of the iconic Bondi beach and ocean. Wake up to the sun rising over the water and fall asleep to the sound of the waves crashing.
space: Top floor flat with amazing views of the icinic Bondi beach and ocean. Wake up to the sun rising over the water and fall asleep to the sound of the waves crashing. Two bedrooms, one bathroom, traditional classic furniture and parking for one car. Master bedroom with four poster queen bed  has direct access to the bathroom and is suited for a couple. The second bed is a fold down double bed, most suited for one person. There is an additional charge of $25 per night for the use of the second bed.   In addition the flat offers a flat screen TV with DVD/Blueray player and cable, wireless internet, local phone calls. Relax on the balcony or take in the view from the comfortable seating inside the unit. Whales and dolphins can be spotted in the season which runs from June to Nov. Parakeets are frequent guests on the balcony.  The unit is located in a residential cul-de-sac street with steps going down to the breathtaking coastal walk from Bondi to Bronte beach. notes: The blinds to the balcony doors are electric and are operated by remote control. The left faucet is instant hot water for tea or cooking needs. Please be careful not to place your hands under the running water.
interaction: I let guests have space, relax and enjoy the place but I’m available by email or text as needed.

name: Coogee Beachside Garden Apartment
space: Recently renovated tranquil ground floor apartment with own entrance and garden in charming Classic Victorian 5 apartment building. 200m from the Beach near cricket oval and tennis courts. Walking distance to main Coogee high street with shops, restaurants, pubs and general amenities. Bus to city and Bondi Junction directly opposite. Coastal walk to Bondi at the end of the street. Property located on the northern side of Coogee just next to Clovelly. Marble kitchen fully equiped with Smeg appliances (gas cooktop) and integrated fridge and freezer. Everything you need for entertaining inside or out in the garden which has also been recently landscaped with limestone paving and new grass laid. Outdoor copper hot and cold shower for those warm summer days to wash off the sand from the beach. Marble bathroom with underfloor heating and heated towel rail. Shower (no bath). Decorated to reflect breezy Sydney beach lifestyle. Original floorboards painted white throughout with 3m high ceilings

name: LovelyStudio Near Sydney University
summary: You've just found a funky little studio, filled with everything you need for your Sydney  visit - spotlessly clean, with lots of light & air, it is private, modern & comfy. Everything you need for a simply, fresh breakfast provided. Enjoy easy public transport to city from a suburb with lots of local charm. Free Wifi. Cafes around the corner. Moments to the train station, and minutes to the City Centre. I have been an airbnb superhost for a long time - so will look after you beautifully.
space: The Darling Studio: Wilson Lane, Darlington, NSW (Sydney's Inner West)  Hi there  This apartment IS small in size but we offer GREAT service, spotless cleanliness and lots of comfort and style - all within a funky, innner-city neighbourhood. Serviced accommodation  The Darling Studio is a stylish and self-contained studio with new, contemporary furnishings. We provide short or long term serviced accommodation. Exquisite linen. Quiet, sunny and spotlessly clean, The Darling Studio is ideally located just minutes away from the University of Sydney, Carriageworks, and the Seymour Theatre.  Is there much traffic noise? The studio is situated overlooking a lane. The lane is not a thorough-fare, as mostly only our neighbours use the lane to access their garages, but occasionally you do hear delivery vans pass by for the shops on the next street. Run by a local family, we aim to provide a warm, friendly, and client-focused service to ensure your stay is delightful. We've been doing this for o

Everything you need for a simply, fresh breakfast provided. Enjoy easy public transport to city from a suburb with lots of local charm. Free Wifi. Cafes around the corner. Moments to the train station, and minutes to the City Centre. I have been an airbnb superhost for a long time - so will look after you beautifully. The Darling Studio: Wilson Lane, Darlington, NSW (Sydney's Inner West)  Hi there  This apartment IS small in size but we offer GREAT service, spotless cleanliness and lots of comfort and style - all within a funky, innner-city neighbourhood. Serviced accommodation  The Darling Studio is a stylish and self-contained studio with new, contemporary furnishings. We provide short or long term serviced accommodation. Exquisite linen. Quiet, sunny and spotlessly clean, The Darling Studio is ideally located jus
neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is vibrant and lovely. Long ago it was an area with a rougher reputation but it is now becoming gentrified and has a strong, family community spirit.  Lots of families and academics are our neighbours. There are several local cafes and take-aways at your doorstep, vibrant Farmers Markets in our street on weekends, and we are near 2 large culture/performing arts centres (Seymour theatre and Carriageworks), if you want to catch a show while here - check out their websites. You can walk there! The studio is also walking distance to the vibrant Newtown and Glebe, yet remains a peaceful area.
notes: CHECKING IN AND CHECKING OUT While we have set preferred check-in (2pm) and check-out times (9 - 9.30am), we will be as flexible as possible outside of these times to accommodate your needs whenever we can.
transit: Location & Getting Around The Darling Studio is in a fantastic location. Despite being located within 40ms of local friendly cafes, shops and parks, it is usually whisper-quiet. It is situated on a laneway, so the outlook is not stunning, but happily The Darling Studio is only 15 minutes walk to the hustle and bustle and all that King Street (Newtown), and its fabulous cafe and restaurant lifestyle, has to offer.  As the Studio overlooks a laneway, even though it is not a thorough-fare, you do hear vehicle noise and delivery vans occasionally. Redfern train station is just minutes away (but far enough away so that train noise is not a problem). By train, you can be at The Opera House, and the centre of Sydney, in less than 15 minutes. We are located just minutes from the University of Sydney, while UTS and Notre Dame campuses are a slightly longer walk away (about 12 - 18 minutes).  Australian Technology Park is also just 15 minutes walk away. The Darling Studio is also within an easy
access: Our guests have their own entrance and completely separate accommodation, with their own bathroom. There is shared access to the laundry (that you can use for free) There is shared access to a lovely, small courtyard (with trees and beautiful garden), with bench seats. The main house is separated from the Studio by the courtyard (the family lives in the main house). Guests can access the Darling Studio Wifi / internet free of charge. While the internet is usually excellent, we cannot guarantee internet in the rare event of a technical fault outside of our control - happily this rarely happens!
interaction: Although we live in the main house, we give you lots of privacy. However, if you need anything, just knock on the back door, call or email and we will help out.
house_rules: We appreciate that you please leave the Darling Studio as you find it – as clean and tidy ... it seems to be part of the culture of airbnb travellers - that they leave the homes they visit nice and tidy/clean.  Please don't leave garbage inside when you check-out (the garbages are just downstairs, so please put rubbish there - thank you). Please don’t worry about making the bed because we will launder the linen after you leave.  We ask that you respect our neighbours - especially in relation to noise in the evening (e.g., no loud music after 10pm) as we have really lovely neighbours, some with young children, and we don’t want to disturb them.  The Studio has a lovely breeze and cross ventilation when you open the windows. However, for security, please close the large, central windows whenever you leave (the small sides one can stay open) Thanks! Your security code:  Only paying guests are permitted to use the security code. Guests cannot give their security code to any other person, o
host_about:
Hi. My name is Kellie. 

My family (myself, my husband and 3 kids) have been welcoming guests at our Studio since August 2010, but we only started using “airbnb” in July 2012. To see the feedback guests give us about their time with us in The Darling Studio, please see below. We have never had any negative feedback and the feedback is not “cherry-picked” (i.e., we only show you the best of our feedback – we show it all). 

The Studio is a separate residence, sitting at the back of the main house, separated by a courtyard.  Our approach to hosting is to give our guests privacy, however, if you need us or need help, we do our utmost to help ... Whether you want recommendations for the best local pastry shops (Black Star in Newtown), advice about lovely walks around Sydney harbour or local beaches (that us locals use – not just the typical ‘tourist’ haunts) or you’d like a home-made map of the quickest-back-street-way to drive to the airport, we are there for you.  

We travelled through Europe staying in serviced apartments and we use that experience to make our Darling Studio the most comfortable we can for our guests. We learnt what not to do, as well as what travelers appreciate (e.g., some little “goodies” like chocolates, fruit, cereal, some milk and butter or fruit on arrival to help you settle in before your first big supermarket shop); helpful (but not intrusive) hosts, honesty in advertising and so on. 

We have had guests stay as long as 11 months, and others return 3-5 times, so we think that suggests we are getting something right with hosting. We find it a real joy to meet people from all over the world, and help their stay in Sydney be comfortable, friendly and memorable. 

Warm regards & I look forward to hosting you at our Darling Studio sometime soon.
Kellie (with feedback from our guests below).

FEEDBACK FROM GUESTS
What a jewel: This studio is beautifully designed, practical, clean, peaceful with a lovely court yard, and in walking distance to the University of Sydney and Redfern station (one station from Central station). The hosts are most welcoming and helpful while guaranteeing privacy and individuality to the guest. The parallel street is charming, too, with student atmosphere, small coffee shops, deli and restaurants. The Darling Studio is definitely my favourite accommodation in Sydney (Stefan, German/Swiss professor, five separate visits across 2011 and 2012). 

The Darling Studio is my cozy and beautifully designed haven whenever I am in Sydney. The hosts are warm and welcoming with an eye for attention and comfort. The location is ideal - a very short walk to Redfern train station and the neighbourhood is filled with charming cafes and friendly neighbours. I highly recommend a stay (Heather, Consultant, four separate visits across 2011). 

I stayed at the Darling Studio for a week and the only way to sum up the place is to say it was a home away from home! The hosts were wonderful and assisted with all my inquiries (eg. location of hairdresser, train services, best eatery, etc). The Darling Studio was not only clean and fresh but contained EVERYTHING you could possibly need and more than is advertised (eg. DVD's, books, maps, take away pamphlets, shampoo, ear buds, basic foods - just everything). I would highly recommend it to anyone needing a place to stay in Sydney. The price you pay for what you get is great value and only a short distance (via train or taxi) away from major attractions in Sydney. Definitely will be staying there again in the future! (Claudia, Midwife, October 2011). 

I was a Japanese visiting researcher in Sydney University and stayed in this studio for eleven months. It was very convenient for commuting to University and for shopping at Broadway and Eveleigh Markets. On weekends I walked down to Cockle Bay, Circular Quay and Hyde Park and went to suburbs from nearby Redfern Railway Station. The hosts are very kind and friendly. If you want to concentrate on your work in the day and to have a quiet night, you can do it here just as I did (Professor Ueshima, 2010-2011). 

What a wonderful place to stay and so close to everything important; cafes, pubs and shops. I especially loved the little touches, like a pre stocked fridge to help ease you through the first couple of days whilst recovering from travel. Lovely place and helpful happy people to deal with ... what more could you ask for! (Geoffrey, Dislocate Circus Theatre Company, 2011).

... thank you for our stay - we had a wonderful time ... The hospitality offered by you was first rate, and the little touches like providing milk, fruit and bread every so often was highly appreciated (Jim, IT specialist, 2010). 

A word of thanks for making our recent 3-week stay in your beautiful Darling Studio a most wonderfully comfortable experience. The moment you welcomed us, we felt we had truly arrived in our Home Away from Home !!! From your beautiful studio furnishings, the boutique linens; towels, to the specially stocked pantry, fresh foods, and flowers, you thought of everything !! … We look forward to returning; definitely recommend your "Darling Studio"! Until we meet again, health and happiness to you all, Sincerely Crystall and Alisia (Surrey, British Columbia Canada November, 2010).

name: Light  Room In Coogee near Beach
summary: Lots of space and light in this cosy, two bedroom apartment. I have a large bookshelf with a broad range of books to read as you sit on a comfy chair in my sunroom overlooking the trees.
space: The apartment I live in on the top floor of a duplex in a spacious2 bedroom flat. We are in a leafy, friendly neighbourhood that is safe and has easy access to the beach, shops, transport and great cafe. I share a sunny garden and have a sweet little miniature poodle who is playful and loves people. She doesn't said which suits allergy sufferers. I keep her clean and well groomed. I will do my best to make you feel comfortable and cared for. I have a modern kitchen, with a dishwasher and two sunrooms each with leafy outlooks. They hare great to sit and relax, listen to music, check your emails or just gaze out at the trees. I will provide you with supplies for a simple breakfast that you can help yourself to. I also have great coffee and teas. My home is perfect for a clean, quiet, responsible traveller or student who enjoys going out and exploring the beautiful coastal walks around here or taking an easy bus to the city. There is so much to see and do in Sydney. My preference

notes: We are a quiet, leafy neighbourhood, lots of keen gardeners around and you might even here our neighbour's chickens.
transit: I am a block away from Carrington road, which has a regular bus route (Bus #374) up to Randwick shops and to the city. I am 10mins away from Coogee beach which has regular buses to the city and Bondi Junction.

interaction: I'm friendly and warm if you'd like a chat but am also respectful of giving my guests their space.
house_rules: As a Superhost, my aim is to make your stay as comfortable as it can possibly be!  I pride myself in opening my home to you so that you are safe, comfortable and at ease..   - I provide a beautiful spacious comfortable home not a hotel, and it is also my home that I share with you.  Please be respectful of the property and keep it clean before you leave.  Here are some house rules that I hope will help you get clear on the expectations of your stay here and allow you to relax.   It would be helpful for you to read these  house rules and confirm that they have been reviewed WITHIN 48 HOURS OF YOUR BOOKING. This is to ensure that if there is any reason the House Rules cannot be followed, you, my guest, will have the option of cancelling the booking penalty free as I have a Strict Cancellation policy. Thank you in advance and I truly appreciate your cooperation. HOUSE RULES  - Keep noise to a minimum after 10pm. - No TV watching during the day.  - This is a strictly non smoking house whic
host_about:
I am a warm, lively woman who has done a lot of traveling and has many stories to tell from my adventures in life. I work as a holistic psychotherapist in private practice with specific expertise in the divine feminine.  I love living near the ocean and walk along the coast everyday with my dog, a very sweet miniature poodle. I live in a great neighbourhood with lots of tall trees and lots of colourful and chattery birds. People are very friendly around here and there is a wonderful sense of community.  I'm in close walking distance to the beach shops and buses to the city.

i live in on the top floor of a duplex in a spacious 2 bedroom flat. I share a sunny garden with friendly downstairs neighbours who are into permaculture, so it's always full of veggies and flowers. The room that is available is light and airy and I am only looking to rent to singles at this time or perhaps a parent and child.

My place is comfortable and homey and would suit a clean, mature traveller or student who likes to be out and exploring the beautiful coastal walks and cafes around here.
I am looking forward to welcoming you soon!

name: Early Beach Walk B&B - Malabar
space: Home away from Home.... Located just a 3 minute walk to Malabar Beach, this is the perfect place to base yourself at this summer. Walk across Golf Course. Bus located across the house will make it easy to and from any destination. This homely bed and breakfast is quaint but delightful. Your room is cosy and practical and has everything you need in order to make your stay here confortable. The main shopping centre is just a 3 minute walk away and we are also situated on most of the main bus routes. While you are here, make sure you you check out the cliff walk in the National Park, or if you're really up for it, why not give the he Maroubra to La Perouse bush walk a go. space: Do you need somewhere to call home for a little while? Are you moving to Sydney and need a temporary base? This bright and airy room is available for longer-term stays, preferably a month or more (but we are flexible).  It's a great room in a long-established share house, living with two locals. Darlinghurst is a great location choice when visiting Sydney as it is centred between the City and Bondi.

Contemporary Hotels is Australia's leading independent boutique accommodation provider well known for its design-conscious Beach Houses + Villas + Luxury Houses + Apartments - as well as its landmark urban boutique hotel Medusa in Sydney. The collection also encompasses a suite of luxury properties on Italy's Amalfi Coast, a sumptuous villa in Bali and a beautiful apartment in Paris.
Contemporary Hotels is the destination of choice by urban sophisticates, professionals, couples and well-travelled families looking for unique contemporary accommodation that celebrates Australia's style. We focus on providing unparalleled service, attention to detail with our properties and ensuring that you, the guest, has a wonderful holiday!

neighborhood_overview: Wonderfully located on Victoria Street in Potts Point. Potts Point is Sydney's most cosmopolitan neighbourhood (think Soho London, The East Village NYC). Victoria Street is unique. Lined with beautiful trees, it starts at the Harbour and is filled with cafes and restaurants. During the last decade Potts Point has become recognised as one of the most desirable places to live in Sydney. Many empty-nesters have sold their family homes in the suburbs and bought an apartment in the neighbourhood. Many young families now choose to live here, so much so that the sight of prams, once as rare in Potts Point as koalas, are now part of the diverse mix of locals. And why wouldn't anybody want to live here? It is the most cosmopolitan 'hood' in Australia. It is beautiful, grand old art deco buildings and harbour side parks; it is a walk to the city through the Botanic Gardens; you can get a coffee downstairs, and have a drink after dinner. It is all about amenity. It is a vibrant, living, inner-urb
notes: Parking. Parking is subject to availability. The cost is $25 per day and must be booked at the time of your reservation.
transit: It is one minute walk to the nearest train station (Kings Cross) or you can walk into the CBD in fifteen minutes. There is a goget car for hire by the hour on the street. Harbour-side parks are 5 minutes walk. The surf beaches are also a short train/ bus ride away. Within walking distance of the Botanic Gardens, Opera House, Art Gallery, Australian Museum, central business district & most tourist sites  AIRPORT: - Taxis takes about 20 minutes and cost about $50 (depending on the time of day).  - Shuttle bus stops at nearby hotels. This costs approx. $14 but takes much longer as it makes a number of stops. - Train. Domestic Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.22 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station - Train. International Airport Station to Kings Cross, a one way ticket is: $16.81 AUD and takes 30 minutes station to station
access: Guests have access to everything in the apartment and direct access to the best food and drink Sydney has to offer.
interaction: I like to welcome Guests and show them their accommodation. My family and I live in the next street, so I am close by if Guests need something.
house_rules: ★ Prior to the day of your check-in, ONLY CONTACT ME via the Airbnb message thread. Keeping your booking requirements here in one place keeps me organised. ★ Arrival and Departure times. Please advise: • your estimated ARRIVAL time in Sydney, and • your planned DEPARTURE time from the apartment (checkout is before 11am) I need the times for your convenience so I can plan check-ins and schedule cleanings. If I do not know the times in advance or you are delayed without contacting me, your check-in maybe POSTPONED till later in the evening. ★ Check out. Leave the apartment as you found it is probably the best guide. Please: • wash dishes • take out rubbish • leave used towels in the shower • close windows • put things away (hairdryers, plates, pots etc) • turn off lights and air-conditioning • leave BOTH sets of keys IN the apartment. • message me to say you have left ★ Sheets and towels. Please DO NOT wash the sheets and towels before your departure. I appreciate the effort, but I prefe
host_about:
My family and I live in Potts Point. We love it and think it is the best neighbourhood in Sydney. It is full of life - cafes, restaurants, bars, markets, shops and parks. If Potts Point does not have it, it is nearby by foot, taxi or public transport. It is rated as the most liveable part of Sydney.

We like to travel. I have been fortunate enough to live in Singapore (Tanglin School), France (Dijon - Universite di Bourgogne), Holland (Delft), Italy (Perugia - Universita per Stranieri), UK (London), PNG (Moresby) and Germany (Hamburg). Our experience in travelling and living abroad has been distilled into our apartments.

Airbnb gives us the opportunity to offer to you the five homes we own (not just manage) in this neighbourhood for your stay in Sydney.

All our homes are well designed, comfortable, clean, secure and fully equipped with everything you will need to enjoy your holiday or business trip. We live a minute away so we are available should you need something.

HELPFUL TIP: If you are new to Airbnb, and have not yet completed your profile, it is highly recommended by both Airbnb and myself, that you do. If this is not completed prior to contacting me, then please take the time to introduce yourself in your first contact message when sending in an inquiry or booking request. We would like to know who is coming to our homes. 

The homes we have on Airbnb can be found below.

The houses are mostly quite large and there are several parks and bush walks within a short distance of each other.  The local shopping village is 2 km from our home.
notes: There will probably be other guests staying at the same time.
transit: We have easy access to the city centre.  There is a weekday ferry to Circular Quay just 7 mins walk away and the bus stop is 2 mins walk.  There is safe and plentiful on-road parking just outside.  To get to our home from the airport there are various options.  You can take a train to Wynyard then from Clarence St near Wynyard take the 261 bus and get off at the first stop on Kenneth St.  Uber or taxi can cost anything from $45-85 depending on traffic  or I offer a pick up service for $45  1 person, $50 for 2, $55 for 3. I am not always available to do this so please check first.
access: Breakfast is included in the cost and you can either have access to the kitchen to make your own dinner or join us for $7 extra per person.  We have dinner together most nights so you would be welcome to join us.  The pool is also available to guests approx six months a year from mid Oct - mid Apr.
interaction: We will interact with guests as much or as little as they wish to.  I am home quite often during the day so am available to help with advice or just to have a coffee and a chat.
host_about:
I love travelling myself and like to stay with local people whenever I can to get a true feel for the country I'm visiting.  We also enjoy having international guests share our home. We like to make people feel relaxed and comfortable when they stay with us.
 Our most recent favourite destination was The Netherlands which we cycled around for a month and our favourite meal is sushi!

name: Sunny Garden Apartment at Manly Beach
summary: Located just 2 minutes away from the East Manly Cove Beach, this apartment boasts a green & relaxed ambience suitable for couples looking for a home away from home. With a spacious living room, fully equipped kitchen, comfortable bedroom, clean bathroom and reliable WiFi access, this cozy apartment filled with indoor plants and an open garden view will surely take your breath away.
space: Welcome to the Sunny Manly! Come stay in our charming one bedroom apartment. Centrally located to everything in Manly and ready for you to walk in and enjoy! The Apartment: Our place is fully equipped with a gourmet kitchen, including stone benches, gas cooking, dishwasher etc. featuring a marble bathroom.  The bedroom comes with a well-sized queen bed and an open garden view.  The apartment features a bright open plan lounge and kitchen as well as comfy chairs on the balcony with a garden outlook. There is also a 42 inches plasma TV. There's a fan to keep the air moving on a still evening and get warm quick in winter with a large gas heater. Centrally located, only 5 minutes walk to: - Manly's numerous world famous beaches and harbour - An abundance of shops, restaurants, bars, cinema etc - National Park and walking trails - Buses and wharf  Need more reasons to stay? - Quiet, off-street location - Wireless internet - Dishwasher - Washer & dryer -Nespresso machine - Only 18 minutes fe

notes: Only on-street parking is available.
transit: Get around however you prefer! Short walk to Manly Wharf for buses and ferries. PopCar, Car Next Door ($5 per hour) and other share cars or rentals are available within a block or so.
access: The entire 1 bedroom apartment + small veranda is all yours! Port-a-cot available on request.
interaction: You will be staying in my home while I am house sitting so I will not be on site but respond to quierys ASAP and am nearby if you need me!

We love the warmth of summer and so do these bugs. Be careful with leaving food behind and/or with leaving windows and doors open at night as these critters will find their way in. name: Cosy Cottage close to Transport!
summary: The Garden Cottage is a cosy and quiet one bedroom house in the leafy north of Sydney. Sleeping up to five people, it has everything to make your visit very comfortable. We are only 5 minutes' walk to Denistone train station and from there, it is 30 minutes on the train into Sydney. We are also handy to Sydney Olympic Park and Parramatta CBD. We are only a few minutes' easy walk from two supermarkets, shops, cafes and restaurants.
space: This luxurious one bedroom house is situated at the rear of our property in quiet Denistone in the Ryde area on Sydney’s leafy North Shore.  The House  Our house has a spacious living/dining room with views of the large garden, which is visited daily by native birds. You are welcome to sit and relax in the tranquillity of the garden - you won't want to leave! There is plenty of safe, free parking in the street. There is a full kitchen with stove, microwave, large refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster and dishwasher as well as all the pots and pans, plates and dishes you need. The ensuite bathroom, which has vanity, shower, toilet, hair dryer and heated towel rail, also contains a washing machine and clothes dryer.  The large bedroom has one queen-size and one single bed and large wardrobes. Another two single beds are situated in the living room.  Quality bed linens, bathroom towels, beach towels all provided.  The house has a flat-screen television with Foxtel cable TV, free wireless in

neighborhood_overview: Denistone is a very leafy, quiet and safe suburb but it is close to amenities and transport. Lots of safe, free parking in the road.
transit: Five minutes' walking will bring you to either Denistone or West Ryde stations where regular trains will take you to Sydney CBD in 30 minutes. Good bus services will take you to Parramatta or Chatswood.
access: The cottage will be completely yours - no sharing! The cottage is in the garden behind the main house and access is easy.
interaction: We are around to answer any questions you may have about the cottage, or staying in Sydney.
house_rules: This is definitely a non-smoking property. Smoking inside the house will incur a cleaning fee of A$300.  Please try to avoid strong cooking odours. Minimum rental is 3 days. Long term rentals available on request, subject to negotiation. House must be left in clean condition or a cleaning charge of A$150 will be incurred. Internet usage is free, but please be fair and reasonable.
host_about: Hi, I'm Sue! My husband, Ian and I love to travel and we have stayed in some wonderful places around the world. We love to meet interesting people and welcome visitors to our cosy garden cottage.

name: Rose Bay - 10mins to CBD and Bondi
space: Large top floor 2 bedroom double brick art deco apartment with balcony, polished floorboards, chandeliers and freshly painted white walls in a small block of 12. New bathroom, fully equipped kitchen with gas stove and electric oven. Washer/dryer, dishwasher, coffee machine, grinder and plenty of kitchen utensils, great for dinner parties. $700 per week is market value for long term rent. (Go to (URL HIDDEN) Happy to waive usual premium associated with a short term stay. Manion Avenue is a quiet street in Rose Bay surrounded by Sydney Harbour, a golf course, Rugby playing fields and a 20min walk to Bondi, Vaucluse and Double Bay. You could practice your golf, go watch a rugby game at the East's rugby club, have lunch or dinner at two of Sydney's iconic harbouside restaurants, Pier and Catalina's. name: Harbour Views, Resort Facilities!
space: Welcome to Sydney! On offer is an oversized room in a conveniently located, spacious, bright and modern, fully-furnished security apartment within a landmark Sydney complex designed by reknown Australian architect, Harry Seidler. "The Horizon" is your inner-city oasis located in trendy Darlinghurst and a stones throw from the areas' famed cafes, bars and restaurants. The best Sydney has to offer is also at your doorstep.  Within Walking Distance: 5min to Kings Cross, Potts Point & Taylor Square/Oxford St. 10min walk to Woolloomooloo Wharf, Cook & Phillip Park Aquatic Centre, Hyde Park, Australian Museum and the CBD.  15min to Sydney Harbour, Art Gallery of NSW, Botanical Gardens, Surry Hills & Rushcutters Bay. 20min to the Opera House, Museum of Contemporary Art, Chinatown and Paddington. name: Live like a local
summary: Live like a local in our renovated terrace house in trendy inner Sydney. The place is located at the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane. Perfect location for anybody wanting to see what Sydney has to offer!
space: The bedrooms are not big, but have built-in wardrobes. It has a window with a pleasant outlook and blinds, warm bedding, bedside lamps and power points. The bedroom is up a narrow flight of stairs with the bathroom downstairs, so if you have a small bladder and a hip replacement, it might get uncomfortable during the night. Bathroom is new with a rain shower and 'bath' made out of tiles. We'll leave some toiletries for you. There's a lounge room at the front with bookshelves, sofas and a little desk and a new deck with table and chairs at the back. There's wireless internet, a printer for tickets etc, a dishwasher in the kitchen, and washing machine and clothesline. Transport:  The best and easiest way to access the property from the Airport is via Uber. Usually this takes (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) min depending on traffic and costs approx $25AUD total. (Hidden by Airbnb) maps has full transport route and time details for travel in Sydney Parking:  Unfortunately the apartment doe
description: Live like a local in our renovated terrace house in trendy inner Sydney. The place is located at the crossroads of Surry Hills, Paddington and Darlinghurst in a quiet lane. Perfect location for anybody wanting to see what Sydney has to offer! The bedrooms are not big, but have built-in wardrobes. It has a window with a pleasant outlook and blinds, warm bedding, bedside lamps and power points. The bedroom is up a narrow flight of stairs with the bathroom downstairs, so if you have a small bladder and a hip replacement, it might get uncomfortable during the night. Bathroom is new with a rain shower and 'bath' made out of tiles. We'll leave some toiletries for you. There's a lounge room at the front with bookshelves, sofas and a little desk and a new deck with table and chairs at the back. There's wireless internet, a printer for tickets etc, a dishwasher in the kitchen, and washing machine and clothesline. Transport:  The best and easiest way to access the property from the Airport is vi
neighborhood_overview: The terrace is in a leafy lane and very quiet but is steps from 3 of our favourite suburbs: Surry Hills, Darlinghurst and Paddington. We spend time in Surry Hills for our hipster fix, restaurants and groceries; Darlinghurst for bars and the new Eternity Playhouse theatre and Paddington for people watching, shopping and the local bottle shop.
notes: The convenient location comes with strict parking inspectors, so let us know beforehand if you're thinking of bringing a car. We have a short 'manual' for the house and detailed directions for your arrival - both will be sent to you upon confirmation. If this sounds like what you're looking for, please get in touch. We look forward to meeting you. Anna
transit: Aside from the beach, we rarely have reason to venture more than a few blocks from the house for shopping, restaurants, cafes, bars, parks and friends.  It´s a half-hour walk through Hyde Park to the business district and a 15 minute (hilly) walk to Central Station. Buses to the beaches go from around the corner: ~20-40 minutes depending on which beach you choose and the traffic. Our favourite is Bronte. You can also walk to Bronte in just over an hour through gorgeous Centennial Park.  There are lots of GoGet pods if you're a member and we're very well serviced by Uber (their app sometimes thinks our street's one-way, so you might want to walk outside and meet them on Hannam St a few doors down)
access: The house will be set up as-is, with clean linen on the bed, towels etc. It's fully furnished and filled with our things, but we're not cluttery people and we'll make room in the wardrobe and bathroom for your things.
interaction: We won't be here but we'll leave plenty of instructions and the phone number of a friend.
house_rules: - Treat the house with respect - No smoking - No pets - No parties - We'd be very grateful if you watered the houseplants and herbs occasionally!
host_about:
Hi. I'm Anna. 
I'm a Sydney-based doctor who loves to travel.
I also host in Sydney with my boyfriend, and we love having interesting visitors here enjoying our neighborhood. As hosts, we have plenty of recommendations for you, but will otherwise be pretty hands-off. We're at the work most days, and enjoy cooking dinner at home. Looking forward to speaking to you, Anna.

name: Bronte Beach Glamour + Serenity
summary: Opposite a lovely park in one of Sydney's most delicious beach side suburbs, this art deco apartment is filled with sunshine and fresh air. Guest room is bright, secure and private, looking out to a (Hidden by Airbnb) , close to public transport, so many beaches, cafes, and shops. Book for a few weeks or months and really enjoy this beautiful area. We've had great feedback from all our previous guests.
space: This charming two bedroom apartment in one of Sydney's most coveted suburbs right by the sea is safe, cosy, freshly painted with modern bathroom and kitchen, and timber floors. Airy and light filled with large windows, it is located close to lots of fast public transport, beautiful beaches, cafes, restaurants, yoga and lovely Centennial Park. The guest room offers privacy, security and warmth; features timber floors, excellent double bed, fast internet and a gum tree outside the window. It's a ten minute walk to Clovelly or Bronte Beach, and you can follow the coastal walk to Bondi or Coogee.

Guest room is bright, secure and private, looking out to a (Hidden by Airbnb) , close to public transport, so many beaches, cafes, and shops. Book for a few weeks or months and really enjoy this beautiful area. We've had great feedback from all our previous guests. This charming two bedroom apartment in one of Sydney's most coveted suburbs right by the sea is safe, cosy, freshly painted with modern bathroom and kitchen, and timber floors. Airy and light filled with large windows, it is located close to lots of fast public transport, beautiful beaches, cafes, restaurants, yoga and lovely Centennial Park. The guest room offers privacy, security and warmth; features timber floors, excellent double bed, fast internet and a gum tree outside the window. It's a ten minute walk to Clovelly or Bronte Beach, and you can follow the coastal walk to Bondi or Co
neighborhood_overview: Our little village has lots of very good restaurants and cool cafes, corner store, hair dresser, chemist, florist, doctor, laundry and bars within an easy walk, fresh ocean air, lots of trees, close to city but away from the racket and rush. Spectacular coastal walk to Bondi and other beaches, swimming and snorkelling, relaxing. Terrific yoga school just over the road. Gordon's Bay is one of my favourite local swimming spots. It's a five minute walk to Bronte road with all its restaurants and supermarket, and Bondi Junction shopping centre is 5 minutes away on the bus.
notes: I don't really do one or two nights. Several weeks or months suit me better. This is a two bedroom apartment to share with me. I'm busy and like to maintain a harmonious domestic space. The guest room is well insulated and you can be completely private or share a cup of tea when the desire arises. Some guests spend their entire stay in their room. Others like to chat. I'm easy either way. I recently acquired a kitten. He is very shy, house trained, and knows he is not allowed in the guest bedroom.
transit: Heaps of fast buses, and trains to all parts of Sydney just ten minutes away at Bondi Junction. I cycle everywhere - it's just 20 minutes into town through beautiful Centennial Park. There is a bus shuttle to the door to and from the airport which is only $20
access: Our security building of only 6 units has a front entrance one minute from the bus stop, and back stairs down to the shared garden. The apartment is absolutely secure. The park directly opposite is filled with colourful birds and possums, with a glimpse of the ocean.
interaction: I value and respect privacy but I'm always happy to chat or share a meal. I'm very busy so guests have a lot of free time in the flat without me. I love to cook and share meals. Happy to help you with any information about places to go all over Sydney, and even travel across Australia. I'm a writer/filmmaker who also works in the environment sector. I am also a travel writer and have had many adventures in some of Australia's most remote and beautiful places. I know a lot about Australian Aboriginal culture, and Sydney's history, and have extensive connections to Sydney's music, art and literary circles.
house_rules: Please note the cleaning fee is for the room once you leave. Although I maintain high standards, your contribution towards household cleaning is greatly appreciated. There is no maid! One thing I really don't like is dirty dishes in the sink. It's important to keep the kitchen clean and clear.
host_about: Your hostess is a well known Sydney writer/filmmaker who was a high profile film critic/arts feature writer with Australia's high end newspapers, magazines, and ABC radio and television before moving into the environment sector. Last year she finished work on a book about Aboriginal Art and has just shot a doco in Myanmar.

name: Balmain Beautiful Family Home
summary: We put a lot of thought into the design of our home and fortunately we love it. It has 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, exposed concrete ceilings, decked outdoor space, and water views. Perfect for a family holiday.  PS. We have a new dining table to the one shown in the pics - a vintage Danish design that extends to seat 10.
space: Our home was designed by award winning Sydney architects MCK and other than the facade (built 1905) it was completely renovated in 2011. The design is both beautiful and functional.  Comfortably fits 6-8 people. Features Include: - Water views - Unique contemporary architectural design - Suitable for children (we have 2 boys aged 5 and 8) - Secure front and rear gardens - 3 good sized bedrooms downstairs with 1 very comfortable 'Sealy' double ensemble, 1 solid single bed and 1 double Aerobed (Platinum pillow top if required) -1 large master bedroom upstairs with a very comfortable 'Sealy' Queen ensemble bed - Spacious, open plan living areas with exposed concrete and water views - Hydronic underfloor heating (gas heated hot water) - Modern kitchen with concrete and stainless steel benches - Induction cooktop, oven, and dishwasher (Miele) - Internal landry with washing machine and dryer (Miele) - Spacious  ground floor bathroom with bath and shower - Indoor and outdoor dining areas - Sp

neighborhood_overview: Balmain is a charming 'inner west' suburb of Sydney surrounded by water. It is popular for its proximity to the city (3 km), shops, cafes and restaurants along the main street (Darling St) and its village feel. A lot of young families who still want to be amongst cafes and good shops choose to live in Balmain and there are numerous parks and playgrounds.
notes: The house is located on Vincent street which overlooks the water (White Bay) and is a 2 min walk up to the main street. It has unmetered 24 hour street parking and there is a lovely children's playground a minute from our door. A short 10 min walk away you will find Mort Bay and Ballast Point parks along the water. Both have beautiful picnic grounds, play equipment, walking/jogging pathways along the foreshore.
transit: You can walk into the village or into the city or catch a bus along Darling st - they come every 5-10 mins. We have a 'Go get' share car in our street.
access: Balmain is 3km from the city and close to Sydney's other main attractions. It has direct access to the city by ferry or over the Glebe Island bridge (5 mins by car or bus, and 35 mins walking/cycling); great access to the lower north shore suburbs and beaches (such as Mosman and Balmoral beach) over the Harbour bridge; and to the Eastern suburbs (such as Bondi) via the Cross City tunnel (5 mins to Paddington and Darlinghurst).
interaction: I am happy to be in text or email contact as much as you like. Feel free to text if you have any queries e.g. if you can't work out how to use something.
house_rules: Please keep in mind that this our family home and not an investment property. So we can provide a glowing review and not claim on the security bond please treat it with care and respect as you would your own or a friend's home. Main rules: No parties or functions without prior approval from us in writing - drinks/ dinner parties with the guests staying of course fine No smoking in or outside  No pets in or outside the property Ideally remove your shoes when inside  and no shoes upstairs in car petted areas Leave the fridge clean and empty! Put garbage out and sort into correct recycling bins Min stay 1 week Enjoy your stay!
host_about: I teach yoga and meditation, and enjoy weekends at our beach house in Killcare on the central coast. I have lived in Chile, Germany and Singapore so I can speak some German and Spanish if it can help out. We have 2 young boys.

name: Tranquil Beach & Bush Cottage + Backyard Studio
summary: If you want to explore Sydney's nature and still be close to the city, this is the place! A few minutes from pristine Long Reef beach and marine conservation area, and the cafes of Manly and Dee Why, you can walk or cycle to the beach or  Narrabeen Lake bushland. For bright lights, get the bus to the city. Surf or swim at Sydney's best beaches then come back and relax surrounded by birds in this peaceful retreat with plenty of room for the kids to play.
space: Relax in this 2 bedroom character cottage plus modern one-bedroom studio with a sunny outdoor entertaining and garden, with a vegetable garden, worm farm and BBQ, you'll enjoy chilling in the backyard in between surfing, swimming and bushwalking. The modern kitchen and 2 bathrooms, dishwasher and laundry, vegetable patch and trampoline are all for your use. We can also supply a surfboard or 2 on request. For music lovers, there's a piano and guitar, and plenty of books to read in the bookshelf, and some board games! WiFi is also available, TV with access to a large number of digital stations, and an off-road car space. Wildlife commonly seen in the backyard includes Kookaburras, Cockatoos, Lorikeets (parrots), Red Parrots, wattle birds, blue tongue lizards (harmless!) and more. Transport nearby includes the bus to the city (about 30 - 40 minutes), plus you can walk or bike to Long Reef, Dee Why or Collaroy Beaches, and Narrabeen Lake - all around 20 - 30 minutes walk, 10 minutes by bik
description: If you want to explore Sydney's nature and still be close to the city, this is the place! A few minutes from pristine Long Reef beach and marine conservation area, and the cafes of Manly and Dee Why, you can walk or cycle to the beach or  Narrabeen Lake bushland. For bright lights, get the bus to the city. Surf or swim at Sydney's best beaches then come back and relax surrounded by birds in this peaceful retreat with plenty of room for the kids to play. Relax in this 2 bedroom character cottage plus modern one-bedroom studio with a sunny outdoor entertaining and garden, with a vegetable garden, worm farm and BBQ, you'll enjoy chilling in the backyard in between surfing, swimming and bushwalking. The modern kitchen and 2 bathrooms, dishwasher and laundry, vegetable patch and trampoline are all for your use. We can also supply a surfboard or 2 on request. For music lovers, there's a piano and guitar, and plenty of books to read in the bookshelf, and some board games! WiFi is also availab
neighborhood_overview: Collaroy Plateau is a green area with lots of trees and native birds, and national park and beaches nearby. If you're lucky, you'll spot native brush turkeys in the street as well as the beautiful King Parrots.  Collaroy Plateau is a quiet family area, but it's great location is catching on with film producers and media celebrities moving into the area. It's also close to bars, great food and coffee, and there's an Art Deco cinema just a short walk away. Dee Why is a 20 minute walk and Manly a15 minute drive. There's a great, character-filled Indian restaurant a short walk up the road, as well as plenty more restaurants a short walk - great Italian, Asian fusion and a pub. Tell us what food you like and we'll tell you the best food around! Cycling is also a good way to get around provided you can ride up hills! If you'd like to hire a car, let us know and we can help organise it.
notes: Ask about discounts for weekly and 2-weekly stays!
transit: There's parking on the street and a bus stop with buses that take you to Dee Why and Sydney city centre only 5 minutes walk.
access: You'll have access to the whole house and backyard, assuring privacy. we'll ensure there's someone on hand to help you out if needed.
interaction: We'll be away, but we have a friend who will be available for help and questions. We're also available by phone (free call).
house_rules: Given we live here, we expect guests to use only items as agreed and specified in our listing, and take the usual care they would as with their own house to avoid damage etc. If you have young children, the backyard is great place to play and is enclosed. They may still need some supervision, as there are a few high steps and places they could hide! It's a great garden for adventures and running about though. The front yard is not, and we ask children don't play there. This is a non-smoking house, and while pets are allowed, it's expected they'll spend most of their time out in the big backyard. This is a great house for families - note that there are 2 sets of around 4 stairs going into the property, and if you have an inquisitive toddler, things may need to be moved out of their way! Note that water is valuable in Australia, so please use water, particularly for baths and showers, sparingly where possible.  We are conscious of the environment, and have a worm farm for your scraps. We
host_about:
I love nature - walking, cycling or just being. Generally, when I travel, I come with my husband, Glen, and sometimes our son, Alex. We are all very much into the outdoors, peace and wildlife. 
At the same time, we enjoy great food and different cultural experiences. Glen and I lived and worked in Vietnam together, and I've lived in a few other countries, including Canada, the UK, Malaysia and Austria.
Alex is a very well-behaved well-travelled boy (not just saying that!), who has been with us to Europe and South East Asia. 
We all have itchy feet and love to travel and meet different people and experience different cultures, whether near home or far away.

name: Rose Bay Beautiful Home
summary: This newly renovated modern and totally private 2 storey eco friendly house is walking distance from the hustle bustle of Bondi but set at the end of a cul de sac where you can hear birds chirping and see the sun shining . Our beach style home makes you feel like your on holidays around the clock. Walking distance to Bondi, Bondi Beach, Rose Bay village, Rose Bay ferries, buses at the end of the street to Bondi Junction. This house is very comfortable all year round, every room has fans however they are not really needed as we have the perfect cross breeze in every room as it is an eco friendly design to match the seasons. Ideal for familys to come and stay. However we would like to request no children under 10 please.
space: This unique house has all the comforts you can ask for whilst caring for the environment at the same time. There is off street parking for up to 3 cars. There are 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 1 play room, 1 balcony upstairs and a study, T.V room, open plan lounge dining kitchen downstairs . There are 2 sets of bedding per room, towels, beach towels for everyone. there is Netflix and Stan and free to air in both the T.V room and the master bedroom. Computer and WIFI, Large BBQ, undercover outdoor entertaining area which includes a lounge area , table and chairs. All rooms overlook a private park, if you rise early enough you can catch the sun rise right outside your bedroom. We have private access to this unique park which is very kid safe and adult friendly if you are the sporty type. Great house to relax in away from all the action as its so quiet you can almost hear a pin drop at any time of the day
