Newly refurbished, fully self-contained and sunny, the Cottage features a main room (including kitchenette), bedroom, bathroom, laundry facilities and private outdoor courtyard and grassy front lawn with new energy efficient Air-conditioning. On the Harbour The Cottage is located on the famous Manly to Spit Scenic Walkway, with Manly about 30 minutes’ walk away (or five minutes
neighborhood_overview: We live next door and try to be good neighbours. We will meet you when you arrive and make sure you find every thing you need to enjoy your time in the cottage. If you need any thing feel free to pop over and ask us other wise we will leave you to your own devices.
notes: We have free parking on the street in you need it.
transit: At the top of our street we have bus stops - aprox 250m away. There you can get a bus in peak hour to the city or during the day you can get buses to manly or to our local mall. There is also a free community bus that also stops here and will take you around the local area. We also have the Park and ride bus that you can pay for and will take you around the local area - this needs to be booked and paid for before using.    If you walk to the main road - Sydney Rd aprox 10 mins you will find a wider more frequent range of buses going up and down the beaches and also to manly or to the city .  We are a 25- 30 minute walk to the manly Ferry along the famous manly to Spit scenic walkway - one of the prettiest walkways in Sydney. Take a short detour and pick up a coffee along the way from 40 beans to enjoy. Most guests think they will take the bus but end up finding they enjoy the walk so much they use this more.
access: Guests have private street access to the cottage through there own front gate. The courtyard and grass lawn in front of the cottage are your private garden to enjoy. We have a fence around the cottage to keep it private for you and for us.  When you need to empty the rubbish and recycling please come through the side gate to use the large rubbish bins in front of our house.
interaction: We live next door and try to be good neighbours. We will meet you when you arrive and make sure you find every thing you need to enjoy your time in the cottage. If you need any thing feel free to pop over and ask us other wise we will leave you to your own devices.
house_rules: The Ranger’s Cottage – Terms & Conditions 1.The cottage is let to you for holiday or residential accommodation purposes only and for the period confirmed via email (minimum stay three nights). 2.Check in is from 2:00pm on the date of arrival or as otherwise agreed via email. 3.Check out is by 10:00am on the date of departure or as otherwise agreed. 4.The quoted nightly or weekly rate is for accommodation for 1 or 2 people in king bed or two single beds (in the single bedroom).  A maximum of two additional guests can be accommodated on a double sofa bed in the main room.  An additional service fee of $25 per person per night applies above 2 guests.   Should a cot be required a service fee of $25 per stay will apply.  Please specify guest numbers and special requests when booking.  Note: meals are not provided but the cottage is equipped with a kitchenette.  A welcome breakfast basket and variety of condiments will be provided at the commencement of your stay. 5.All prices quoted are sub
host_about:
Our family of four had outgrown our previous home and my husband and I had both grown up in New Zealand surrounded by plenty of open space.  So when the opportunity presented itself to acquire this property we jumped at the chance.

We love the proximity to the bush and the beach and call it our enchanted corner of Sydney.  We're removed from the bustle of Manly yet close enough that we often enjoy a family walk along the harbour foreshore for hot chocolate and waffles at our favourite cafe.

While the main house that we live in is still in need of some TLC, we've spent a year transforming the Ranger's Cottage and surrounding garden into what we hope you will agree is a lovely retreat. We're planning to squeeze into it when we get around to renovating the main house, but in the mean time we're very happy to welcome guests, both familiar and new.

My husband and I both share a strong service ethic and I have a background in hospitality. We love creating environments in which people can enjoy themselves, whether that means leaving you to your own devices (the cottage is completely detached from the main house) or helping you feel right at home,

What else about me: I like to collect vintage things and enjoy a spot of baking so you may find yourself the recipient of cookies or cakes during your stay. During the warmer months you might find me first thing Swimming laps along our local beach.

We have two great young boys who enjoy riding bikes exploring the bush and keeping an eye out for the native wildlife.  We also enjoy going to the aquarium, wildlife world, zoo and museums in the city.  

We're looking forward to meeting you!

name: Harbourside Apartment in Sydney
summary: Fully-equipped 2 bedroom, 1-bathroom apartment in a 3-floor waterfront building of 7 apartments in beautiful Birchgrove on the Balmain peninsula.   Fantastic harbour and city views with ferry wharf only 100 metres from the front door..
space: The apartment is on the top floor with access to a large rooftop deck which gives a 360 degree panorama of Sydney harbour and surrounds.  A lovely path and stairs lead down to a private waterfront garden. KITCHEN The kitchen includes stove/oven, fridge, microwave, kettle, cutlery, toaster, crockery and all the basics for self-catering.  There is no dishwasher (yet!). There is a Weber charcoal BBQ on the waterfront at the bottom of the garden.  Charcoal is not supplied and can be easily obtained from the supermarket. BEDROOMS Bedroom-1 contains a queen-size bed and Bedroom-2 has 2 single beds that can also be reconfigured into a king-size bed.   All bed-linen is provided and plenty spare towels, sheets, blankets, quilts, pillows.   Ample wardrobe, hanging space and drawers. LIVING/DINING ROOM The living room has a leather lounge plus 2 armchairs, TV, DVD, IPod dock, Pay-TV, telephone, inkjet printer, wired and WiFi internet.  Internet and local telephone calls are included free of charg

house_rules: This is a small block with mostly long-term residents.  Your courteous respect for their privacy and amenity is expected.
host_about:
Welcome!  I am a semi-retired owner of an IT business and my wife, Cathy, is a physician.

We both enjoy traveling and have had plenty of adventures in Europe, North America, the Middle East and Asia.  

Our passions are golf and cycling.

We live on the coast about an hour south of Sydney and have listed our Sydney apartment with Airbnb and, also a private apartment attached to our home in Wombarra.   The apartments are used mostly by friends and family and we welcome Airbnb guests with verified profiles at other times to share the beauty of Sydney harbour and the near south coast..

name: The Biggest Bed in Sydney + Parking
summary: A stylish, centrally located apartment that really does have the biggest - and most comfortable - bed you will sleep in. Minutes from Sydney's Downtown area and only 400 meters (430 yards) from Redfern Station which gives fast access to all of Sydney. The Opera House and Harbour Bridge are both an easy 40 minute walk, or ten minutes on the City Circle train from Redfern.
space: Welcome to the United Nations of Redfern! In the past four years, we have welcomed people from every continent (except Antarctica!) Please note. If you are booking for January 14 or January 21, 2018 the checkin time is midday, not 10am.  We have hosted Muslims, Jews, Hindus, Christians, Buddhists, atheists and probably other faiths. All have been welcomed, and everyone always will be at my place. Very GLBTI-friendly. Very straight friendly too! During these times when the world is on edge, travel is a wonderful way for people to connect. From the pictures of the bedroom, it's hard to gauge just how big that bed is. It really is the biggest bed you will see. It's 230cm x 205cm or 90.5" x 81". Huge and comfortable. Downtown is on your doorstep! From the rooftop herb and flower garden, you can watch the sun set over the city to the immediate north. The proximity to the city is one of the key reasons why people choose my apartment, and we installed double glazing and heavy drapes to create

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Redfern, one of the oldest areas in Sydney. CBD, Harbour Bridge, and the Sydney Opera house are just 10 minutes away on the train. Two railway stations are easily accessible within three blocks.
notes: We provide tea, coffee (with your own espresso machine), cereal and fresh milk for your breakfast. Please cook! The pantry is also well stocked with spices, rice and pasta, oils, tinned tomatoes etc.We are happy to make this  available on an honesty system - feel free to help yourself but please replace what you use. No need to replace oils, spices etc if you use the last of the container. Just leave a note of what to stock up on again!  We want to make your stay effortless.
transit: In 10 minutes, you are in the CBD, 20 minutes to Darling Harbour, 50 minute comfortable stroll along George St to the Harbour Bridge (I never get tired of riding across that!)  or The Sydney Opera House (up there with Empire State, Big Ben, and the Eiffel Tower as amazing architecture which defines a city!) Free parking is on offer, but please ask BEFORE BOOKING, as I share between two apartments. If no one has already requested it, it is yours at no further cost!
access: Living Room:   LCD TV & DVD/BluRay with good selection of quality movies    Hi speed wireless Wifi     Tastefully & comfortably furnished     Large King Furniture chaise longue style sofa for comfortable relaxing and viewing Kitchen:    Dishwasher     Fridge/Freezer     Microwave     Oven/grill     Espresso machine     Crockery, cutlery, utensils, pots, pans etc. Bedroom:    Hotel quality bed, bigger than a King size, with deep, comfortable latex mattress     Linen, pillows and towels included     Large built-in wardrobe with drawers available for my guests Bathroom:    Full bath, and shower    Towels included     Hair dryer Laundry:    Washing Machine and Dryer     Clothes rack     Iron and ironing board
interaction: The apartment is offered in its entirety. You have the whole place to yourselves! Keys are left in a secure safe for guests who arrive at different times in case my cleaner and I are not around. I try and meet all of my guests at some stage of their stay, as I feel that is is an important aspect of being a host. As well as providing an apartment, I want to welcome you to my city.
house_rules: This is a lovely, friendly building. All I ask is that you respect my home, and my neighbours with some simple guidelines:  This is a smoke-free building. Please don't smoke in the building or on the balcony. You can smoke on the rooftop terrace if you take your butts down to the garbage. Respect the space and the things in it.  Please don't use illegal drugs in the house.  Please don't invite visitors (strangers) into the apartment - although friends are welcome to visit.  No overnight guests except those registered in advance.  Please be courteous and kind. Hosting requires a good relationship with my neighbours. Please talk quietly in the hallways and in the apartment. When moving in and out, please be aware of the noise of bags on wheels on hard surface as you maybe arriving early or departing late, and going past my neighbours' bedrooms. The apartment building is quiet, with nice neighbours,so please be respectful of them with noise. If you need assistance, please contact me - not
host_about:
I (Paul) am a psychotherapist which  is fascinating in terms of the wonderful clients and staff with whom I work.  I spent 12 years as a university lecturer and another 10 doing research on sexuality and gender, having come to academia late after running a manufacturing business, driving trams in Melbourne (a job a STILL have great dreams about!) and a wasted year in a clothing factory after high school. 

Raymond works as an analyst in government and corporate media, a field he has been involved in since graduation. After his honours year, he spent the best part of the next year backpacking around the world. Every continent covered.... except Antarctica. So that's on our mutual Wishlist!

Meeting guests - especially those visiting Australia - is like having a little holiday without leaving Sydney as we get to hear what their home countries are like. We manage to meet over 80% of our guests to welcome them to town! And this is the best part of being hosts with Airbnb. We have also been really lucky to meet a lot of other local hosts, managers from the San Francisco head office, and the wonderful, warm and friendly staff at the Sydney office. Paul was also asked to speak on the SuperHost panel at the inaugural Airbnb Open in November of 2014 and we both attended the Paris Open in 2015. It was really thrilling to be included with such passionate, professional hosts talking to a huge room full of excited people. 

We have traveled extensively including staying in hotels, hotels, on the beach, and latterly in Airbnb homes. So we really know what makes for a good stay. It's both a pleasure and an honour to have folks stay at here, especially international guests who are traveling around this lovely country.

We have three great apartments, close to the centre of Sydney, available as the entire place for up to four guests. We do not stay when guests are staying - you have the whole apartment to yourselves.

Redfern is an original area of Sydney, featuring some of the oldest homes dating back to the 18th and 19th centuries. Prince Alfred Park is nearby, and the city itself is on the other side of that. You can literally walk to town in under 10 minutes, and it is well supported with public transport to all parts of the city only a four blocks from the front door.

name: Charming & Comfy in Annandale - 1
summary: Nice and charming space close to the centre of Sydney.  Walking distance to water view, parklands, shops and public transport.  Sydney University, Sydney Fish Market, Glebe, Newtown and Leichhardt are just a few minutes away.  Cafes and restaurants are abundant in the area and the suburb is a quiet village that have easy access to other parts of Sydney. We enjoy hosting guests and have met hundreds of Sydney visitors and our aim is to make their stay just like home.  Come and share with us.
space: Welcome to Annandale! Please read through the entire listing carefully before booking this room as it will answer most of your questions and I'd like to share with you all aspects of the room, not just a pretty picture. If you have any questions please ask before booking the place. Due to high demand for Christmas and New Year period, between Dec 20 to Jan 15, the minimum booking period is 4 nights. The Location:  Close to the city of Sydney CBD, located near the heart of Annandale village, walking distance to shops, transportation and water-side recreation, this century old 3 bedroom established house features high ceiling, timber floor, nice living space and a charming deck that leads to a little backyard with a fish pond that has some goldfish in it. It isn't a newly built mansion, but a comfortable home that carries a great vibe. Transport:  One minute walking distance to the bus stop, 15min bus ride into the city, 30min from the airport, a bus takes you directly to Coogee beach. 3

The Location:  Close to the city of Sydney CBD, located near the heart of Annandale village, walking
neighborhood_overview: Annandale is a charming area based in the Inner-West of Sydney, the village features some heritage listed architectures, cafes & restaurants, and is very close to the City, Glebe, Newtown and Sydney University. 10min walking distance you get to the bay at the foot of ANZAC Bridge or you can go explore areas like Leichhardt & Balmain which is all fairly close.
notes: We recently adopted two kittens, so now we have a house with cats.  If you are allergic to animals and dislike pets in the house, this place isn't the right fit for you.  Please be very mindful with the kittens as they will want to get out the house at any given chance and / or making discoveries, trying to get into your room, under the bed to have a play, or they might follow you asking for a hug.  If you think any of the listed behaviour can cause some inconvenience to you and your stay, please do not book the place.  We just discovered that feeding two kittens is like taking two small babies, it involves work on our end, and understanding on the guests' end.  Please do not feed the cats as they follow a particular diet and don't let the cats run out as they are still small and can get lost, attacked by larger birds and/or hit by a passing vehicle.  If you think you can live with two tiny friend in the house who are generally clean and cute, we believe the kittens can also bring you
transit: One minute walking distance to the closest bus stop, where you'll get two buses, 15min bus ride to central and the other bus takes you to Coogee Beach. Bus comes around at 15min interval during peak hours and 25min interval off peak. You can also walk 10min to Parramatta road where there's a selection of about 8 buses that goes into the City or western suburbs of Sydney. There is a light rail station within 10min walking distance and you can take a light rail into the City on a 15min ride that goes through Fish Market, Darling Harbour and China Town eventually Central. You can get here from the airport either by train then bus (45min) or Taxi (25min). In terms of parking, you'll get plenty of street parking free of charge 7 days a week.
access: Please be mindful that this isn't a hotel or serviced apartment. It's a sharing house where you get your own rooms. Furnitures and other items not listed in the profile are private property (e.g. Piano, books & albums etc), please ask if you wish to use them.
interaction: Me and my partner Julie live in the house, unless we go on vacation or travel for work we'll be around most of the time so don't hesitate to ask if you need any directions, suggestions as to place to visit, things to see. I have been hosting for some time now both with AirBnB and through other platform, we enjoy meeting people and the general feedback we get is that guests love the place and our hospitality. We look forward to your visit and hope you enjoy your stay in Sydney.

host_about:
Easy going, optimistic, spontaneous, creative and adventurous person. After former corporate life that propelled me to explore what life has to offer outside of what many people see as an attractive 'career path', I have been happily living an unconventional life experiencing it to the full.

I'm quite active, I love ocean swimming, riding my motorbike, go hiking, skating or long walks to enjoy the outdoors. I go dancing from time to time (tango or salsa) and I channel a fair bit of energy through my creative outlet in photography. I love to travel, even though I haven't been to nearly as many places as i wished to, but each and every travel experience brings immense joy, learning and friendship that I value. 

I enjoy meeting people, I especially love spending time with those who are positive, easy going, adventurous, open minded and passionate in following their dreams.

Recently i have swam the English Channel (yes UK->FR) and am now working on my next challenge (and a few of them too :)

name: Bronte Charm by the Beach!
space: Welcome to Bronte! 1 bedroom in a charming house in desirable Bronte beach locale in walking distance to the beach and local trendy cafes. 1 breezy bedroom, quality linen provided with an en-suite bathroom. Also feel free to use the kitchen for breakfast! Bronte: Bronte is a hilly, quieter, and more relaxed alternative to Bondi with equally stunning views. It tends to have a village and a community feel, but make no mistakes, there is a café scene here too around the picturesque beach. Bronte Beach: Bronte is a pretty and green beach, equipped with barbecuing facilities and popular with families, spread out across the parkland that provides much needed shade on a sunny day. The surrounding district is rich with refreshment facilities for those with no respect for a Great Aussie Barbecue. Great place for an outdoor party or sports event. Easy to reach by public transport or car (expect parking space to be extremely limited on a sunny weekend). More popular with loca

host_about: I love Bronte's beach lifestyle and adore my two grandchildren. I enjoy hosting friends and hopefully you'll be one of them.

name: Private Airy Room with Bush Views & Big Pool.
summary: Big airy room with windows on 3 sides. Lots of light, bush views looking out to Allambie. Plenty of storage space in wardrobes. TV with free to air channels Fan Hairdryer available in bathroom  Main Queen size bed + Single & pull out bed. Desk and chairs Use of Pool
space: Welcome! Large eclectic artistic style home with the biggest private saltwater solar heated pool in Beacon Hill. Every bedroom has a double bed, and we also have 2 twin share rooms. Large room with very comfortable queen size bed, fitted with full length mirrors wardrobe and draws for storing your luggage. Linen and towels included. Tv  Large shared bathroom with shower, toilet and drawers for storing your bathroom items. Couples or friends sharing are welcome: the overnight rate is per person. Guest bathroom is a large shared bathroom with a lock on the door. There are 3 bathrooms / toilets in the house total. We allow small fridge space for our guests. Prepared dinner most nights included in the price + available on request. Meet our other guests and enjoy the conversation. We provide a real fire in winter, a huge pool for summer swimming. Uniquely we offer a freshly prepared dinner around the family table when required. Location The house is located 22km north of Sydney CBD in a pre

neighborhood_overview: local beaches including Dee Why, Curl Curl, Freshwater, Manly. Walking distance to Westfield Warringah Mall. Safe green area. Also close to French's Forest Parkway Conference centre.
notes: *no children under 12 allowed *We are not responsible for any air carrier delays, missed flights or rescheduling of your flight, travel plans or accidents .  We do not owe you any refund for booked nights missed due to your airline or travel complications.  Please look to your travel insurance agent to cover this.
transit: buses to City, Manly, French's Forrest & Chatswood. bus stops within 5 minutes walk  (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  Ferry connects to city from Manly. Nearest train station Chatswood.
access: pool and garden areas tv / dvd / lounge / kitchen / clothes washing machine / free street parking
interaction: We are here for support if you need us, but we also respect your privacy.  We are normally around to answer questions and offer advice if required.
house_rules: We appreciate that many people are in Australia to enjoy Sydney,culture and English language. We expect that people would speak English in communal areas. We offer a typical Australian home stay experience where people of many cultures interact and help each other. We offer a pleasant home stay , where we serve dinner around the dinner table almost every evening if required. No photoshoots, commercial filming, or wedding events without prior arrangement. Light self serve breakfast is included. Lunch, or takeaway picnic lunch is NOT included. There are local supermarkets, McDonalds & cafes within 2km walking distance.  As it is home stay we expect help with simple duties like drying dishes or dishwasher. Be respectful of our home, other guests , pets, and waste recycling .   Smoking is allowed , outside only.
host_location: Beacon Hill, New South Wales, Australia
host_about:
We are friendly, easy going, love to cook, love meeting people from other countries.
creative type people: art therapist, furniture renovation & upcycling furniture.
we both love to read, catch up on tv, walk the dogs, socialise with friends and family, and travel.
We have enjoyed hosting many people from many countries.
We will help orientate you around the local area, and transport system, entertainment, attractions, walks, sport and events in Sydney.
We are 30 minutes from Manly by bus, and 50 minutes by bus from the city centre. 
We are 35 minutes away from Chatswood on the bus.
The bus stops are 5 minutes walk away. 
We have previously hosted many wonderful guests of all ages.
